loans.name: Ana Dayssi

texts.es: Ana Dayssi S. M. vive en Zacatecoluca ubicado en el departamento de la Paz, Dayssi tiene 24 años de edad está acompañada con Willian y tienen un pequeño niño de 3 añitos llamado igual que su padre Willian. La pequeña familia vive en casa de madre de Willian padre. Dayssi  se dedica a su negocio que es una tienda con productos de consumo diario y por las tardes hace venta de tortillas, Dayssi solicita este crédito, porque quiere surtir su tienda con variedad de productos que sus clientes le demandan.
texts.en:
Ana Dayssi S. Mejia lives in Zacatecoluca located in the department of La Paz, Dayssi is 24 years old and lives with her couple Willian, and their 3 year old son, named after his father, Willian. The small family lives at Dayssi's mother in law's house. Dayssi works at her grocery store and in the afternoon she prepares tortillas, Dayssi requests this credit, because she needs to supply her store with a variety of products that her clients demand.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia M. is from the city of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro. She is 30 years old. Olivia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Olivia owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables. Olivia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Olivia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Olivia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Olivia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Olivia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Songneang

texts.en:
Mr. Songneang S., 42 and his wife, Mrs. Chanthoeun Chea, 30 were married in 1997 and have two children: one son and one daughter. The eldest son attends school and the daughter is still young. The family lives along national road number one about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Songneang has been a security guard for a company for eight years. His wife has been selling food and dessert in front of the garment factory for two years. She buys ingredients from Korky market which is about 5 kilometers from her house. She is able to receive a gross profit of about $6.25 per day.

Songneang’s old motorbike doesn’t work properly, so he is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a replacement motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to replace the old one.

loans.name: Setra Bagam Group

texts.en: This is the Setra Bagam group, which is led by Setra Bagam. There are three members in this group. Each of the members wants to take a loan for his or her business. Setra Bagam wants to take a loan on behalf of her husband for his general store. Asmatullah also wants to take a loan for his general store. Mayku wants to take a loan on behalf of her brother for his vegetable and fruit shop. They are requesting a group loan 30,000 afghani. They are very happy for this loan opportunity in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For expanding general store

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam L. is from the city of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro. She is 34 years old. Meriam is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Meriam owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community.  They sell it thru peddling. Meriam and her husband peddle their fish using their motorcycle around the village. Meriam has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Meriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meriam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Meriam is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP, which will be used for capital and partly as a down payment for a motorcycle. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Meriam from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education and improvement of the house. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To add to her capital and to go to the downpayment of a motorcycle

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sokhai

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhai C., 29, was married in 1999. She has three children: two daughters and one son. Two of them are in school and the other one is still young. The family lives on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sokhai has been a silk weaver for fourteen years; it’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then take them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. She is asking for a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
"H. Trương Thị  (20203050042) is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 8-member group L. offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 08 (8).


H. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, H. owns & operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new L. of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The L. will be the first L. taken out by H. from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trương Thị L. (20203050043) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business iraising livestock.


2.  Trương Thị M. (20203050044) is a 20-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.


3.  Trương Thị S. (20203050045) is a 45-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.


4.  Cao Thị L. (20203050046) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  N. Thị N. (20203050047) is a 55-year-old female who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


6.  Nguyễn Thị D. (20203050048) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


7.  Nguyễn Thị T. H. (20203050049) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Trương Thị  (20203050042) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 08 (8).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trương Thị L. (20203050043) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Trương Thị M. (20203050044) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ T.ật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ.


3.  Trương Thị S. (20203050045) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ T.ật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ.


4.  Cao Thị L. (20203050046) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  N. Thị N. (20203050047) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


6.  Nguyễn Thị D. (20203050048) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


7.  Nguyễn Thị T. H. (20203050049) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng S. is 36 years old and his wife, Mrs. Noem Phany, is 25. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1998 and have two daughters. The eldest daughter is in school and the other one is still young.

Heng has been a full-time employee in a company in Phnom Penh since 2006. His wife has been a farmer since 1998. She grows many kinds of vegetables in her village, such as cucumbers, lemon grass, and ridye gourds. The couple want to repair and put additions on their house to protect it from rainwater but they don’t have the money they need. So Heng is asking for his first loan of $500 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To repair his house.

loans.name: Mareu Group

texts.en:
This is the Mareu Group, led by Mareu. There are two members in this group and they want to takes a combined loan of 28,000 Afghani and want to expand their businesses.

Mareu wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store.

Muhammad Rafe wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring.

So the are happy that AFS and Kiva lenders can support all poor people.

loans.use: To support her husband's general store

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es: Silvia Lorena M. T. vive en Zacatecoluca  ubicado en el departamento La paz. Silvia tiene 27 años de edad. Silvia tiene pareja pero por motivos económicos él se encuentra  fuera del país y le ayuda con remesas mensuales. Silvia se dedica a su negocio que es una tienda con productos de consumo diario y ahora se ve en la necesidad de solicitar este crédito por que quiere surtir su negocio, ya que carece de productos que sus clientes le demandan. Anteriormente Silvia ha obtenido otros créditos, los cuales ya cancelo y fue muy puntual en todas sus cuotas asignadas.
texts.en:
Silvia Lorena M. T. lives in Zacatecoluca located in the department of La Paz. Silvia is 27 years old. Silvia has a couple but because of the economic situation he is out of the country and helps her with monthly remittances. Silvia works at her grocery store and now she is requesting a loan because she wants to stock her business, because she is missing some products her clients demand. Silvia requested other loans before which were all paid on time each and every quote.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her business

loans.name: Seiha

texts.en:
Mrs. Seiha M. is a 49 year old widow with two sons and two daughters. Her two sons have had full-time employment as drivers in a company in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, for two years. Her daughters attend school. The family lives in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Seiha has been selling food in her village for five years. She is able to earn a gross daily profit of about $2.50. Her old house is broken in some parts and it’s difficult for family members to stay. She is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon E. is from the town of Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, she manages a beach resort in the town. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP. This previous loan was used as capital for a variety store in her resort. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to use as additional capital. This loan will be her 4th HSPFI loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to provide for her family's needs.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her variety store.

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.en:
Tunzala was born in 1974. She is married. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region and is now settled in Khirdalan town.

This kind woman sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for eight years. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fruits and vegetables to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline A. is from the City of Carmen, Cagayan de Oro. She is 49 years old and married with eight school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a food stall selling snacks, viands, and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell so she can generate a much higher income. This loan will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ. 3. Trương Thị T. (20203050075) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Trần Thị M. (20203050076) là 22 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en:
Elpedio O. is from the city of Ramon Chavez, Cagayan de Oro. He is 48 years old. Elpedio is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Elpedio owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from processing and selling pork products in the local community, particularly pork longganisa and tocino. Elpedio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from this work.

In 2008, Elpedio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. He became a member in order to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Elpedio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Elpedio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make his food products for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Elpedio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for his food-selling business

location.town: Ramon Chavez, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
Shakir is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, now settled in Sumgait town.

This man was born in 1960, is married and has two children. Ten years ago he started his taxi business. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts for his taxi to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Abdul Jalil Group

texts.en:
This is the Abdul Jalil group. Led by Abdul Jalil, the group is made up of five members, each of whom would like to obtain a loan to improve their businesses:

- Abdul Jalil wants to take out a loan for his flower shop. - Shellah would like to request a loan for her tailoring business. - Shakaba would like a loan to apply toward her her bead-working. - Anufa hopes to receive a loan for her husband, who sells cigarettes from his cart. - M. Osian wishes to obtain a loan for his cloth-selling shop.

Togther, they hope to expand their businesses with this loan of 70,000 Afghani. They are happy to have the opportunity to apply for a loan that helps support entrepreneurs in this way.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses

loans.name: 03 - Đông Hải Group

texts.en: Hằng T. Thị (23) is a 24-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 3 Đông Hải (16.01.003). Hằng is married and has an infant child. To making a living, she owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month. In 2008, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,120,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Hằng is now requesting a new loan of 1,626,900 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her second from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Lê Thị Việt (28) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 1,626,900 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. 2. Đỗ Thị Hồng (37) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 1,626,900 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. 3. N. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 1,626,900 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma E., 52 and married with one adult-aged child, is from the city of Ramonal, Cagayan de Oro where she owns and operates a mini-restaurant (carenderia). The main source of income for the business comes from serving local foods to customers in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over seven years, earning approximately 12000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to invest in expanding the business, Wilma is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to invest in further expansion of the business. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Ramonal, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20203050083), a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh, is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 15 (15).

T., married and the mother of two adult-aged children, owns and operates a handicraft business whose main source of income comes from selling wood handicrafts to tourists and local community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over seven years, earning approximately 2.000.000 VND a month.

T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan, her first from SEDA, of 5.152.000 VND to invest in expanding the business. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Trương Thị A. (20203050084), 52, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. Trương Thị Dư (20203050085), 46, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.

3. Trương Thị T. (20203050086), 21, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.

4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050087), 45, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5. Trương Thị L. (20203050088), 42, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

loans.name: Razeu Group

texts.en:
This is the Razeu group, led by Razeu. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants takes a loan for her business.

Razeu wants to take a loan for the business of knitting.

Sakena wants to take a loan for the business quilt-making.

Raema and Tahera want to take a loan for the business of carpet-weaving.

So they are requesting a group of loan 56,000 Afghani and they are very happy about this small loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita S. is from the city of Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro. She is 44 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children.

To make a living, Anita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not her only means of generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling vegetables. Anita has engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services, to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase products to sell.

Anita is requesting a loan of 11000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family income.

--------------------------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase new items to expand product offerings.

location.town: Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Oyuntogtoh

texts.en:
Oyuntogtoh O. lives with her husband and three children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her two sons are students in a local high school and her husband looks after his one-year-old infant daughter at home.

Oyuntogtoh has a small business in clothes-making. She started her business in 2006 using her old sewing machine at home. She mostly sews various women’s clothes by request of her customers. Since the start in 2006, her business has done well and her business capital has increased from 100,000 MNT to 500,000 MNT (100,000 MNT is approximately $70).

As for the expansion, she now rents a work place for her business. In the future, she hopes to have her own work place, instead of paying high rent. She requests a loan to purchase raw materials such as various cottons for her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as various cottons for her business

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Tungalag Z. is a single mother with two children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her 11-year-old daughter is a student in a local high school and 6-year-old son goes to a local kindergarten. Tungalag has a small retail business in women and men clothing. She started her retail business in 2003 by importing cheap clothing for women and men from Ereen, China. Ereen is a popular destination for cheap products in China. Since it is the closest border town, many small Mongolian vendors import cheap products to Mongolia. She rents a small stall in Tsahiur shopping mall. Since the start in 2003, she has done quite well; her business capital has increased from 300,000 MNT to 750,000 MNT. In the future, she hopes to create saving accounts for her two children to ensure her children's future. She aims to put aside some of her profits for her children's savings. She requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen for her business.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and bricks.

loans.name: 27 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Phượng Lý Thị is a 47 year-old woman who lives in the town of Thanh Hóa. She is the group leader of a four member group operated by theThanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Each member of the group receives an individual loan, but is responsible for paying back the entire loan if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Phượng is married and has two school aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business in the food sector, running a food stall. While not her only means for generating revenue, the main source comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Phượng has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1.600.000 VND a month.

In 2009, Phượng joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Phượng is requests 1.626.900 VND to purchase products to sell. The loan will be her first loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Phượng plans to use the revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: Purchase products to sell.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela L. is from the city of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro. She is 32 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Carmela owns and operates a specialized retail store. Carmela has engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Carmela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Carmela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase a transport vehicle. Carmela is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to expand her business. This loan will be the fourth taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to pay for a motorcycle and support the needs of her family.

--------------------------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Amam Group

texts.en:
This is the Amam group, led by Amam. There are five members in this group and they would like to expand their businesses. They are requesting a group of loan 50,000 Afghani.

Amam wants to receive a loan for his general store.

Zakara wants to receive a loan for her bakery.

Parwe and Khare Gul wants to take a loan for their husbands who have fruit and vegetables shops.

Najeba wants to take a loan for the business of a clothes-selling shop.

They are happy about this process of loans that can support the entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To support his general store

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
"T. Trương Thị is a 51 year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a five member loan group offered by SEDA. Each member of the group receives an individual loan and is responsible for paying back the entire loan if someone is delinquent or defaults. The name of this group is Ô Cách 11.

T. is married and has three adult aged children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business in the agricultural sector raising livestock. While not her only means of generating revenue, the main source comes from raising cattle for sale. T. has engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month.

T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services, to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. is requesting her first loan from SEDA of 5.152.000 VND to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. T. plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Hoàng Thị L. is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 2. Trương Thị T. is a 37 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business. 3. Trương Thị Trà is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business. 4. Nguyễn Thị M. is a 20 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam ---------------------------------------------- T. Trương Thị (20203050067) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 11 (11). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND. T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Hoàng Thị L. (20203050068) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Trương Thị T. (20203050069) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 3. Trương Thị Trà (20203050070) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 4. Nguyễn Thị M. (20203050071) là 20 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: Purchase livestock feed and supplies.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz M. is 56 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of eight children. Her father's hard, demanding character showed her, from the time she was young, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life.

Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cows. With the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. Solmaz asks for a loan of 1200 USD in order to buy more calves to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment Solmaz will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her family's quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Tamella

texts.en:
Tamella B. is 53 years old and married with four children. She has been running her own small business for 18 years. She built a store in the local market where she sells different kinds of food such as candies, cookies, sugar, etc. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.

Tamella is very friendly and polite which attracts customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase a wider range of goods for her store. This will help her to provide for her children's needs and pay their school fees. Tamella promises to repay her loan without any delay and thanks everyone who decides to support her.

loans.use: purchase more goods for her store

loans.name: Aygun

texts.en:
Aygun P. is a 20-year-old single woman. She started her own business a year ago because her parents retired. To earn extra income for her family, Aygun sells confectionery items such as candies, cookies, and pastries at the local market.

Aygun dreams of building her own store one day. Today she requests 1200 USD to expand the range of goods that she sells at the market. Aygun will use the extra income from expanding her product selection to improve her family's living situation and for savings for that future store.

loans.use: purchase more goods to expand her range of goods

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen R. is from the city of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro. She is 31 years old. Helen is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: 32 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Quyên Ngô Thị is a 34 year-old woman living in the town of T. Hóa.  Quyên is the leader of a 4-member group which is accepting a loan offered by T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 32 - Nam Ngạn.

Quyên is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Quyên owns and operates a business venture in the service sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hairdressing & beauty services to local members of the community.  Quyên has run this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 Vietnamese dong (or about $84 US) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Quyên joined T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Quyên is requesting a loan of 1,626,900 dong (or about $91) from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She will use the loan, her first, to purchase materials needed to provide service.  Quyên plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.


About the other borrowers in the group:

1.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Tumur

texts.en:
Tumur S. lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His two children go to local high schools in Ulaanbaatar.  Tumur has a small retail business in women's cosmetics. He runs the cosmetics business with his wife. Tumur had worked as an electrician for Tulga Company for more than 15 years and in 2008, he decided to quit his job in order to pursue his own business. He frequently travels to South Korea to purchase women's cosmetics for his business. In the meantime, his wife rents a small stall in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, and sells the cosmetics that her husband brings from South Korea. Tumur and his wife hope to be financially able to set aside some money for their children's education. 
Tumur requests a loan for two purposes: to purchase more cosmetics for his business, and to buy bricks to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
M. Bakhtiyor is a very courageous man who is characterized as one who can manage tough jobs like raising livestock. He's the father of three children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, Bakhtiyor has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of animals to breed them on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Bakhtiyor comes to IMON International for a loan for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  cattle to develop his business

loans.name: Gulniso

texts.en:
K. Gulniso is a hard worker and a "person in charge"; she is married and has three children. Her husband receives a very low wage, not enough for all the expenses of his family. For that reason, Gulniso found it necessary to also enter the family business.

Gulniso began to sell foodstuffs in a little grocery store. This has been a fundamental piece in the growth of this business; together, they have managed to advance it. At this moment, Gulniso is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni that she will use in the extension of her business to be able to offer better service to her customers and to improve the looks of her store. Gulniso thanks you very much for the confidence and aid that you offer her.

loans.use: purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods she sells

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: C. Eng, 58, is a widow and earns a living by doing farming for only about US$ 3 per day. She has three children who are all employed in a garment factory with a daily income of US$ 3 each. After the years of hardship without modern equipment to do the farming, C. Eng wants to take a KIVA loan of US$ 1000 to buy a plow tractor to enable her to obtain better income generation by producing more output of rice on her own plots of farmland. If she succeeds in her business plan, she wants to hire more farmland and repair her house.

loans.use: buying a plow tractor

loans.name: Réhoboth Plus Group

texts.fr: Chantal a passé une bonne partie de sa vie dans la micro-entreprise. Elle s’est donnée corps et âme pour faire prospérer son activité malgré quelques étapes difficiles traversées. Elle a commencé le commerce en 1984 avec un capital initial de $50. De 1984 – 1990, la vente des vivres frais lui a procuré un capital de plus de $100 qui lui ont permis de diversifier l’affaire en y ajoutant une boutique générale. Celle-ci a prospéré de 1994 en 2000 lorsque Chantal connut un accident en route pour les achats de la marchandise pour sa boutique. Son hospitalisation pendant 4 mois causa une baisse sensible de son affaire. Après la convalescence en 2000,  elle décida de lancer un autre type d’activité, la vente des produits de beauté pour dames. Suite à l’expérience de la bonne gestion acquise depuis des années, Chantal parvint à réaliser en 2006, un capital propre de $500 qui lui ouvrit la porte à une petite usine de fabrication d’eau pure qu’elle monta jusqu’à ce jour. Compte tenu de son rêve d’ouvrir un jour une grande usine de fabrication d’eau pure afin de servir la population de son quartier qui en a grandement besoin, elle décida en décembre 2007 d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Réhoboth Plus » dans le but de renforcer financièrement son affaire. Chantal est une cliente fidèle de Hope qui a reçu plusieurs fois les crédits et les a remboursés totalement et à temps. Le crédit obtenu le mois de juin courant lui a servi à acheter 1000 paquets des sachets d’eau pure en vue de satisfaire le besoin de ses clients et ainsi accroitre le bénéfice. Actuellement, son capital propre est de plus de $500. Son activité génère $40 de bénéfice par semaine. Chantal est une dame âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 12 enfants âgés de 4 à 24. Onze d’entre eux étudient.
texts.en:
Chantal has spent a good deal of her life working in micro-business. She has put body and soul into her business's prosperity despite difficult periods. She began a business in 1984 with an initial capital of US$ 50. Between 1984 and 1990, the sale of fresh foodstuffs brought her up to a capital of US$ 100, which allowed her to diversify her business by adding on a general store. This also prospered from 1994 to 2000, at which point Chantal was in a traffic accident as she was out buying goods for her store. Her hospitalization of 4 months caused a noticeable diminishing of her business.

After her convalescence, in 2000, she decided to undertake a different type of business, selling beauty products for women. Since she had acquired so much experience in business management over the years, Chantal was able to accumulate a personal capital of US$ 500 by 2006, which allowed her to open a little factory for pure drinking water that she maintains up to today.

In view of her dream of one day opening a big factory making drinking water so as to serve the population of her neighborhood, which has great need of this product, she decided in December of 2007 to join one of the groups of Hope RDC called « Réhoboth Plus » with the goal of increasing her business's financial base. Chantal is a faithful client of Hope and has received several loans, reimbursing them completely and in a timely manner.

The loan she has received in this month of June allowed her to buy 1000 packages of bags of pure water so as to satisfy the needs of her customers and thus increase her profit. Presently, her personal capital is more than US$ 500. Her business generates $40 in profit per week. Chantal is a 41-year-old woman, married and the mother of 12 children from 4 to 24 years of age. Eleven of them are enrolled in school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 1000 packages of bags of water for resale

texts.en:
B. Rustam is a very responsible and optimistic person; he has two children and a wife whom he has to support. Rustam wishes to develop his business. This business consists of raising cows in his village because there is a very high demand for milk from villagers and especially from customers who come from enclosed towns.

Rustam is helped by his wife. He is currently faced with many problems because his children are growing and, accordingly, their expenses are growing, too. The only way to get out of this difficulty is to succeed in business, so we hope that his capabilities and the services provided by IMON International will help him improve the business.

loans.name: Vosid

texts.en:
A. Vosid is 45 years old. He is married with 4 children. Vosid is running his own café where he cooks shish kebab. His café is located in one of the markets of Istaravshan town. He has been in this business already for 8 years. On average he serves 20-25 customers a day. His wife and daughter help him with the business.

Vosid is trying to use only the best ingredients in his café. Thus the business is stable and brings in considerable income for the family. Vosid requests 800 US Dollars to purchase meat and charcoal for his café for cooking shish kebab. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time. Vosid wants to thank everyone who is supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing meat and charcoal for his café

loans.name: Sevara

texts.en: G. Sevara is a young lady and a devoted daughter who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Two years ago she had an idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for her business. With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of the animals she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 3,000 Somoni. Be an important part of the growth of Sevara’s business. loans.use: To buy young cattle to expand her business

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr: Emmanuel A. est un jeune homme de 27 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il est revendeur de chaussures à Lomé. Emmanuel désire avec ces fonds relancer son activité en s’approvisionnant de nouvelles marchandises afin répondre aux besoins sans cesse de la clientèle. Il exerce ce commerce depuis 3 ans et cette activité est sa principale source  de revenus.
texts.en:
Emmanuel A. is a young man of 27, married and the father of one child. He sells shoes in Lomé. Emmanuel wants to use this loan to get his business going again by buying new merchandise so as to respond to the never-ending demands of his clientele. He has been in this business for 3 years and it is his principal source of revenue.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing shoes for resale

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en: I. Dodo is 42 years old and the father of three children. His main work consists of breeding cattle. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. A very ambitious man, Dodo would like to buy a greater number of cattle, and to build a barn to house them, in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni for the realization of this project. When his dream is carried out, Dodo will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family. With your help this will be possible. loans.use: To buy cattle and young cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
Ilgar (his relative is pictured) is married and has three children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in Horadiz town. He was born in 1966.

Ilgar has been in the sheep-breeding business for six years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy twenty-three sheep for improving his sheep-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 23 sheep to improve his business

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en: Their education is the most important inheritance Mukaddas and her husband can give to their four, dear children. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband and children, she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenditures, and she would like a loan in order to increase their capital by increasing their production. Mukaddas and her family are waiting for your quick response. loans.use: To buy cattle and young cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Ravshankul

texts.en: T. Ravshankul is 25 years old and is married. Together with his wife they have two children. Ravshankul is a farmer who owns a plot of land in their village on which he grows different kinds of crops like wheat, potatoes, onions and other vegetables. He has been in this business since 2004. These crops are the main source of income for their family. To alleviate the hard physical labour and to expand the business, Ravshankul would like to apply for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en: T. Zafar is 40 years old and is married with four children. He has dedicated himself to his cattle-breeding business for the past five years. He purchases calves to raise them, fatten them, and then sell them or butcher them to sell the meat. His children are also engaged in this family business. Today, Zafar’s major need is acquiring young cattle for his business. For this reason he looks for support to IMON International, to buy more of the cattle that make his family’s sustenance possible. With your help Zafar can improve his family living. loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en: Y. Uktam is 50 years old and is married with three children. Since he was 40, Uktam has been working as a cook. After he had gained much experience he decided to run his own café. Certainly, he does not have sufficient funds for a private café, that is why he is renting one located in the central market of the city. In the café he provides various meals of the national and European cuisine. The business is profitable and Uktam hopes to open his private café when he has generated enough money for this. However, today, he needs to expand his business and wants to purchase additional tables, chairs and dishes. With this purpose in mind he requests $800. This is the first loan for Uktam and he thanks everyone for trusting him and promises to repay the loan promptly. loans.use: To purchase tables, chairs and dishes for expanding his café

loans.name: Suraiyo

texts.en:
Suraiyo is a married mother of two children. Her men’s clothing sales business has been a valuable source of income for her and her family over the past 10 years that she’s been in business. In a typical month Suraiyo makes about $200 in profit from the business. Suraiyo is a hard-working, polite and communicative entrepreneur. She has an attitude of service and loves being able to help her clients with their clothing needs. Suraiyo has requested a loan of 2500 Somoni to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her family. loans.use: Purchasing of new men's clothing for summer season.

loans.name: Mirsaid

texts.en:
Mirsaid M. is 60 years old, married, and has four adult children. For 14 years Mirsaid has been developing agricultural production on his land with the help of his wife and children. Now planning to sow potatoes on his land, he is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to purchase potato seed and mineral fertilizer for processing the land. You could play an important part in Mirsaid’s family's life; he deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hamrodjon

texts.en:
Hamrodjon O., married to an entrepreneur, has three children, the source of her inspiration and drive as she wants to give them a better life so that they can study and do well for themselves. She began her grocery-selling business seven years ago to help out her husband financially, beginning with only a few products, but her business has subsequently grown significantly. Hamrodjon would like a loan of 2500 Somoni so that she can offer a wider variety of products and continue to grow the business as clients are always asking her for new things. Hamrodjon and her family thank you very much for your support which will allow her business to expand and enable her to meet her goal of providing for her family.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods offered for sale.

loans.name: Sodikjon

texts.en:
T. Sodikjon is a 50-year-old married man who lives with his four children and wife and owns a cattle-breeding business. Sodikjon has 16 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Sodikjon has become a very successful businessman. Sodikjon has a friendly family who are always try to help each other. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing. Now Sodikjon wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. So, Sodikjon applied for a loan of 4600 Somoni. He thanks all lenders for their support. With your help, Sodikjon can get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 47 years old and lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children. Khaled has been selling fruits and vegetables for over 23 years. He has requested a loan of US$700 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables for his work. This is the first time that Khaled has requested a loan.

Khaled is unique because he sells a wide variety of merchandise in his business. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he faced some funding obstacles but decided to proceed because he had a good reputation on which to build a business. He plans to improve his business further in future.

loans.use: Khaled will use the loan to purchase fruits and vegetables for his work.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 25 years old and lives in the Bekaa. Ibrahim has been working as a car electrician for three years and has requested a loan -his first one- of US$1300 US from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his work.

Ibrahim is a particularly special businessman because he is very punctual. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the necessary startup capital to purchase all the tools he needed but decided to continue anyway because he needed to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business further.

loans.use: Ibrahim will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is 24 years old and lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Adel has been working as an aluminum distributor for four years and has requested a US$1500 loan -his first loan- from A. Majmoua to do some maintenance work on his van.

Adel is a particularly speciA. businessman because he is very punctuA.. His main clients are aluminum stores. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties and decided to set up this business based on his good reputation as a worker. He plans on improving his business further in future.

loans.use: Adel will use the loan to do some maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en:
Rajaa is 25 years old and lives in the Bekaa. Rajaa has owned and run a mobile phone shop since 2006. She has requested a US$1500 loan - her first one- from Al Majmoua to purchase mobile phones and accessories.

Rajaa is a committed and hardworking businesswoman whose clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties and plans on expanding her business further in future.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 43-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband. Siham has owned a grocery store since 2005 and requested a loan of $1000 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Siham has requested a loan.

Siham is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients who are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, her store wasn’t well located, being a bit far from other markets. Siham decided on doing her work because of her financiA. need. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock of goods.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 43-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their five children. Sonia has been working as a seamstress for thirty-five years. She sews curtains, clothes and even wedding dresses. She also sells thread.

Sonia requested a loan of $1,600 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tissue, thread and accessories for her sewing. This is her fourth loan and she has always repaid on time. Her previous loans helped her purchase a new sewing machine and improve her work.

Sonia is special in her work because she does it well. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Sonia decided on doing her work because she learned it since she was young; she took after her father’s work. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase tissue, thread and accessories for her sewing

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mhamad is a 47-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Mhamad owns a small bookstore and also sells stationery and does bookbinding.

Mhamad requested a loan of $2,400 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new books for his library and some stationery as well. This is his fourth loan and he has always repaid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his work by diversifying and expanding his book choices.

Mhamad is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients who are his friends, neighbors and students. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. He decided on doing his business because there was no library in the locality and he thinks that it is important to have libraries. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase new books for his library and some stationery

loans.name: Nesrin

texts.en:
Nesrin is  22 years old and lives in Bekaa. She has owned a bakery since 2007. She bakes “saj”and “mankoucheh”. The “saj” is the metal oven where you bake the saj bread. A traditional Lebanese cooking dome is used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections or Mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza; the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Nesrin requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and raw material for her bakery. This is the first time that Nesrin has requested a loan. 
Nesrin is well known for her good and tasty mankoucheh. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and tourists. When Nesrin first started her business, she had some financial issues. She decided on doing her business because she wanted to improve her financial situation and she also wanted to have an independent job. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Nesrin will use the loan to purchase merchandise and raw material for her bakery.

loans.name: Noura

texts.en:
Noura is a 47 year old woman who lives in Bekaa with her husband and their four children. Noura has owned a grocery store since 2003. She also sells fruits and vegetables. Noura requested a loan of 2300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. Noura has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

loans.name: Arche De Noé Plus Group

texts.fr: Joséphine est entrée dans le monde de micro-entreprise à l’âge de 13 ans en 1985. Initiée par sa mère, elle a acquit une solide expérience dans la vente des poissons frais à Mbandaka dans la province de l’Equateur en République Démocratique du Congo. En 1994, son activité a produit un montant de $300 qui lui ont permis  de s’acheter un gros panier des poissons fumés qu’elle a revendu  à Kinshasa.  De 1994 – 2000, grâce aux bénéfices accumulés, elle a diversifié son affaire en y ajoutant des moustiquaires dont les gens avaient grandement besoin dans son milieu pour combattre la malaria. De 2001 à ce jour, Joséphine a reprit la vente des poissons qu’elle maitrise mieux. Des difficultés rencontrées dans son foyer en 2006 qui ont abouti au divorce avec son mari ont causé la baisse de son affaire. Joséphine est très encouragée par les crédits qu’elle reçoit de Hope RDC. Le prêt obtenu au mois de juin courant lui a servi d’acheter 2 paniers des poissons fumés qu’elle revend dans le but d’accroitre le revenu de son activité qui lui génère $30 de bénéfice par semaine. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une boutique ainsi qu’un dépôt du maїs et du manioc. Elle a 6 enfants âgés de 3 à 21 ans dont trois seulement vont à l’école. Joséphine aime son affaire car elle supporte financièrement son foyer.
texts.en:
Joséphine got into the world of micro-enterprise at the age of 13 in 1985. Taught by her mother, she acquired a solid experience in selling fresh fish in Mbandaka in the province of Equateur in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. In 1994, her business had allowed her to accumulate US$ 300 which let her buy a big basket of smoked fish that she sold in Kinshasa. From 1994 to 2000, thanks to her accumulated profit, she diversified her business by adding the sale of mosquito nets, which were very necessary for people in her area to combat malaria. From 2001 to the present, Joséphine took up the sale of fish, which she is better at. Difficulties in her household in 2006 led to a divorce from her husband and caused a drop in her business. Joséphine is very much encouraged by the loans she receives from Hope RDC. The loan she has obtained in the month of June allowed her to buy 2 baskets of smoked fish which she is selling in view of increasing the income from her business which generates US$ 30 in profit per week. Her ambition is to open a little shop and a maize and manioc depot. She has 6 children aged 3-21 of whom only 3 are enrolled in school. Joséphine feels good about her business since she is the breadwinner for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing 2 baskets of smoked fish for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer trabaja como transportista en el trufi 88 del Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa; el taxi que maneja  no está en buenas condiciones, por lo que ha decidido venderlo y comprar otro más nuevo, pues esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos y esposa.

Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la Zona Villa Dolores de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para la compra de otra movilidad en mejor estado para seguir trabajando.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Wilmer works as driver at the truffi 88 of the Eduardo Avaroa Union; the taxi he drives is not in good conditions, so he decided to sell it and buy a new one, because this activity is his main source of income to support his two children and his wife. He lives at his parents' house in the Villa Dolores in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy a new vehicle in better shape in order to keep on working. This is his third Impro loan, his good behaviour allows to approve another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new vehicle to keep on working as a taxi driver

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin trabaja como transportista en el trufi 88 del Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa tiene su movilidad propia, la cual es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos; la esposa se encuentra trabajando en la Republica de Argentina como costurera..

Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la Zona Villa Alpacoma de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para comprar un motor más nuevo para movilidad.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite la aprobación del   préstamo solicitado por el prestatario.
texts.en:
Edwin works as a driver in the “trufi” (a taxi with a fixed route) 88 in the Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa. He has his own car, which is his primary source of income to support his three children. His wife is working as a seamstress in the Republic of Argentina. He lives in his parents’ house, which is in the Villa Alpacoma zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy a newer motor for his car.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a newer motor for his taxi

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
