Epifania tiene un taller de cerrajería donde elabora ventanas, puertas y todo lo referido a metal mecánica; trabaja junto con su esposo y sus productos son comercializados en la feria popular de la Zona 16 de julio de El Alto. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus 4 hijos. Tiene su casa propia ubicada en la Zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto. 

El crédito lo destinará para comprar materia prima (fiero) para poder incrementar su producción.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Epifanie has a locksmith’s shop where she makes windows, doors, and everything having to do with metal works. She works together with her husband. Their products are sold in the popular fair in the zone, 16 de Julio, in El Alto. This business is their principal source of income that covers the cost of raising their four children. They have their own house, which is located in the Villa Ingenio zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy raw materials (iron) to be able to increase their production. This is her third loan with Impro. Her good payment history qualifies her for the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy iron for her business of making windows, doors, and other metal products

loans.name: Nuevo Atardecer Group

texts.es: El grupo “Nuevo Atardecer” esta representado por la señora Miguelina, Jenny y Dalia que son su presidenta, tesorera y secretaria. La mayoría  se dedican al comercio de venta de productos como refrescos, comida, cosméticos por catalogo y otros se dedican a la elaboración de chompas de lana y al servicio de enfermería. El M. tiene un alto nivel competitivo pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y a su fuerza de voluntada como lo demuestra la señora Silvia que a pesar de estar impedida para caminar realiza trabajos de tejidos que comercializa para sacar adelante a su familia. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición de  mercadería, materia prima e instrumentos de trabajo que ayuden a genera mayores ingresos y a mejorar la calida de vida de sus familias. A pesar de que el grupo es relativamente nuevo han demostrado entusiasmo, unidad y responsabilidad por lo que la fundación Agrocapital les brinda el apoyo económico que necesitan.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Atardecer group is represented by Miguelina, Jenny and Dalia; they are the president, treasurer and secretary. The majority of them sell products like soft drinks, meals, and cosmetics by catalog. Others make wool sweaters; some are nurses. The market has a high level of competition, but the group members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and personal strength. Silvia demonstrates this. In spite of not being able to walk, she knits and sells her knitting products to get her family ahead. The loan is to acquire merchandise, raw materials, and work instruments to help generate greater income and improve the quality of life of their families. In spite of the fact that the group is relatively new, they have demonstrated enthusiasm, unity, and responsibility for the Agrocapital foundation. Agrocapital offers them the economic support that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Max

texts.es:
Max es artesano y elabora mantas de vicuña para cholitas; trabaja con su esposa y ella comercializa el producto en las ferias populares de la ciudad El Alto. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la Zona Villa Bautista Saavedra de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para la compra materia prima (lana de vicuña e hilo) y de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Max.
texts.en:
Max is an artisan who makes vicuna blankets for little ones. He works with his wife, and she sells the product in fairs that are popular in the city of El Alto. This business is his principal source of income that covers the cost of raising their little son. He lives in a rented house located the Villa Bautista Saavedra zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy raw material (vicuna wool and thread). That way he can satisfy the demand he has in his market. This is his first lone with Impro. The completed evaluation shows that Max qualifies for the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vicuna wool and thread for his business of making vicuan blankets

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa es artesana, teje manualmente guantes de lana de oveja y alpaca que  comercializa en la feria artesanal de la Ciudad  de La Paz, el esposo es empleado publico y trabaja en la policía. Tienen 2 hijos que dependen de la pareja tiene su casa propia ubicada en la Zona Villa Progreso de la ciudad de El Alto. 

El crédito lo destinará para comprar material de construcción, ya que le falta concluir un cuarto que le servirá a uno de sus hijos.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Felipa is a craftswoman. She knits by hand gloves made from sheep’s wool and alpaca. She sells them in the handicraft fair in the city of La Paz. Her husband is a public employee, and he works for the police. They have two dependent children. She has her own house, which is located in the Villa Progreso zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy construction material since they have not finished one of the children’s rooms. This is her third loan with Impro. Her good payment history qualifies her for the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement, stucco, and sand to finish construction on a room for one of her children

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia trabaja en un salón de belleza de empleada por las mañanas y por las tardes está instalando un salón propio, pero aún le falta equiparlo; es madre soltera de dos hijos de 2 y 6 años de edad y vive en la casa de su madre ubicada en la Zona Villa Esperanza de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para comprar el equipo de su salón de belleza (dos sillas, blow dryers, peines, tintes) de esa forma podrá incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite la aprobación el  préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Claudia works as an employee in a beauty salon in the mornings, and then in the afternoons she works in her own salon which still lacks some equipment. She is a single mother with two children aged 2 and 6. She lives in her mother’s house in the Villa Esperanza neighbourhood of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy equipment for her beauty salon (two chairs, blow dryers, combs, dyes) so that she will be able to increase her income. This is Claudia's second loan with Kiva partner, Impro. Because she repaid her first loan responsibly, she has been approved for a second one.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy two chairs, blow dryers, combs for her beauty salon

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been working most of her life in the beauty industry. She absolutely loves her job. She works full time at her salon and is single mother of four children, who are 20, 18, 14, and 6 years old. 

Three years ago she had the opportunity to purchase the salon she now owns. She came to ACCION USA immediately and was able to get a loan to start her business. Elizabeth’s store is in a great location in a busy area, where she gets lots of foot traffic.  Elizabeth has one other employee. Recently, she has requested a loan for $6,000 to purchase new chairs, hair dryers and several other products to enhance her salon. 

She has been successful in her three years in business and has high hopes for her future. Her plans are to eventually expand her store and offer more services.

loans.use: Hair dryers, chairs and beauty products

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi tiene su salón de belleza en el sector de La Ceja en la ciudad de El Alto y tiene una empleada que  trabaja con ella y los fines de semanas por la cantidad de demanda que tiene emplea a otra peinadora más. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su pequeña hija de 7 años de edad. Deysi es madre soltera, vive en la casa de su madre ubicada en la Zona Llojeta de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para la construcción de un cuarto en la casa de sus padres y de esa forma podrá tener mejor comodidad en su vivienda.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para la aprobación del   préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Deysi owns a beauty salon in the La Ceja area of the city of El Alto. She has one employee. Because the salon is very busy at weekends, she employs a second stylist at that time. This work is Deysi’s main source of income, and with it she supports her 7-year old daughter. She is a single mother, and lives in her mother’s house in the Llojeta neighbourhood of El Alto. The loan will be used to add a room to her parents’ house so that she will be able to live more comfortably in their home. This is Deysi’s first loan with Kiva partner, Impro. She has been evaluated and approved for the amount of money she requested.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to add a room to her parents’ house

loans.name: Massandjie's Group

texts.en:
Massandjie, a single mother of three, has owned her own beauty salon since 1999. She learned how to braid hair from family members in Africa and later went to school to obtain formal training. Her work has inspired many of her younger family members to pursue the profession. 

She was successful with a small loan through ACCION USA to build her credit, and is now using a new loan to purchase more inventory. She specializes in hair braiding and extensions and plans to use her loan from ACCION USA to purchase more human and synthetic hair at wholesale, which she will sell to other salons for a higher profit.

Business is going well overall; there are expected ups and downs but Massandjie always perseveres. Like many entrepreneurs she works very hard and is always trying to grow and expand her business. She would even like to open a second location.

loans.use: Purchase human and synthetic hair for extensions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Professional image setter

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain trabaja como transportista en el trufi 88 del Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa tiene su movilidad propia; esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de su madre y dos hermanitos menores.

Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la Zona Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz.


El crédito lo destinará para comprar un motor para su herramienta de trabajo de esa forma seguirá trabajando como transportista.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite la aprobación del   préstamo solicitado por el prestatario.
texts.en:
Efrain works as a driver for the Trufi 88 route (a trufi is a taxi with a fixed route) belonging to the Eduardo Avaroa union. He owns his own vehicle. This work is his main source of income, which he uses to support his mother and two young children. He lives in his parents’ house in the Pasankeri area of La Paz. The loan will be used to buy a newer motor for his taxi so that he can carry on working as a driver. This is his first loan with Kiva partner, Impro. He has been evaluated and approved for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a newer motor for his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase building materials for facility expansion

loans.name: Nicolay

texts.es:
Nicolay joven emprendedor que trabajaba como empleado, poco a poco se está independizando formando su propio taller de arreglo de frenos y balatas para movilidades; vive con su madre y un hermano mayor. Esta actividad de auto mecánica es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su madre. Ellos viven en la casa de su abuela ubicada en la Zona 16 de julio de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para la compra materia prima (frenos y lubricantes) para su taller de frenos y de esa forma poder contar con mayor clientes.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Nicolay.
texts.en:
Nicolay is a young entrepreneur who used to be an employee. Little by little he is becoming independent with his new auto repair shop which specializes in fixing breaks and related pieces for automobiles. He lives with his mother and older brother. This auto repair business is the principal source of income of the household. They live in his grandmother's house, located in Zona 16 de julio in the city of El Alto. He will use the loan to buy supplies (brakes and lubricants) for his auto repair shop in order to increase his number of clients. This will be his first loan with IMPRO, which was approved based on his evaluation.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy brakes and lubricants for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Las socias del banco comunal “NUEVO PROGRESO DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”, están situadas en el distrito de Quispicanchis, en la comunidad de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco.

Las socias conforman un grupo de 12 miembros, las cuales alternan su actividades del hogar como amas de casa y el comercio minorista, muchas de ellas tiene sus pequeños negocios en la misma localidad, ellas venden comidas en el mercado central, también tiene tiendas abarrotes pequeños, venden frutas, chicas y diferentes artículos para el hogar, estas socias requieren el préstamo para poder invertir en sus diferentes negocios y así abastecerlos con mayor producto.

Nuestras socias agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank New Progress of Andahuaylillas (NUEVO PROGRESO DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS) are located in the district of Quispicanchis, in the community of Andahuaylillas, in the province of Cusco. The members form a group of 12 who alternate their household activities as housewives and retailers. Many of them have their small businesses in the same location. They sell food in the central market. They also have small grocery stores. They sell fruits and different household items. These members require the loan to invest in their different businesses and as such supply them increased production. Our associates appreciate and value the loan and agree to comply with the payment of their debts in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.en:
Mujeres Luchadoras (Fighting Women) is a committee which was started about two years ago following the end of another committee.  Several women in the neighborhood got together and decided to form a committee and it has gone well so far.  They don’t have any late payments and have group savings of over $400.  They work to help pay their loan payments.  The women that participate in this committee sell their wares in their neighborhood as well as in the center of San Lorenzo.  

Due to the economic crisis, several women changed payment plans in this cycle of the committee.  The average loan received by each woman is 530,434 PYG, which will be invested in the purchase of wares that will be sold in their respective commercial activities.  

1	Ysidora G.	Dressmaker 
2	Rossana V.	Massage therapist 
3	María G.	Grocery store 
4	María B.	Clothing sales 
5	Gladys R.	Grocery store 
6	Inocencia M.	Food and drink sales 
7	Beatriz M.	Clothing sales 
8	Dolly A.	Clothing sales 
9	Beatriz B.	Undergarment sales 
10	Carmen V.	Dressmaker 
11	Carolina M.	Clothing and undergarment sales 
12	Gricelda A.	Natural juice sales 
13	María D.	Food sales 
14	Sixta S.	Drink sales 
15	Andrea M.	Undergarment sales 
16	María D.	Bakery 
17	Romina M.	Undergarment sales 
18	Juliana A.	Dressmaker 
19	María A.	Clothing sales 
20	Claudia F.	Clothing sales 
21	Valentina C.	Dressmaker 
22	Zunilda R.	Undergarment sales 
23	Nancy G.	Grilled food sales

loans.use: Purchase stock sale in various businesses

loans.name: Felisa

texts.es:
La señora Felisa vive en casa de su tía con su esposo e hijos en la Calle Manuel Jofre de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que ella tiene es la venta de ropa, ella viaja y compra en cantidad y acomoda al crédito a todas las señoras que venden en la feria de la ciudad de El Alto, también vende a personas particulares. Con esta actividad ella mantiene a su familia; el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más mercadería y mantener su fuente de trabajo estable.

Felisa solicitó un préstamo a través de Kiva  en Abril de 2007 y pagó muy bien, por lo que  puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Felisa lives with her husband and children at her aunt's home on Manuel Jofre Street in the zone of Villa Nuevo Potosí in the city of La Paz. Her business is to sell clothing. She travels and buys in large quantities and sells on credit to all the women that sell at the market in the city of El Alto. She also sells to other individuals. With this commercial activity, she sustains her family. The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital, to buy more merchandise, and to have a stable source of income. Felisa requested a loan through Kiva in April of 2007 and paid punctually, so she can acquire a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business and sell it

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia cuenta con 23 años, vive en su casa propia, con su pareja por más de 4 años, con la que tiene un pequeño hijo. Desde los 18 años se dedica a la siembra y venta de café y de plátanos, actividad que heredó de sus padres, y que le complace mucho. Por ello, madruga diariamente para que a las 7.00am, con  el almuerzo preparado, enrumbe hacia sus chacras, algunas veces en compañía de su esposo, pero generalmente lo hace sola, ya que su esposo trabaja como albañil. Para Patricia todos los jueves de cada semana, son los días más arduos y complicados, puesto que tiene que preparar su carga de productos y muchas veces no encuentra cómo transportarlos. Pero pese a esas dificultades logra llegar al mercado de Santa Ana y Perené donde sus clientes la esperan muy ansiosos, ya que saben que los  productos que ella lleva, son de primera calidad, y eso la llena de regocijo, por lo que se esmera en atender bien a sus clientes, quienes durante estos años le han permitido obtener buenas ganancias para el sostenimiento de su familia. Este es el quinto ciclo de su banco comunal, ella se incorporó en el tercero, puesto que este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, donde viene demostrando puntualidad en todas sus cuotas programadas por su asesor de crédito. Con los mil quinientos soles que solicita plantea comprar fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus chacras de café.
texts.en:
Patricia is 23 years old and has lived in her own house with her partner and their child for more than 4 years. Since she was 18 years old, she has dedicated herself to sowing and selling coffee and plantains. She inherited this business from her parents, which pleases her very much. For this reason, she gets up every day so that at 7:00 am, with lunch prepared, she goes to her small farms. Sometimes she goes with her husband, but generally, she does it alone since her husband works as a plumber. For Patricia, Thursdays are the most difficult and complicated days given that she has to prepare her load of products, and many times she can't find the means to transport them. But despite these difficulties, she manages to get to the Santa Ana y Perené market, where her clients wait anxiously since they know that she brings high quality products. This fills her with satisfaction, and that's why she works hard to serve her clients well. Her loyal clients have allowed her to generate high profits to sustain her family during the past years. This is the fifth cycle of the community bank. She joined in the third since this is her third loan with MFP, where she has been very punctual in paying her installments with the support of her credit consultant. With the 500 soles that she is requesting, she plans to buy chemicals to fertilize her coffee plots.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 32 años, vive con su pareja en su casa propia, es madre de una pequeña de un año a quien le dedica toda su atención y cuidados. La siembra, cultivo y venta de plátanos y café, son las actividades cotidianas que realiza Betty por más de 3 años en las chacras que le prestaron sus padres y sus suegros hasta que obtengan sus propias tierras. Cuando era joven, tenía la idea de dedicarse al comercio de ropa, pero se enamoró de un agricultor y sus pretensiones cambiaron debido al amor que le tiene a su esposo, pues lo apoya en sus labores agrícolas, y con el paso del tiempo aprendió a amar cada uno de sus cultivos. Ahora, junto a su esposo, se han propuesto incrementar su producción y generar las ganancias suficientes para comprar sus propias chacras, pero mientras logran esa cantidad, también están procurando comprar un terreno en la ciudad, donde construyan una casa, con mejores comodidades para sus futuros hijos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos anteriores ha demostrado ser una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos y colaboradora con las actividades y acuerdos de su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucha gratitud y cariño porque le permitirle seguir trabajando. Con el dinero facilitado va a mandar a limpiar sus chacras de plátanos, así mismo, empezará a preparar la tierra en otras extensiones de terreno para sembrar en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Betty is 32 years old and lives with her husband in their own house. She is the mother of a little one-year-old girl to whom she devotes all of her attention and care. Planting, cultivating and selling plantains and coffee are the everyday activities that Betty has performed for more than three years in the fields that her parents and step-parents have loaned her until she can obtain her own. When she was young, she thought she would go into clothing sales, but she fell in love with farming and her aspirations changed because of the love she has for her husband, since she helps him with their agricultural chores, and over time she learned to love every one of her crops. Now she and her husband are proposing to increase their production and generate enough profits to buy their own fields, but while they are accomplishing this, they are also trying to buy some land in the city where they can build a house with better amenities for their future children. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. During her previous loan cycles she has shown herself to be a client who is very punctual in her payments, and one who participates in the activities and fulfills the agreements of her communal bank. She has a lot of affection and gratitude for them because they have allowed her to continue working. With the money provided she is going to take charge of cleaning up her plantain fields. At the same time she will begin to prepare the soil in other areas of the land in order to plant even more.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her plantain fields.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy sensata y precavida. Está casada, vive en su casa propia con el padre de sus 6 hijos, de los cuales, el mayor migró a otra ciudad y los menores están junto con ella apoyándola en sus trabajos agrícolas. Eugenia le tiene un sentimiento muy grato a cada una de sus plantas cafetaleras, porque gracias a la buena atención y a los cuidados que les brinda logró realizar buenas cosechas que le permiten cubrir la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. Se le levanta muy temprano por la mañana para preparar el desayuno y el almuerzo de sus hijos, quienes al regresar del colegio acuden a cuidar de los cultivos de sus padres, mientras tanto Eugenia y su esposo trabajan en las chacras de sus vecinos desde 8.00am hasta las 6.00pm por un pago diario de 12 soles a ella y 15 soles a él. A pesar de cumplir con su trabajo para sus vecinos, no descuida sus propios cultivos, pues se organiza y delega funciones a cada uno de sus hijos, ya que quiere que aprendan el trabajo y valoren el dinero que se obtiene con esfuerzo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo (3 años) se ha ganado el aprecio, cariño y respeto de todos los integrantes de su banco comunal, debido a su responsabilidad y a sus acertadas opiniones durante las reuniones del grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para agilizar la maduración uniforme del café, de ese modo podrá cotizarlo a un mejor precio en las próximas campañas de cosecha.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a sensible and cautious woman of 40 years old. She is married and lives in a house that she owns with the father of her 6 children. Her oldest child has migrated to another city while the younger children help her with her agricultural work. Eugenia is glad for her coffee plants, because thanks to her attention and care, they have given her good harvests, which have paid for the education and feeding of her children. She rises early in the morning to prepare breakfast and lunch for her children. When they return from school, they help to take care of the plans. Meanwhile, Eugenia and her husband work in their neighbours’ small farms from 8am until 6pm for a daily wage of 12 soles (about 4 US dollars) for her and 15 soles (about 5 US dollars) for him. Although Eugenia and her husband work for their neighbours, they don’t neglect their own plants. They delegate specific tasks to each of their children, so they can learn not only how to farm but also the value of money that is obtained through hard work. This is her fifth loan with MFP. Over the last 3 years, she has gained the esteem, affection and respect of all the members of her communal bank, due to her responsibility and her wise opinions during group meetings. She is now asking for money to buy chemical fertilizers to speed up the even ripening of the coffee beans, so she can get a better price for her future harvests.

Translated from Spanish by Zev Lowe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer (Compra de fertilizantes)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: José

texts.es: José tiene 47 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 2 hijos. Es un hombre de campo muy alegre, cada mañana con machete en mano, acude a sus chacras de café y plátano, actividad que heredó de sus padres, y en todo este tiempo ha acumulado la experiencia necesaria para realizar determinados cultivos con excelentes resultados. Trabaja desde muy temprano, pero eso de la 11am se da un descanso de 2 a 3 horas debido al terrible sol, y a las 3 de la tarde retoma sus labores hasta que cierra la noche. José está muy contento con sus trabajos agrícolas, pero lo que más le gusta son las cosechas, porque le permita acumular el dinero necesario para el bienestar económico y el sostenimiento de su familia. Sus deseos de progreso a futuro los tiene puestos en la agricultura, y seguirá trabajando arduamente con miras de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, donde se siente muy cómodo y feliz por la organización de su banco comunal, cada uno de los ciclos anteriores los ha venido pagando puntualmente, y cuando hay algunas discusiones entre sus compañeros, es el primero en poner orden en el grupo. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
José is 57 and lives with his wife, mother, and 2 children. He is a very happy man of the country. Every morning with his machete in hand, he goes to his coffee and banana fields. He inherited this work from his parents, and in all of this time, he has accumulated the necessary experience to grow crops with excellent results. He starts working very early, but he takes a break at 11 am for 2 to 3 hours because of the terrible sun. At 3 pm, he returns to his work until nightfall. José is very happy with his agricultural work, but what he likes most are his harvests because they let him earn the money he needs for the economic well-being of his family. He has dreams of progress for the future, and he will keep working hard with the goal of reaching a better quality of life for his family. This is his fifth credit with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he feels very comfortable and happy because of the organization of his communal bank. He has paid back each one of his loans in a punctual manner. Whenever there are disagreements among his fellow members, he is the first one to bring order back to the group. With the money he is requesting, he will buy fertilizers for his coffee crop.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bendicion Group

texts.en:
The committee Bendicion has been together for six cycles.  The members live in the Reducto zone of San Lorenzo and have a group savings of 4,700,000 PYG, or almost $1,000.  All of the women are very responsible and hard working.  They have weekly meetings in which they share their preoccupations.  They have been working with the Fundación Paraguaya for two years.  

1	Luisa Elizabeth D..	Small grocery store
2	Maria Elena D..	General store 
3	Laura A..	General store
4	Justa A..	Food sales 
5	Olga G. F..	Food sales 
6	Rossana B..	Hair salon 
7	Julia G..	General store 
8	Maria Francisca A..	Fruit and vegetable sales 
9	Maria Francisca D..	General store 
10	Maria Agusta G..	Food sales 
11	Maria D. S. O..	Clothing sales 
12	Fatima F..	Diner 
13	Maria Elena A..	House wares store 
14	Mirtha O..	Clothing sales 
15	Tomasa R..	Small grocery store

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise for sale

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: El señor Juan Ramón C. , tiene la edad de 45 años, habita en el barrio San Caralampio en la comunidad de Ticuantepe , él es soltero , a su cargo tiene tres hijos , de 18 ,17 y 13 años , todos varones ; ellos estudian su secundaria y en tiempos libres ayudan a su papá , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Juan desde hace quince años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento a la vez la sequilla en ocasiones . Con el préstamo obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para obtener una buena cosecha y vender a mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Ramón C. is 45 and lives in the neighborhood of San Caralampio in Ticuantepe. He is single and has three sons, who are 18, 17, and 13. They are in secondary school and help their father in their spare time. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions. The biggest difficulty he faces is the lack of financing and at times drought. With this loan, he will buy fertilizers and supplies to produce a good crop so he can sell it for a better price at market.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive con el padre de sus 5 hijos, quienes son el motivo de sus diarios esfuerzos. Hace 20 años que se dedica a la agricultura, pero desde hace 8 años ha preferido especializarse en la siembra y venta de café porque le resulta más rentable en comparación al resto de productos, por ello atiende sus plantas de café quitando las malezas y abonándolas constantemente. Ahora Lucia está a la espera de la maduración del café, y cuando llega la cosecha, con su esposo e hijos realizan jornadas de competencias para la recolección de los granos. A Lucia le agrada mucho su trabajo, por ello contempla con paciencia sus siembras, las cuales le han permitido acumular dinero durante todos estos años para solventar la educación de sus hijos, y está convencida que poco a poco irá incrementado su producción y mejorando su calidad de vida. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante los cuatro ciclos pasados ha demostrado mucha puntualidad en cada uno de sus pagos y se ha ganado la confianza de los demás integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes la reconocen por su dinamismo en las actividades de su organización. Lucia invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de plantitas de café para renovar sus próximos cultivos en chacras nuevas.
texts.en:
Lucia is 39 and is a very hard-working woman. She lives with the father of her 5 children, who are her motivation for her daily work. She has worked in agriculture for 20 years, but for 8 years she has specialized in harvesting and selling coffee because it is more profitable than other crops. She attends to her coffee plants, weeding them and fertilizing them often. Now Lucia is waiting for the plants to mature, and when the harvest arrives, her husband and kids compete against each other to pick the beans. Lucia enjoys her work a lot, which is why she contemplates her harvests with patience. They let her earn money to pay for her children's education. She is convinced that her production will increase little by little and improve her quality of life. This is her fifth credit with Microfinanzas Prisma. During her four previous loans, she has been very punctual with her payments, which has earned her the confidence of the other members of her communal bank. They know her for her dynamism in the organization's activities. Lucia will invest her money in the purchase of young coffee plants to renew her next plantings in new fields.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coffee plants

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 34 años, está felizmente casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en su casa propia. Es una esposa y madre muy amorosa, que también trata con mucho cariño a sus cultivos, puesto que sabe que con dedicación y atención le resultarán muy favorables. Diariamente madruga para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, quien regresa a desayunar, después de trabajar muy temprano en sus chacras. Pero a eso de las 9.00am ambos regresan a continuar con las labores agrícolas, Maria nos comentar que cada día le da gracias a Dios por sus chacras y sabe que con su bendición sus tierras son muy fértiles. Ella se siente muy orgullosa de ser agricultora, por lo que emplea todas las técnicas que ha ido aprendiendo con el paso de los años. Sus productos (café y plátanos) los comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Lima, donde según la variedad, vende a 6 soles cada kilo, acumulando mayores ganancias, lo que le permite avizorar un mejor futuro a base de sus cultivos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos pasados ha pagado responsablemente sus cuotas, y del mismo modo hace compromisos de hacerlo esta vez. Los dos mil doscientos soles que viene solicitando los va invertir en la compra de plantitas de café y de plátanos morados para incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Maria is 34 and happily married. She has 4 children and has her own home. She is a very loving wife and mother and also treats her crops with a lot of care. She knows that with dedication and attention, they will give her favorable results. She gets up very early every day to make breakfast for her children and husband, who comes home to eat breakfast after working very early in the fields. Around 9 a.m., they both go out to the fields. Maria tells us that every day she thanks God for her fields because with his blessing, the land will be very fertile. She feels very proud of being a farmer because she employs all of the techniques that she has learned over the years. She sells her products (coffee and bananas) at the markets in Lima, where according to the variation in prices, she can sell them for 6 PEN per kilo. She is earning better profits, which let her visualize a better future. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. During her previous loans, she has been very responsible with her payments. In the same way, she promises to be responsible this time. She will invest the 2,000 PEN that she is requesting in the purchase of young coffee plants to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coffee and banana plants

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 30 años, vive en su casa propia que hace poco tiempo terminó de construir con su esposo, tienen un solo hijo de nombre Javier. La actividad que realiza es la venta de productos comestibles de primera necesidad, por lo que desde las 6.00am es posible encontrarla realizando la limpieza y arreglo de su local con mucho esmero, además de conversar con cada uno de sus clientes y vecinos que pasan por su bodega, puesto que sabe que gracias a ellos genera ingresos para su hogar. Los 3 años que lleva en este negocio le han dado la experiencia y paciencia de cómo tratar a sus clientes, y espera en adelante incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que ofrece. Maritza considera que lo más dificultoso de su trabajo es cuando llega la fecha del vencimiento de algún producto que no terminó de vender, y esto le ocasionan pérdidas, pese a ello, aprecia mucho su negocio, y aunque no adquiere muchas ganancias por el momento, ya ha obtenido varias amistades con las que puede conversar, que es lo que más le gusta. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, durante el ciclo pasado tuvo voluntad de pago y nunca cayó en mora, debido a que ella previene con anticipación sus cuotas señaladas, asimismo, se siente muy feliz y a gusto con la organización de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar los productos de primera necesidad de su bodega
texts.en:
Maritza is 30 and lives in her own house that she and her husband recently finished building. She has only one son, Javier. She earns her living selling basic food items, so she can be seen at 6:00AM cleaning and fixing up her shop with great care. In addition, she talks with each and every customer and neighbor that passes through her grocery store, since she knows that it's thanks to them she can earn the income for her household. Maritza treats her customers with the experience and patience she has gained in her three years in this business. She hopes to increase her inventory in the future. The hardest part for Maritza is when a product has not been sold by its expiration date, resulting in losses that she regrets. She really appreciates her business, and even though she's not earning too much right now, she has made a number of friends to talk to, which is what pleases her most. This will be Maritza's second loan with MFP. With her last loan, she had the will to pay and prevented herself from ever falling behind by making payments in advance. She is very happy and comfortable with her village bank. She plans to use her loan to increase the number of basic food items in her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto tiene 44 años de edad, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposa, con quien tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales, 4 viven en su casa y lo apoyan en sus cultivos, mientras que el resto migró a otras ciudades. Desde niño ayudaba en los trabajos agrícolas a su padre, una vez que se casó esta actividad se convirtió en su única fuente de trabajo. Él produce café y plátanos, cada cosecha la envía a los mercados de las ciudades de Lima y Huancayo para captar mayores ganancias, en aras de cubrir la alimentación de sus hijos, esta dinámica es con la que trabaja constantemente. Los años de experiencia le han permitido a Modesto lograr muy buenas cosechas, que le han resultado ser muy rentables, lo que le permitió cubrir la educación de sus hijos. En algunas oportunidades logró  incrementar su producción, pero en otras, le tocó enfrentarse a las plagas que perjudicaron su capital de trabajo, lo cual lo entristeció muchas veces. Pero como le gusta y ama sus cultivos, sigue trabajando con la misma fe con la que se inició. Ahora, Modesto tiene el anhelo de comprar un puesto en la ciudad para que sus hijos se dediquen a comercializar sus productos sin intermediarios, para así, incrementar sus ganancias. Él es uno de los fundadores de su banco comunal, al cual le tiene mucho cariño y durante los cincos préstamos que ha tenido con MFP demostró ser un hombre responsable y con gran sensibilidad a los problemas ajenos. El dinero que solicita es para invertir en un vivero de plantitas de café, para que luego de algunos meses proceda a sembrar en nuevas chacras.
texts.en:
Modesto is 44 years old and lives in his own house with his wife with whom he has 7 children, of which 4 live in his house and help with harvests, while the rest have migrated to other cities. Since he was a young boy he helped his father to farm, and once he got married this activity became his only source of income. He produces coffee and plantains and sends every harvest to the markets of the city of Lima and Huancayo to receive higher earnings to the cover costs of feeding his children; this is the dynamic that he works with constantly. Years of experience have allowed him to achieve very good crop yields that have been very profitable, which has allowed him to cover the expenses of educating his children. On some occasions he has been able to increase production, but in others, he has had to confront pests that have threatened his work capital, which has often saddened Modesto. However, because he likes working and loves his crops he continues working with the same faith with which he started. Currently Modesto has the desire to purchase of stand in the city so that his children can sell their products without the need for a middleman, which will allow them to increase their earnings. He is one of the founders of his communal bank for which he has much affection. In the five loans that he has had with MFP he has shown himself to be a responsible man with a great sensibility to others problems. The money that he is requesting is to invest in a nursery for his coffee plants that he will in a few months take to plant on new plots of land.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A coffee plant nursery.

loans.name: Ta Malaneh Enterprise Group

texts.en:
This is a group containing Kadiatu T., Amie F., Sallamatu B. K., Kadiatu K., and Memunatu K.. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town. They named their group Ta Malaneh, which is a Temne phrase meaning, “Let’s embrace each other.” This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs have receivedfrom SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have been of great help to these women. They were able to repay their loans on time and in full, while also feeding their children, paying school fees, and saving some money for unforeseen situations. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of SLL 1,000,000, for each person, to further strengthen their businesses.

Kadiatu T. (second from right) is the leader of the group. Kadiatu is forty-eight years of age. She is married with five children. Three of her children are already adults, and two are still in school. Kadiatu sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and has been in business for over twenty-five years.

loans.use: Invest in her palm-oil business

loans.name: Renee

texts.es: Renee tiene 43 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo, con el cual se casó, muy enamorada, hace 20 años. Fruto de ello, tiene 8 hijos, 5 viven fuera y los 3 menores con ellos. Ella se levanta muy temprano por la mañana, para preparar el desayuno y el almuerzo al mismo tiempo, puesto que el resto del día, estará muy ocupada realizando los trabajos agrícolas en compañía de su esposo. Ellos siembran café, plátano y otros frutos cítricos en sus propias tierras y otra parte en chacras alquiladas. Renee está muy contenta con los trabajos agrícolas, puesto que gracias a estos cultivos pudo educar a sus 5 hijos mayores y ahora viene educando a los otros 3, brindándoles a su vez, comodidades en casa. Ella considera que la siembra de café requiere mucha inversión de dinero, tiempo y mano de obra; pero así mismo, no pierde su capital, y aunque el precio en el mercado no sea bueno, siempre capta ingresos para su familia. En otras ocasiones ha hecho contacto con compradores de la capital que le han cotizado a un mejor precio, lo cual le permitió satisfacer los requerimientos educativos y de prendas de vestir para sus hijos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y durante este tiempo demostró tener capacidad de trabajo y responsabilidad en cada una de las intervenciones que realiza en su banco comunal, donde todos los integrantes la respetan mucho. Con el dinero que solicita contratará a personas que con machete en mano, limpien sus chacras de las hierbas y plantas innecesarias. Con otra parte, comprará plantas de café para renovar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
43-year old Renee lives in her own house with her husband whom she married, very much in love, twenty years ago. As a result of the union, they have eight children, five of whom are independent and three of whom still live with them. Renee gets up very early to prepare breakfast and lunch at the same time, because she is very busy the rest of the day, working in the fields with her husband. They grow coffee, bananas, and citrus fruits on their own land and on rented land too. Renee enjoys her work as a farmer because the income from it has enabled her to raise her five older children, and now she is in the process of raising the other three, providing them all with a comfortable home. She knows that growing coffee requires a big investment of money, time, and work. However, you don’t lose your money, as even when the market for coffee isn’t good, there is always enough income to support your family. On occasion Renee has made contact with buyers in the capital city who gave her a better price, allowing her to educate and clothe her children. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner, MFP, and during this time with each loan she has proven herself a hard worker and a responsible member of the community bank whose members greatly respect her. With some of the money she will hire people with machetes to clear away weeds and other unneeded plants from her fields. The rest of the loan will be used to buy new coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To clear her fields and buy new coffee plants

loans.name: Maribel Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maribel del Carmen M. , tiene la edad  de 28 años , habita en el barrio las conchitas , ubicado en el departamento de Masaya , junto a su esposo , el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo , tres hijos , todos menores de edad, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyarlo siempre en sus estudios , doña Maribel desde hace 18 años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , en un futuro quiere diversificar el cultivo . Con el préstamo obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y obtener mejores resultado. Da las gracias Afodenic por los beneficios adquirido para hacer las mejoras a su cultivos.
texts.en:
Maribel del Carmen M. is 28 years old and lives in the Conchitas neighborhood located in the department of Masaya. She lives with her husband who helps with household expenses and they have under their care three children, all whom are underage. They hope to improve their family’s living conditions and support their children in their studies. Since she was 18 years old Maribel has dedicated herself to agriculture; the biggest difficulty that she faces is a lack of financing. In the future she would like to diversify her crops. With the loan that she obtained she will purchase fertilizers and supplies to apply to her crop to obtain better results. She thanks Afodenic for the help it has given her to improve her crop.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers to apply to her crops.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is Zainab H., a local entrepreneur based in Makeni, which is in northern Sierra Leone. Zainab Adin is a successful and thriving entrepreneur who has benefited from SMT/Kiva. With the aid of SMT/Kiva loans, Zainab has been able to secure a booming business. She is currently building a house from the profit she makes from her business.

Zainab is now forty-eight years old and married with six children. She was born in Bo city, in southern Sierra Leone. Three of her children are in college, two are in secondary schools, and one is in primary school. The responsibility for paying school fees and other school related charges for the children rests solely on the shoulders of Zainab, as her husband is currently unemployed. 

She sells provisions such as peak milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, and ready-to-wear-clothes. She is also the owner of two motor-bikes that work as taxis in and around Makeni city. She buys her goods from neighboring Guinea, where goods are relatively cheaper than in Sierra Leone. Mrs. H. has been a businesswoman for seventeen years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Santos Efrain

texts.es: Santos Efrain , soltero por viudez habita en su casa con su hija de 18 años quien esta estudiando en la universidad, él trabaja como profesor de Educacion Fisico en 2 centrso de enseñanza secundaria, en el San Francisco desde hace 20 años y en Nuestra Señora de la Asuncion desde hace 15 años.  Esta solicitando su 4to credito para reparar el piso de su casa ya que su casa esta construida en mal terreno y con frecuencia se le parte el piso y ahora quiere hacer un mejor trabajo,  y construir un muro en la parte del frente de su casa y si le ajusta reparar gradas que dan hacia la calle.  El credito anterior lo cancelo anticipado al plazo, pues desea hacer estas reparaciones con urgencia por el invierno.  Expresa ademas que sin los creditos  no es posible salir adelante para lograr mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santos Efrain is widowed and lives in his house with his 18-year-old daughter who is studying in the university. He works as a Physical Education teacher in two centers of secondary education; he has worked in the San Francisco school for the past 20 years, and at Nuestra Señora de la Asunción for the past 15 years. He is requesting his fourth loan to repair the floor of his house given that his house was built on bad land and as a consequence the floor often cracks; he would like to do a better job in regards to his floor. He would also like to build a wall in the front part of his house, and if he can repair the steps that lead to the street. He finished paying of his previous loan before the term was over because he would like to carry out these repairs urgently due to the impending winter. He also expressed that without these loans he would not be able to get ahead and improve his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the floor and build a wall.

loans.name: Santos Lino

texts.es: Don Santos Lino es casado, de 49 años de edad, trabajo como ganadero (ordeña 30 vacas en 2 fincas ubicadas en la Gateada, tiene 3 hijos los cuales estudian, 1 en la secundaria, el viane a su casa 2 veces por semana, tiene un trabajador permanente en la finca quien se encarga de las labores, su esposa tiene trabaja en un pequeño negocio en el hogar (pulperia), esta solicitando su primer credito para utilizarlo en la construccion de un muro y porche que es de suma urgencia debido a que con las lluvias  las corrientes de arriba llegan al porche de su casa y luego se inunda la vivienda, ese muro le servira para ampliar el porche ql que pondra techo, al muro le pondra tubos y mallas porque lo cerra porque quiere aprovehcar el aire que les llega.  El tiene 30 años de estar en la actividad ganadera, pues desde niño comenzo con su padre.
texts.en:
Santos Lino is married, 49 years old, and work as farm hand (he milks 30 cows on two ranches located in La Gateada). He has 3 children who all study, 1 of which is in secondary school. He leaves home 2 times a week, and has a permanent worker on his ranch that takes care of the daily chores. His wife has a small business in their home (a small grocery store). He is requesting his first loan to build a wall and porch that is of the up most urgency because with the rains, the water currents reach his porch and then flood his house. The wall will serve to expand the porch to which he will also add a roof; he will also add tubes and netting to the wall so he can enjoy the air that passes through. He has worked with cattle for 30 years, and began doing so with his dad when he was a small boy.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Karolina Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Karolina del Socorro Suárez, tiene la edad de 24 años, habita en el barrio Benjamín Zeledón , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a sus padres , ella es madre soltera , a su cargo tiene dos hijos , uno de siete años y un bebe de once meses , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder hacer algún día su casa propia , doña Karolina desde hace 18 años , trabaja como agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio esta actividad con apoyo de su papá , Con el préstamo obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Karolina del Socorro Suárez is 24 years old and lives with her parents in the Benjamín Zeledón neighborhood located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother and has two children under her care; one is seven years old, and the other is an eleven-month-old baby. She hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and to be one day build her own house. Since she was 18 years old, Karolina has worked in agriculture; the biggest difficulty that she faces is a lack of financing. She began working in agriculture with help from her father. With this loan she will purchase fertilizer and supplies to apply to her crop to have a good yield.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and supplies

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has been a taxi driver for 5 years, since a friend suggested the idea to her. She enjoys the scheduling freedom her job gives her. She is a single mother and the head of her family. She has 2 daughters, 24 and 18 years old. One daughter is finishing high school this year and the second one is attending college. 

She has had a total three loans through ACCION USA. The first two were to purchase cars and this last one was to repair the car and to pay for the insurance down payment. Taxi drivers generally have to pay their insurance in an annual lump sum. ACCION USA helped her to be able to drive her own car rather than renting one, which is expensive and as not profitable for the taxi driver.

loans.use: Car Insurance and some vehicle repairs

loans.name: Geoconda Marbelly

texts.es: Doña Geoconda es casada, tiene 33 años, trabaja junto a su esposo como negociantes de productos lacteos (queso y crema), tienen 2 hijos, los cuales estudian la primaria, ella esta solicitando su primer credito para la construccion de un pantry y la ceramica de la cocina, manifiesta que una vez realizada esta obrea solicitara otro credito para la construccion del gabinete que en estos momentos se lo hacen demasiado caro.  En su casa tiene comodidades en lo que se refiere a la sala, dormitorio, baños , pero le hace falta la cocina para contar con una vivienda digna y con condiciones para sus hijos. Es una persona reconocida en la comunidad y con excelentes recomendaciones.  El producto de la venta lo hacen fuera de Juigalpa para venderlo mejor, ya que es de calidad, consideran pagar en tiempo y forma el credito.
texts.en:
Geoconda is married, is 33 years old, and works with her husband as dairy products (cheese and cream) merchants; they have 2 children who are in primary school. She is requesting her first loan to build a pantry and to tile the kitchen; she mentions that once she is finished with this construction job she will request another loan to built cabinets that are currently too expensive. In her house she has a living room, room, and bathrooms that make her house comfortable but she is does not have a kitchen to make her house suitable with the proper living conditions for her children. She is a well-known person in the community and with excellent references. They carry out their sales outside of Juigalpa to sell more given that they sell a quality product; they plan to pay their loan back on time and completely.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a pantry and tile the kitchen.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Discovering that postal services were limited in his area, Carlos found a niche and opened a postal service three years ago with a loan from ACCION USA. Each week he sends a freight of 120-150 packages between 4-8 pounds to Ecuador. His business has been very well received in his community in Queens, New York. He is married and has three children he is able to support through the success of his small store.

Carlos has been approved for another loan through ACCION USA, to purchase a car which he will use to bring packages to and from the airport for shipping. This is his first car and he says that it will help him to increase his efficiency and grow his business.

Most of his clients are sending gifts and clothing to Ecuador and they are so grateful for the service he provides. Carlos loves that he is able to connect the people of his community with their family and friends back in Ecuador. Many of his clients are unfamiliar with other means of shipping goods to their home country, so Carlos provides an easy and simple way for people to stay connected to their distant loved ones.

loans.use: To buy a car for transporting packages

loans.name: Elvis Jose

texts.es: Elvis, acompañado con la Sra. Guadalupe U., ambos trabajan en la Universidad Agraria (UNA) con 8 años de servicio, tienen una niña la que todavia no esta en edad escolar, él tiene una hija de su matrimonio anterior quien vive con su mamá, esta estudiando 1er año de secundaria, le apoya con los utiles escolares, medicamentos, ropa y una cuota mensual, ambos tienen horario de 8 a 5 p.m. de miercoles a Domingos, ademas brinda servicios de contabilidad a Reposteria Hoblan y Hermandad Gogar de anciandos donde le pagan U$.150.00.  Esta solicitando su 8vo credito el que utilizara para las reparacion del piso de un anexo que hizo para la cocina en su vivienda, el cual  mide 6m x 1.80 mts, ya habia sido construido con el credito anterior, aunque no fue por el fondo KIVa, este quedo en pesimas condiciones con un desnivel que cuando llueve el agua del patio se mete a la casa, por lo que le urge realizar la reparacion. Expresa que garacias a AFODENIC posee una vivienda digna para su familia y piensa seguir trabajando porque esta institucion ofrece a los asalariados mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Elvis and señora Guadalupe U. have both worked at the Universidad Agraria (UNA) for eight years. They have a daughter who is not yet old enough to attend school. Elvis also has a daughter from a previous marriage who lives with her mother and is in first year of high school. He provides her with school supplies, medicines, clothing, and a monthly allowance. Both Elvis and Guadalupe work from 8am to 5pm Wednesday to Sunday. He also provides accounting services to the Hoblan Bakery and Association Gogar for Seniors who pay him US$150. This is his eighth loan, and he will use it to repair the floor in a room adjacent to the kitchen in his house. The floor measures 6m x 1.80m and was built using a previous loan, although not with Kiva. It is now in a dreadful condition; the uneven floor allows water from the patio to enter the house when it rains, so repair is urgently needed. Elvis says that because of Kiva partner, AFODENIC, he now has a decent house for his family, and he intends to continue working with this institution because it offers good benefits to working people.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Floor repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tile cutter and other new tools

loans.name: Mame Binta

texts.fr: mame binta S. habite tout pres de la caisse de yoff ou elle est membre depuis 2006.elle est specialisee dans le commerce de l'habillement et d'autres produits divers.
texts.en:
Mame Binta S. lives very near the Yoff bank, where she has been a member since 2006. She is specialized in the commerce of clothing and also diverse goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique is the proud owner of a shoe repair business in Manhattan. Shoes are his passion. His business, with shoes displayed in the front and a small workshop in the back, supports his family, which consists of his wife Maria and their grown daughter.

Enrique apprenticed as a shoe repairman for many years.  Two years ago, he proudly took ownership of his own store. Despite working six days a week, his energy remains high. He has been approved for a loan of $5,000 from ACCION USA to provide him with working capital that will help him to continue his repair work. 
                            
He admits that times are sometimes tough, but his clients remain loyal because they know that his work is of the highest quality. New clients get a sense of his work with flyers and samples of work in his store.

loans.use: Leather, rubber soles and general working capital.

loans.name: María Argentina

texts.es:
La señora María Argentina A. es una dama muy alegre y esforzada que se dedica a su negocio de venta de alimentos en su localidad.

Las personas le visitan mucho porque ella se ha destacado elaborando deliciosos alimentos que son del agrado de muchas personas. La señora María ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de dichos alimentos y así salir adelante en el negocio de venta de alimentos.
texts.en:
María Argentina A. is a very happy and hardworking woman that dedicates herself to her business in the sale of food in her neighborhood. People visit her often because she is well known for making delicious dishes that are well liked by many people. Maria has requested a loan to purchase basic materials to make her aforementioned dishes and in that way get ahead in her food sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic materials.

loans.name: Brenda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La dama Brenda E. se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzados en la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario comercializa sus productos a las personas que le visitan.

Es importante destacar que ella ha logrado salir adelante brindando buenas condiciones a su negocio y para ello ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel por medio de la solicitud de un crédito para dar lugar a la compra de la ropa y el calzado y así mejorar sus condiciones económicas y las de su negocio.
texts.en:
Brenda E. sells clothing and shoes in the city of Chinandega. She sells her products daily to people that visit her. It's important to point out that she has managed to get ahead and keep her business in good condition. She has looked to Ceprodel for support so she can buy clothing and shoes and improve her and her business's economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Adelina

texts.es:
La dama Rosa S. se dedica a su negocio de tienda de comestibles ofreciendo diferentes tipos de comestibles livianos como tortas y café. Ella hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos comestibles para continuar en su negocio.

Es de importancia destacar que con el crédito que ella hoy en día solicita, logrará la compra de los comestibles para comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Rosa S. has a food business where she offers light options like cakes and coffee. She has turned to Ceprodel to request a credit to buy such food to continue her business. It's important to point out that with the credit that she's requesting, she will be able to purchase the food and sell it.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo tiene 52 años, vive solo en su casa propia, es padre de 3 hijos, pero ellos no viven con él. Desde hace más de 18 años viene ejerciendo el oficio de cerrajero, su taller está en su misma vivienda, donde construye puertas, ventanas y todo tipo de estructuras metálicas que le soliciten. Adicionalmente, en sus momentos libres se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y taxi en su motocarro. Él considera que su trabajo como cerrajero le es muy rentable porque cuenta con clientes regulares quienes lo recomiendan a otras personas por su buen trabajo. Para más adelante, Alfredo quiere mandar a construir un local adecuado para su taller y para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros y compañeras son personas muy responsables y comunicativas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales para su cerrajería, como fierros, soldaduras y otros artículos necesarios para su labor.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 52 years old and lives alone in his own home. He has three children who live independently. Alfredo has been working as a locksmith for more than 18 years. Within his home, he has a workshop where he builds doors, windows and different kinds of metallic structures upon request. In his free time, he also works as a motorcycle taxi driver. He considers his work as a locksmith quite profitable, since he has a number of regular customers who recommend him to their friends because of his high-quality workmanship. Alfredo's goal for the future is to build a new workshop in a better location that will be more appealing to his clients. This is his second loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. His favorite thing about the village bank he is a member of is that his fellow members are very responsible, communicative people. Alfredo plans to use this loan to buy materials for his locksmith's shop, like iron bars, soldering joints, and other necessary items for his work.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy iron rods and soldering joints

loans.name: Natividad De Maria Group

texts.en:
The committee Natividad de Maria is in their second cycle and have a group savings of 800,000 Gs.  All of them are from the Guarambare zone at the center of San Lorenzo in Paraguay. They conduct many activities and meet weekly where they talk about their activities over the past week.  

1	Alicia D..	Cosmetic sales 
2	Emilia D..	Cosmetic sales 
3	Liz V..	General store and domestic employment 
4	Rufina G..	General store and food sales 
5	Pablina S..	Food sales 
6	Angelica M..	Cosmetic sales 
7	Eugenia T..	Food sales 
8	Maria S..	Diner 
9	Bilda Z..	Bar in a university 
10	Maria P..	General store 
11	Maria R. D..	Food sales 
12	De Jesus S..	Fabric store 
13	Lucila R. D..	Food sales 
14	Vidalia O..	Food sales 
15	Dorila G..	Cosmetic sales 
16	Doris O..	Milk sales 
17	Eugenia O..	Food sales

loans.use: Funds will go to the purchase of merchandise such as, vegetables, breads, milk, deodorants, various housewares, etc.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es: Julio César M. de 41 años de edad reside en Cojutepeque junto a su esposa, dos hijos y un nieto. El posee una tienda de productos perecederos en su hogar, la cual la atienden junto a su esposa, así mismo esporádicamente realiza trabajos de albañilería. Julio solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda construir un muro de contención, ya que el cuarto de su hija se está derrumbando y necesita reparaciones urgentemente, ya que corre peligro la vida de sus hijos pero sobre todo de su pequeño nieto, Juan espera lograr construir dicho muro y poder brindarle seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Julio César M. is 41 years old and lives in Cojutepeque with his wife, their two children, and their grandchild. Julio runs a perishable goods store from his home, which he and his wife both tend. Julio also works occasionally as a builder. Julio is requesting a loan so that he can build a retaining wall, since his daughter's room is collapsing and is in need of urgent repairs. Not only does this situation put the lives of his children at risk, but also the life of his young grandson. Julio hopes to build this wall so that he can provide his family with security.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a retaining wall

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joe’s car accessory business is art in motion. He invented custom external car covers made from unique patterns of faux fur. As an artist he pays attention to detail and has spent countless hours developing his product. His products are very unique.

A few years ago, Joe came to ACCION USA for a loan to create his website. Recently he has requested a loan to purchase more faux fur and to invest money in advertising. His best advertisement is his own car, which he proudly cruises all over New York City and occasionally takes to other cities. The design is “loud” he says, “people are forced to love it or hate it, but at least it wakes them up”.

Joe already has plans for his next loan. He would like to grow his business through high profile advertising.

loans.use: Faux fur and advertising

loans.name: Marta Delmy

texts.es: Marta Delmy B. D. G.  D. 58 años D. edad, resiD. en Cojutepeque junto a sus tres hijos, uno D. los cuales trabaja y los otros dos se dedican a estudiar y no trabajan ya que aun son menores D. edad. Marta se dedica desD. hace ocho años a vender productos plásticos tales como platos y vasos desechables en el mercado municipal D. Cojutepeque. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual espera obtener el capital necesario para comprar productos plásticos al por mayor D. manera que pueda surtir mucho más su negocio, el cual es su principal fuente D. ingresos.
texts.en:
Marta Delmy B. D. G. is 58 years old and lives in Cojutepeque with her three children. Two of her children are minors and are currently in school, while the third works. For the past eight years, Marta has been selling plastic products like disposable plates and cups in Cojutepeque's Municipal Market. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more assorted plastic products in bulk so that she can offer her customers a wider selection of items. This business is her primary source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic products in bulk

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Rhina Maribel

texts.es: Rhina Maribel C. D. M.  D. 44 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad junto a su esposo y tres hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una panadería desD. hace más D. quince años, la cual la atienden junto a su esposo. Rhina solicita un préstamo con el fin D. mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio y así mismo comprar materia prima para la elaboración del pan, ella espera renovar y mejorar su negocio el cual ha sido su única fuente D. ingresos desD. hace quince años.
texts.en:
Rhina Maribel C. D. M. is 44 years old and lives in La Libertad Department with her husband and their three children, who are currently in school. Rhina has had a bakery for the past 15 years, which she and her husband run together. Rhina is requesting a loan so that she can improve her business's appearance and buy ingredients to make bread. She hopes to renovate and improve the business, which has been her only source of income for the past 15 years.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to bake bread

loans.name: Anibal's Group

texts.en:
At the age of 63, Anibal has just as much, or maybe more, energy than the young people that typically work in his line of business. He runs a decorative painting, paper hanging, and ceramic tile installation operation. He began work in this industry twenty years ago, working for various construction companies and landlords. In 1998, after 10 years of working for others, he set off on his own and has built a steady business for himself.

Today, Anibal’s business provides an income and enables him to enjoy time with his wife, three children and two grandchildren. His business has steadily grown with the help of four loans from ACCION USA. His most recent loan was used to purchase a tile cutter and a small scaffold.

Anibal began his business with very little, but through his honesty and hard work, he has built a great reputation and sustainable business. Anibal has decided that he will retire in the next three years and is meanwhile working hard to fulfill his goal.

loans.use: Tile cutter and and small scafflold

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro has created a good life for himself and his family by selling Italian jewelry to customers throughout New York City. He first began to sell jewelry with his brother and later began selling on his own. He travels throughout the city to doctors' offices, hospitals, private offices, and other establishments where he has built up a loyal client base. His clients often call him to see if he has anything new in. 

When he first began his business, he borrowed money from friends to build up his inventory. He once tried to get a loan from a bank but was turned away. Alejandro’s first loan from ACCION USA was to establish his credit; he was able to repay it on time and has now taken a second loan. With his loan he is purchasing more inventory--rings, chains, bracelets, pendants and watches, and some precious stones as well.  

While Alejandro feels that money and happiness are not connected, he has created a stable business that has allowed him to accomplish both his dream of small business ownership and providing for his family. Alejandro's son currently attends university and with his small business he supports him as much as possible.

loans.use: Purchase inventory such as rings, bracelets, chains, pendants , watches and precious stones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: New transmission and other minor repairs

loans.name: Alejandro Santos

texts.es: Alejandro Santos S. E. de 40 años de edad, reside en San Martín junto a su esposa y un hijo. Él posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su casa, y su esposa colabora con los ingresos familiares con una venta de tortillas. Alejandro solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder surtir más su tienda con productos como lácteos, bebidas, golosinas, entre otros más. Alejandro tiene como meta el mejorar su negocio, ya que es de esta manera donde obtienen la mayor cantidad de ingresos, es por esto que es muy importante para él obtener dicho préstamo.
texts.en:
Alejandro Santos S. E. is 40 years old and lives in San Martin with his wife and son. He runs a store from his home, where he sells basic household items. His wife contributes to the family's income by selling tortillas. Alejandro is requesting this loan so that he can stock his store with a wider selection of items, including dairy products, drinks, candy and other products. Alejandro's goal is to improve his business, since this will allow him to maximize his profits. This is why it is very important for him to get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Offer a wider selection of items in general store

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis has a baked goods delivery business. He began his business seven years ago and is proud of the success his venture has become. He is also happy and proud to be able to send his thirteen year old to a good school. He also has two sons who are serving in the Marines. 

He bought the business from another man and has increased from two delivery contracts to six major contracts with various bakeries throughout the city. Luis expanded in 2005 with the addition of a brand new van and the hire of an employee. This is his second loan from ACCION USA. Several years ago, Luis requested a loan to insulate the inside of his first van, which proved advantageous for his business by keeping his goods cold and preventing any damage. He has requested a loan to insulate his second van, which will be necessary to keep his goods fresh during the hot New York City summer.

Luis begins his morning with his first delivery route between one and two in the morning. He does three rounds of deliveries throughout the day. In the morning, he’s bringing fresh baked goods to cafes, delis, and coffee shops. Later in the day, he delivers pies and cakes to restaurants. He works with some of the most well-known bakeries in New York City, providing sweets and breads to hundreds of people daily.

loans.use: Insulation for his delivary van

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es: Ana Deysi R. H. de 45 años de edad reside en San Martín, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ella posee 15 años de tener un bazar y una librería, de la cual han logrado obtener muy buenas ganancias en todo este tiempo debido a que no posee ningún tipo de competencia. Ana solicita un préstamo con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, y al mismo tiempo surtirlo con mucho más producto como ropa, papelería entre otras cosas más. Esto será muy beneficioso para ella ya que podrá obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana Deysi R. H. is 45 years of age, and she lives in the town of San Martin along with her husband and two children. For 15 years she has run a small bookstore and general merchandise store which has been quite successful and profitable, due in part to the fact that she doesn’t have any competition. Ana is requesting a loan to improve her store, and to offer a broader range of items for sale, including clothing, paper goods, etc. This will be very helpful to her, enabling her to increase her profitability.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - purchase stock for resale

loans.name: Blanca Estela
