Leonisa P. is from the village of Santo Nino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Leonisa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonisa owns & operates a "sari-sari" or retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Leonisa is just starting this business.

In 2008, Leonisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari" or retail store. Leonisa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Leonisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for their basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santo Nino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Edmar

texts.en: Edmar O. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 37 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Edmar owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Edmar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Edmar is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his fourth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and to pay for his children's education. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia S. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 41 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. Alicia owns and operates a pub. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional drinks. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional drinks. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional drinks for her pub

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca A. is from the village of Gala, Ozamiz City. She is 64 years old, married, and has six adult children. Francisca owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Francisca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase organic fertilizers such as animal manure. This loan will be her eighth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to sustain her family's needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer such as animal manure

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
N. Lê Thị (440971364) is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has two infant children. 

N. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

N. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to buy piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Pricilla

texts.en:
Pricilla E. is from the village of Purok Rizal, Bacolod, Ozamiz city. She is 49 years old. Pricilla is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Pricilla raises pigs. Pricilla has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately PHP 8000 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Pricilla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Pricilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 9000 from GDMPC. Pricilla is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which she will use to purchase feed for the piggery. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Pricilla from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to sustain the basic needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed for pigs.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Hân Nguyễn Thị, age 52, lives in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has two grown children. She earns a living by owning and operating a business venture in the food sector, specifically, running a food stall where she sells a variety of food products in the local community. Hân has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Hân joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Hân has successfully repaid six previous loans from TYM Fund. These previous loans were used to purchase additional products to sell.

Hân is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Hân plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her food-stall business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Advertising

loans.name: Melgin

texts.en:
Melgin S. is from the town of Migcanaway Tangub City. She is 27 years old. Melgin is married and has 3 infant children. To make a living, Melgin owns & operates a transportation business. This business involves operating boat-ride services. Melgin has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melgin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Melgin is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Melgin from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support her family's needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better transportation service.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Ever since Mary was a young girl she has loved to sing. In 2005 she began studying music and eventually released a single in 2006. With a full length Gospel CD in 2007 her hobby turned into a business.  Mary writes and performs Christian Gospel Swahili music in South Boston where she has close ties to the African community. Mary sells her music through concerts as well as her website.

Mary has recently received a second loan from ACCION USA to finish producing a series of music videos.  She hopes to break into the large market in East Africa where videos, and not music albums, generate revenue and reach more listeners.  

She hopes to reach millions of Swahili speakers in countries like Kenya, Burundi, Tanzania and Uganda.  In addition, she recently noticed that there’s a big market in the United States for her music, that goes beyond the African communities with whom she has close ties.  Mary says many people who buy her CD don’t speak Swahili, “but they like the beat.”  She currently performs all over Boston and has also performs at large community benefits and fundraisers.

loans.use: Music video production

loans.name: Ligia

texts.en:
Ligia is a proud wife, mother, and retail clothing seller in Miami. Her business targets female products, which include pants, shirts, underwear, cosmetics, and beauty supplies. Ligia is aware of the financial benefits of repeat customers, and therefore focuses her marketing strategy on obtaining long term clients. This is why her numerous clients look for her even when she’s not around to place new orders. Some of her clients are from her prior business, where she prepared food. Ligia has two children and a husband that works as a plumber.

Lidia took the first step in building her credit in 2004 by starting her business with her first ACCION USA loan of $500. She has invested more than $2,000 in her business with the help of four loans from ACCION USA. Ligia currently needs a loan of $1,000 to purchase new clothing inventory- styles that keep her clients happy and in style.

She is a proud woman that goes out everyday to find her customers rather than wait for her husband to sustain her, she says. Her immediate goal is to make the transition from a traveling salesperson to a local store owner. She is a skilled salesperson who has a great attitude towards her customers – a combination that continues to bring fortune to both her and her family.

loans.use: Clothing inventory

loans.name: Miguel Jose

texts.en:
Miguel is the owner of a photography and TV production business in Miami. He produces commercials, infomercials and does photography for weddings and birthday parties. He is married with two children. 

Miguel has been working in the industry for fifteen years. Four years ago he formed his own company with a loan from ACCION USA. He has now been approved for a second loan to purchase a new camera and computer for editing video.

By upgrading his equipment, Miguel is able to give his clients the finest prints and video, and stay competitive. He loves his job because he is able to interact with his clients at some of the most important times in their lives. He plans to grow his business over the coming years and provide work to other photographers.

loans.use: A new camera and a computer for editing videos

loans.name: Dady

texts.en:
Dady R. is from the village of Paypayan Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Dady is married and has five small children. To make a living, Dady owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, specifically, selling "buko" or young coconut in the local community. Dady has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2008, Dady joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Dady has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC.

loans.name: Sainiso

texts.ru: Джалолова Сайнисо – женщина 52 лет. Сайнисо замужем у нее 4 детей. Сайнисо узнала о нашей программе кредитование у односельчан и решила попробовать. Сайнисо занимается продажей продуктов питания и хозтоваров у нее есть собственный магазин. Сайнисо не имела возможности расширится из за финансовых ресурсов, теперь она получила кредит у нас и ее бизнес дает хороший прибыль. Сайнисо также о своим мужем каждую неделью торгуют на рынках Аппон, булок и Гудос Аштоского района.
texts.en:
Sainiso D. is 52 years old, married and has 4 children. She found out about our lending program from her neighbors and decided to give it a try. Sainiso is involved in the sales of food products and household goods at her own store. Sainiso has not been able to expand her business due to lack of financial resources. She received this loan from us, and now her business is more profitable. Sainiso and her husband also sell at the Appon, Bulok and Gudos markets in the Asht district every week.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

With this loan, the women would be able to not only improve their business but also financially support themselves and their family.

loans.name: Adélia Rafael

texts.pt:
Adélia Rafael Z.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Comércio – Venda de produtos 
Empréstimo: 10,000.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Adélia de 46 anos nasceu no distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, estudou até quarta classe. Casada com quatro filhos, três dos quais são maiores e o ultimo menor de dez anos.
Veio viver em Boane em 1982 depois de seu casamento.
Vende roupas femininas para jovens e adultas e roupas de cama, importadas da África do Sul, viaja quatro vezes por mês para aquele pais vizinho e cada vez compra mercadoria de cerca de 10,000.00MT.
As vendas diárias variam entre 1,500.00 – 2,000.00 MT e tem renda mensal cerca de 5,000.00MT, o marido é assalariado e tem um rendimento mensal de 4,500.00MT.
Com empréstimo de 10,000.00MT pretende reforçar sua capacidade de compra para reduzir o número de viagens a África do Sul.
No futuro gostaria de construir um pequeno estabelecimento comercial para diversificar o tipo de actividade e não depender apenas de uma única fonte.
texts.en:
Adélia is 46 years old and was born in the district of Massinga in the Province of Inhambane. She went to school until the fourth grade. She is married with 4 children, three of which are adults, and the youngest is 10 years old. She came to live in Boane in 1982 after she was married. She sells female clothing for juniors and adults as well as bedding that she imports from South Africa. She travels 4 times per month to the neighboring country, and each time she purchases merchandise for around 10,000MT. Her daily sales vary between 1,500MT and 2,000MT, and she earns around 5,000MT each month. Her husband is salaried and earns 4,500MT monthly. With a loan of 10,000MT she intends to strengthen her purchasing power and reduce the number of trips to South Africa. In the future she would like to construct a small commercial establishment to diversify her types of activities rather than depend on a sole source.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: individual loan for retail

loans.name: Arimerit Amuleni Bena Group

texts.en:
A. Bena is a 24 year old business lady and mother of two children going to school. She looks after four dependents, who are her brothers and sisters, who are also in schooling.

A. has been dealing in produce, such as sorghum, millet, ground nuts, and peas, for two years. She is using the loan to purchase more of this produce. She is happy that now she can take care of her self and family. She is a hardworking and active lady whose dream is to educate her children, brothers, and sisters and, God willing, she will purchase a plot of land and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase sorghum, millet, ground nuts, peas, and other produce.

loans.name: Hokumkhan

texts.en:
Hokumkhan was born in 1966. He is married and settled in the Fuzuli region. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan.

Six years ago he started a cafe. He now needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy tables, chairs, and equipment for his cafe.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, and the equipment for his cafe.

loans.name: Ana Venâncio

texts.pt:
Ana Venâncio B.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Comércio – Venda de alguidares 
Empréstimo: 20,000.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Ana de 41 anos nasceu no distrito de Manjacaze, Província de gaza, estudou até quarta classe. Solteira  com quatro filhos, três dos quais são maiores e o ultimo com treze anos. Para alem dos filhos vive com mais duas netas.
Veio viver em Boane com os pais  e quando atingiu dezoito anos juntou com o marido com o qual teve os quatro filhos, tendo se divorciado mais tarde, passando a viver sozinha com os filhos.
Trabalha muito duro para sustentar a numerosa família, levanta as 5hrs da manha e sou vai a cama depois das 21 de noite.
Para o sustento da família ela vende cimento de construção e alguidares objectos muito usados nas famílias rurais para transformar milho em farinha. Do seu negocio consegue poupar em media 4,500.00MT/mês, vive na casa própria, e é pela quinta vez que solicita empréstimo a HLUVUKU. No futuro gostaria de construir aviários para criação de frangos.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old and was born in the district of Manjacaze in the Province of Gaza. She went to school until the 4th grade. She is single and has 4 children. The 3 oldest are adults, and the youngest is 13 years old. Besides her children she lives with 2 granddaughters. She came to live in Boane with her parents, and when she turned 18 she married her husband and had her 4 children with him. She later divorced her husband and then lived alone with her children. She works very hard to sustain her large family. She wakes up at 5:00am in the morning and only goes to bed after 9:00pm at night. To support her family she sells cement for construction and clay bowls frequently used by rural families for grinding corn into flour. From her business she is able to save an average of 4,500MT each month. She lives in her own home. This is her 5th loan solicited through Hluvuku. In the future she would like to construct chicken coops to raise chickens.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: individual loan for retail

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.pt:
Antonieta M.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Habitação – Compra de material de construção  
Montante de Empréstimo: 12,500.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Antonieta de 41 anos nasceu no distrito de Marracuene, Província de Maputo, estudou até decima classe. Casada maritalmente com uma filha, de doze anos. Para alem da filha vive com o marido e sogra.
Veio viver em Boane com marido e ambos vivem na casa própria. 
É professora de profissão com uma renda mensal de 4,000.00MT e consegue poupar muito pouco.
Esta é a segunda que pede empréstimo à Hluvuku com o mesmo propósito de melhorar as condições da residência familiar. 
Para o futuro espera concluir com as obras e equipar a sua residência.
texts.en:
Antonieta is 41 years old and was born in the district of Marracuene in the Province of Maputo. She went to school until the 10th grade. She is married and has a 12 year old daughter. Besides her daughter she lives with her husband and her mother-in-law. She came to live in Boane with her husband, and they live in their own home. She is a professor with monthly earnings of 4,000MT. She is only able to save very little. This is the second loan requested through Hluvuku with the same purpose to improve the conditions of her family residence. In the future she hopes to finish construction and furnish her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: individual loan for housing

loans.name: Arimerit Achipa Betty Group

texts.en:
Betty A. is 27-years old and married. She has three children who all go to school. She looks after and additional 13 dependents, some of whom are orphans, who also go to school. 

For the past year, Betty has owned a butcher shop selling meat. She will use the loan to purchase goats for slaughtering and chickens to sell. This loan will help her continue to improve her business after transitioning from making local brew to the butchery business. She plans to work very hard to earn more profits and construct a house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase goats for slaughtering and chickens to sell

loans.name: António Júlio

texts.pt:
António Júlio M.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Habitação – Compra de material de construção  
Montante de Empréstimo: 20,000.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

António de 47 anos nasceu no distrito de Xai-Xai, Província de Gaza, estudou até nona classe. Casado e pai de cinco filhos dos quais quatro são maiores e um menor.
Foi militar e depois passou a desmobilização dez anos mais tarde e neste momento trabalha numa empresa de segurança. Trabalha oito horas por dia.
Sustenta as despesas da família com ajuda da esposa que é negociante. Como o salário é bastante baixo não consegue fazer poupanças já que as despesas de educação dos filhos são bastantes altas.
Com o empréstimo de 20,000.00MT pretende melhorar as condições de habitabilidade da família.
Para o futuro espera concluir com as obras e equipar a sua residência.
texts.en:
António is 47 years old and was born in the district of Xai-Xai in the Province of Gaza. He went to school through the 9th grade. He is married and the father of 5 children, four of which are grown, and the youngest is a minor. He was in the military and was demobilized 10 years later. Right now he works for a security company. He works 8 hours per day. He handles the expenses of the family with the help of his wife who is a businesswoman. As his salary is very low he is unable to save money especially now that the education costs of his children are quite high. With a loan of 20,000MT he intends to improve the living conditions of his family. In the future he hopes to finish his work and furnish his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy construction material for family house

loans.name: Laurinda

texts.pt:
Laurinda J.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Comercio – Compra de produtos de primeira necessidade  
Montante de Empréstimo: 25,000.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Laurinda de 40 anos nasceu no distrito de Guijá, Província de Gaza, estudou até segunda classe. Solteira e mãe de um filho de 16 anos de idade, ainda na fase escolar e sustenta 3 sobrinhos que vivem sobre responsabilidade dela por serem órfãos.
Nasceu em Guijá porque o pai encontrava se naquele distrito em missão de serviço e a mãe numa das visitas ao pai acabou dando parto naquele distrito de Gaza, mas sempre a residência deles foi no distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo.
Vive na casa própria, é comerciante a 20 anos e nunca trabalhou para outrem. Tem como rendimento mensal 3,500.00MT.
É quinto empréstimo com a Hluvuku e sempre foi pediu empréstimo para mesma actividade. Com o valor de 25,000.00MT, pretende reforçar o stock de modo a satisfazer a demanda da sua clientela.
No futuro sonha ampliar o seu estabelecimento comercial
texts.en:
Laurinda is 40 years old and was born in the district of Guijá in the Province of Gaza. She went to school until the 2nd grade. She is a single mother of a 16 year old son, who is still in school, and she supports 3 nephews that are her responsibility because they were orphans. She was born in Guijá because her father found himself in that district on a service mission, and her mother, on one of her visits to her father, ended up giving birth in the district of Gaza. But they always had a home in the district of Boane in the Province of Maputo. She lives in her own home and has been a trader for 20 years. She has never worked for anyone. She has a monthly income of 3,500MT. This is her 5th loan with Hluvuku, and they are always used for the same activity. With a value of 25,000MT she intends to increase her stocks so she can satisfy the demand of her clientele. In the future she dreams of expanding her commercial establishment.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her stocks

loans.name: Aminedeke Peduni Betty Group

texts.en:
Betty P. is 28-years old, married, and has four children. One of her children goes to school; the others are still too young. 

Betty has had a business selling local brew for the past 10 years. She will use this loan to purchase millet and yeast for brewing. Previous loans have improved her business and she has been able to obtain a pig and a goat. Now she is not in hardship like she used to be. 

Betty is an active member of her community where people are encouraging one another to form small groups for development. Her plan for the future is to buy a cow.

loans.use: To purchase millet and yeast for brewing

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol S. is from the village of Upper Lamac Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Carol runs a "sari-sari" or general store selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste, in the local community. Carol has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Carol joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Asli

texts.en:
Asli (her husband is pictured) was born in 1950. You can see in the picture Arzuman Huseynov. This family received the first loan in 2007.

Now they apply for the second loan of 2000 AZN to buy foodstuffs and home appliances for improving their business. "Thanks Kiva for your help!"

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and home appliances

loans.name: Crisy

texts.en:
Crisy B. is from the town of Villa Victoria, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 28 years old. Crisy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Crisy owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop and does RTW clothing sales.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products and RTW in the local community. Crisy has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Crisy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Crisy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family and for the family's basic needs.  

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Imylenda

texts.en:
Imylenda H. is from the town of Gracia, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old. Imylenda is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Imylenda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, delivering dried fish and RTW clothing sales. Imylenda's main source of income comes primarily from selling a variety of different products and delivering dried fishes in the local community. Imylenda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imylenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to sustain her business activities. Imylenda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Imylenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and support her family's daily expenses. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Hưởng Lê Thị is a 49 year-old female living in the town of Kim Động.  She is married and has 4 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Hưởng owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Hưởng has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 1997, Hưởng  joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hưởng has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Hưởng is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Hưởng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Miriam's Group

texts.en: Miriam P. is from the town of Gracia, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Miriam owns and operates a business making and selling specialty food products in the local community like longganisa and chorizo (types of sausage). Miriam has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Miriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Miriam is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase inventory for her new store and as working capital. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and help provide the whole family’s basic needs. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her new  store

loans.name: Aminedeke Alwano Beatrice Group

texts.en:
A. Beatrice is a 35 year old married woman with two children who are attending school and she looks after one dependent who is also attending school. She has sold local brew for 10 years so far. She has learned a lot in her business, most especially how to deal with the customers.

She is using the loan to purchase millet and yeast for making local brew for sale. This is really helping her in paying school fees for her children and it has taken away her stress. She is a hardworking and encouraging woman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase millet and yeast for making local brew for sale

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz was born in 1976. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region in Bala Bahmanli village.

He is married and has one child. 3 years ago he started an engine oil sales business.

Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam P. is from the town of Gracia, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Miriam is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Miriam owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling speciality food products in the local community like longganisa and chorizo. Miriam has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Miriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miriam is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase inventory for her new vacant store & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Miriam from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and help provide the whole family's basic needs. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her new vacant store & working capital

loans.name: Holniso

texts.ru: Шокирова Холнисо – кредитор в Микроинвест уже четвёртый год. Она занимается продажей разных сортов конфет, на рынке Костакоза. Все предыдущие кредиты она погашает своевременно без нарушений. Следующий кредит она хочет использовать для завоза карамели и леденцов.  У неё много постоянных клиентов , которые покупают у неё конфеты. На снимке Холнисо на месте бизнеса .
texts.en:
Holniso S. is in her fourth year borrowing from MicroInvest. She works selling different types of candy at the market in Kostakoz. She has repaid her previous loans on time and without problems. She wants to use this loan for a delivery of caramels and fruit drops. She has many regular customers who buy sweets from her. The picture is of Holniso at her shop.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy candy

loans.name: Akeutu Aswam Akurut Florence Group

texts.en:
A. Florence is a 27-year-old married woman with three children: two of them are going to school and she is taking care of one dependent who is also going to school.

She has been dealing in produce so far for two years. She is using the loan to purchase produce such as millet, maize, beans, ground nuts (peanuts) and simsim (sesame seeds). Her future plan is to work hard and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase produce such as millet, maize, beans, ground nuts and simsim

loans.name: Deiya

texts.en: Deiya W. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables and paste and is requesting a loan to purchase groundnuts (peanuts) to sell. Deiya is 39 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Mahkamboy

texts.ru: Ахмедов Махкамбой парень 24 лет , который занимается вместе с матерью продажей сухофруктов, арахиса , миндаля, фисташек. Он привозит из оптового рынка, по оптовой цене. В основном торгует его мать , т.к. он часто ездит за товаром. Махкамбой  следующий кредит хочет использовать на расширение ассортимента товара. Он планирует привезти арахис высшего сорта, он выглядит крупнее и вкуснее обычного, и пользуется большим спросом.В день мониторинга он был в отъезде за товаром, поэтому на снимке его мать.
texts.en:
Mahkamboy A. is a 24-year-old guy who works with his mother (pictured) selling dried fruit, peanuts, almonds, and pistachios. He buys them at a wholesale market for wholesale prices. Basically, his mother does most of the selling since he is often going out to purchase their goods. Mahkamboy wants to use this loan to expand the variety of goods they offer. He plans on bringing in a premium peanut which is larger and tastier than regular peanuts and is in great demand.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for buying peanuts

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru: Гулрухсор- молодая женщина 26 лет. Образование высшее. Гулрухсор замужем мать 2-х детей. Муж Гулрухор находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Гулрухсор преподает в средней школе, но у нее очень маленькая заработная плата. Поэтому Гулрухсор занимается дополнительно переработкой пряжи и вязанием шерстяных носков. Но полученный кредит она хочет, купит оптом пряжу и переработав продать. Она очень рада, что снами сотрудничает и благодарна  нам.
texts.en:
Gulruhsor is a young 26 year old woman. She has a college education. Gulruhsor is married and is the mother of 2 children. Gulruhsor’s husband is earning money in the Russian Federation. Gulruhsor teaches at a high school, but she has a very small salary. Because of this Gulruhsor also processes yarn and knits wool socks. She would like to use her loan to buy yarn in wholesale quantities and to sell it after processing it. She is very happy that she works with us and is grateful to us.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase yarn

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha M. is currently in the business of selling paste and maize flour and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Asha is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has seven children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for settlement. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Faiziniso

texts.ru: Ахмедова  Файзинисо кредитор в Микроинвест с 2005 года. Имеет бизнес продажи женской одежды. Она проживает в Костакозе, сама водит машину, поэтому без проблем приезжает торговать на рынок « Сомон». Она арендует контейнер для продажи одежды. За товаром ездит в Бишкек сама два раза в месяц. Следующий займ хочет использовать для закупа летних блузок и юбок.
texts.en:
Faiziniso A. has been borrowing from MicroInvest since 2005. She sells women's wear. She lives in Kostakoz, but she is able to drive a car herself and therefore is able to sell at the Somon market without problems. She rents the container from which she sells clothes. She goes to Bishkek twice a month to buy goods. She wants to take out her next loan to buy summer blouses and skirts.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling women's clothes

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy Z. is from the town of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 54 years old, married, and has three adult children. Lucy owns and operates a specialized retail business, primarily selling animal feed and rice in the local community. She also does dressmaking. Lucy has been engaged in her businesses for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Lucy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for her dressmaking and additional capital to expand her retail business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials for her dressmaking and to expand her retail business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en: Laarni is already 31 years old. She is married to Merwin from Barangay Tandul of Cabatuan, Isabela. They are blessed with three children. The eldest is now in high school and her second child is in kindergarten. The family resides in the village of Tandul Cabatuan, Isabela. She has managed both a livestock and a retailing store in their village for about ten years. Through these, Laarni is able to generate around 600 PHP weekly. The amount is already a big help to her children’s growing needs. For her to further develop her businesses, Laarni is requesting a loan amounting to 9,000 PHP that will serve as additional capital for her business.

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Nyoka

texts.en: Nyoka G. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and shoes, and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes and shoes to sell. Nyoka is 39 years old and is married, with a husband that is an army officer. She has 6 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Rayno

texts.ru: Охунова Раъно женщина , которая кредитуется на расширение бизнеса продажи женской одежды. За товаром она ездит в Бишкек раз в месяц. Она торгует в центре Худжанда, поток клиентов постоянный. Для увеличения летних женских блузок , юбок и платьев она решила получить повторный кредит. На снимке Раъно на месте торговли.
texts.en:
Rayno O. is a woman who is borrowing to grow her business selling women’s clothing. She travels for products to Bishkek once a month. She trades in the center of Khujand; the stream of clients is steady. She decided to get another loan to increase her inventory of summer women’s blouses, skirts and dresses. In the photo is Rayno at her place of business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow women's clothing business

loans.name: Hatam

texts.en: Hatam (his relative is pictured) was born in 1964. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in Horadiz town. He is married and has 2 children. He has been in the business of fruit and vegetable sales for 7 years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy fruits and vegetables for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Najeb

texts.en:
Najeb is the son of M.. He lives in Kabul Afghanistan. He is married and has 2 children. He is a tailor and works hard to earn money for the completion of his family’s requirements. He needs to buy a new sewing machine for his shop because he has had many problems during sewing with his old machine. In addition, he wants to enlarge his business and to hire a student to support him in this business.
He wants to take an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani and he is very glad that has the chance to progress.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for expanding tailoring business.

loans.name: Jabe

texts.en: Jabe L. is 32 years old and is married to a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school. Jabe is currently in the business of selling green vegetables and is requesting a loan to purchase smoked fish to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for settlement. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru: Кумри- женщина 38 лет. Замужем мать 3-х детей. Кумри занимается купли продажей скота. Ей помогает муж который привозит скот с Киргизии. Кумри работает в колхозе. Кумри вместе со своей семьей в настоящее время занимаются сбором абрикосов которые продают оптовикам которые вывозят абрикосы и Российскую Федерацию. Из за того что Кумри хотела, купит 2 средних бычка ей не хватало денег она получила свой кредит теперь она купит этих бычков она очень довольна и благодарит нашу организацию за финансовую поддержку
texts.en:
Kumri is a 38 year old woman. She is married and is the mother of 3 children. Kumri purchases and sells livestock. Her husband helps her, he brings livestock from Kirgizstan. Kumri works on a collective farm. Right now, Kumri together with her family is collecting apricots which they sell to wholesalers who transport the apricots to the Russian Federation. Kumri wanted to purchase two bulls, but she did not have enough money; she received her loan and now she can purchase these bulls. She is very glad and is grateful to our organization for the financial support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Akeutu Aswam Adong Pauline Group

texts.en:
Adong P. is 45 years old and married with six children, all schooling. She also looks after one dependent who is also schooling.

She has been dealing in local brew for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase produce such as beans, ground nuts (peanuts), millet, etc. to sell. She is active and encouraging, and her dream is to invest more and more in her business.

loans.use: To purchase produce such as beans, groundnuts, millet, sorghum, etc.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth D. is from the town of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 34 years old. Maribeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maribeth owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from peddling household materials and products such as mats, blankets, plates, etc. in the local community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Maribeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maribeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and for her family's needs.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine J. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to open a bakery. Dorine is 42 years old and is married; her husband is a teacher by profession. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: Akeutu Aswam Apio Scovia Group

texts.en: A. Scovia is 23 years old and married with two children. She deals in local brew and has been in business for 2 years. She will use this loan to purchase yeast and millet for making local brew. She wishes to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To purchase yeast and millet for making local brew

loans.name: Nushaba

texts.en:
Nushaba was born in 1978. She is married and has 2 children. This woman is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan town of Fuzuli. She has settled in the Fuzuli region, in the village of Bala Bahmanli.

Nushaba has run a butcher shop business for 8 years. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy meat to improve her business.

Nushaba's relative is pictured.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Laja

texts.en:
Laja Slender is currently in the business of selling maize flour and is requesting a loan to stock more maize flour to sell. Laja is 29 years old and married; her husband is a nurse. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more flour to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva I. is from the town of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 41 years old. Eva is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a trading business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying cashew nuts and processing them for sale to her established buyer. Eva has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more cashew nuts to process and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Eva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and provide for her family's needs. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Muiddinhoja

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Муиддинходжа мужчина , который кредитуется на расширение бизнеса мужской обуви. Он за товаром ездит сам раз в месяц в Бишкек. Продаёт на обувном рынке Худжанда.
За время кредитования он ни разу не нарушал условий Фонда. Для увеличения летней обуви , он планирует получив кредит съездить и привезти мужские сланцы. Как всем известно Худжанд город солнечный и сдесь очень жарко, поэтому сейчас сезон сланц.
 Поэтому Муидинходжа хочет пополнить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Muiddinhoja is a man who has used credit to expand his men's shoe business. Once a month he makes a buying trip to Bishkek, and sells his goods at the Khujand shoe market. Over the course of his credit history, he has always abided by the terms of his loans. To increase his inventory of summer shoes, he is planning to take out a loan to bring in men's flip flops. As Khujand is a town that is very sunny and hot, and it is now the season for flip flops, Muiddinhoja wants to increase his turnover.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoe sales

loans.name: Gere

texts.en:
Gere L. is currently in the business of selling sandals and is requesting a loan to purchase clothes and earrings to sell. Gere is 29 years old and married; her husband is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a lorry to hire out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and earrings to sell

loans.name: Fatama Group

texts.en: Fatama is the group leader of Fatama group. There are three members in this group. Each member wants to take a loan for expanding her business.  They are requesting a group of loan 42,000 Afghani. Fatama wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store.  Khanm Belqes wants to take a loan for the business of carpet weaving. Fareuda wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. They are very thankful to kiva lenders who can support all poor people.

loans.use: To expand businesses: tailoring, carpet weaving, general store.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
O. Moses is 28 years old. He is a married man blessed with three children, two of whom are schooling. He takes care of his mother with him in his family.

Moses has a retail shop, which he has been operating for over four years. Moses will use this loan to increase his retail stock of sugar, soap, salt, tea leaves, rice, maize flour, millet flour, pet coats, biscuits, etc. He had run short of stock because of his construction process: he used his capital to purchase windows, doors, and cement for completing his house. Now he is restoring the capital with this loan. He is a hardworking businessman whose dream is to create a firm foundation for his children’s education.

loans.use: To restock his retail store

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan Z. is from the town of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 46 years old. Susan is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from peddling cashew nuts, mango,and longganisa; Susan is also a dealer of Avon and personal collections. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Susan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of her family members, such as their daily consumption of rice and viand.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ngor

texts.fr: Ngor  est un boucher   , son étal  est au quartier zone résidentielle de Mbour, ville qui se trouve à quelques 70 km de Mbour. Il est marié et père de trois enfants. Il fait ce métier depuis 7 ans .Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de nourrir sa famille et ses parents restés au village. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite un veut profiter de l’approche de l hivernage moment pendant lequel les moutons se vendent moins chers pour acheter quelques moutons.
texts.en:
Ngor is a butcher and he has a stall in the residential part of Mbour, a town about 70 km from Dakar. He is a married father with three children. He has been working as a butcher for seven years. The revenue generated by his work allows him to feed his family and his parents who stay in the village. With the loan that Ngor is requesting he wants to take advantage of the approaching rainy season when he can buy sheep at a lower price.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Gladys Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Ruth Díaz P. tiene 51 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Superior Incompleta Técnica en Farmacia, tiene  2 hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Gladys se dedica a la Venta de Medicina, coloca inyecciones y hace curaciones de heridas, este negocio se inicio hace 11 años, cuando le dieron un pequeño Botiquín que ella fue implementándolo poco a poco, su negocio es dentro de su casa y sale a hacer curaciones e inyecciones a domicilio.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos como agujas, alcohol, medicina.
El crédito de 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra productos como agujas, alcohol, medicina para implementar su botiquín.
Gladys tiene como sueño tener su Botica comunal para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Gladys Ruth D. P. is 51 year old, and lives in the neighborhood of Asentamiento Humano Victor Raul II, in the district of Porvenir, in the province of Trujillo, in the region of La Libertad, Peru. She started, but did not finish, a graduate program in Pharmacy, and has 2 children that depend on her economically. Ever since she was given a small medicine chest 11 years ago, Gladys has worked selling medicines, administering injections, and dressing wounds. She runs this business out of her home, but also offers house-calls for injections and wound care. She received her first loan of 300 soles from the community bank Lideresas en Accion II, and invested that money in the purchase of products such as needles, alcohol and medicines. She will invest this loan of 800 soles in the same products in order to restock her medicine chest. Gladys' dream is to start a neighborhood pharmacy in order to grow as a small business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of needles, alcohol, medicines, etc.

loans.name: Natama

texts.en:
Natama S. is currently in the business of selling fruits like mangoes and bananas. She is requesting a loan to buy a moto bike to transport her fruits to the market. Natama is 37 years old and is married; her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase a moto bike to tranport her fruits to the market

loans.name: Farzana Muhammad Anwar Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz Baji and Latifan Baji each want a loan to buy auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 
Shagufta Baji wants a loan to buy a digital camera for her movie making business.
Nasreen Baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread, cloth) for her decorative embroidery business.

Farzana Baji is the wife of M. A. who has resided in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 8 years. Her husband runs a clothes selling business. He buys clothes from the famous markets of Lahore named “Ichra and Anarkali” and sells to the clothes shops and earns income. Farzana Baji helps him by selling his clothes in the community and she also handles her sewing business. She sews clothes to pay off the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy clothes to increase the clothes selling business of her husband.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ahrordjon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Акилов Ахрорджон мужчина, который кредитуется в Микроинвест уже несколько лет. И использует займы на пополнение своего товарооборота дисками. Следующий займ хочет потратить на завоз дисков Российских фильмов и клип концертов. Также хочет увеличить свой прилавок видеокассетами. Следующий займ он получит с «Арванда»
texts.en:
Ahrordjon A. is a man and has been taking out loans at MicroInvest for several years. He uses the loans to fill up his inventory of DVDs. He wants to use his next loan to bring in DVDs with Russian films and concerts. He also wants to increase the inventory of VHS tapes. He will receive his next loan from Arvand.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand.” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of DVDs and tapes

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
La señora María Julia R. Díaz tiene 23 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene  1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
María se dedica al Alquiler de CD y DVD, este negocio se inicio hace 3 meses, gracias al préstamo de la ONG Manuela R. su negocio se desarrolla dentro de su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos como CD Y DVD.
El crédito de 400 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de CD Y DVD para implementar su negocio ya que es su único sustenta económico de su hija y la socia porque es madre soltera.
 María  tiene como sueño tener su Internet y venta y/o alquiler de CD Y DVD para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Maria Julia R. D. is 23 years old, and lives in the neighborhood of Asentamiento Humano Victor Raul II, in the district of Porvenir, in the province of Trujillo, in the region of La Libertad, Peru. She finished high school, and has 1 child who depends on her economically. Thanks to a loan from an NGO, she has been able to run a CD and DVD rental business out of her home for the past 3 months. She received her first loan from the community bank Lideresas en Accion II, and invested the money in the purchase of CDs and DVDs. She will invest this loan of 400 soles in buying more CDs and DVDs in order to expand her business since she is a single mother and this is the only source of income she has to support herself and her daughter. Maria's dream is to have an internet cafe and to sell and/or rent CDs and DVDs in order to grow as a small businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Otuchopi 2 Asemo Ruth Group

texts.en:
A. Ruth is 45 years old and is widowed with seven children, all schooling. She also looks after three dependents and they are schooling, too.

A. Ruth has been in the business of making local brew for over 20 years which has supported her in educating her children. She is using the loan to purchase sorghum, millet and yeast for making more local brew. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to work very hard and invest in other sectors besides her current business.

loans.use: To purchase sorghum, millet and yeast for making local brew

loans.name: Rukhsana Muhammad Shahid Group

texts.en:
Sarfraz begum baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

Seemi baji wants a loan to buy bangles to sell.

Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and clothes) for her decorative embroidery business.

Risalat baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Rukhsana baji, wife of M. S., has lived in a city named Lahore, Pakistan, for the past nine years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods.

Her husband has been an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver for the past three years. Rukhsana baji is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw because it’s creating problems and its repair has become essential.

loans.use: To repair her husband's auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Osim

texts.ru:
MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


 Ахмедов Осим мужчина, занимающийся продажей мужской обуви. Он торгует на рынке Худжанда. Все свои кредиты он использует на увеличение ассортимента товаров. Он продаёт модную мужскую обувь. Для завоза летней мужской обуви он решил получить повторный кредит. Его удовлетворяют все условия организации «Арванд».
texts.en:
Osim A. is a man who sells mens shoes. He sells on the market of Khudjand. He uses all his loans to increase the variety of his inventory. The shoes which he sells are modern. To bring in summer shoes he decided to take out another loan. He is very satisfied with the terms of Arvand organization.

MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of mens shoes

loans.name: Maria Neidi

texts.es:
La señora María Neidi A. M. tiene 42 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene  2 hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
María se dedica a la Elaboración de peinados, ondulaciones y cortes de cabello también a la crianza de animales como cuyes, patos, este negocio se inicio hace15 años, su negocio se desarrolla dentro de su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos como liquido para ondulaciones, tintes.
El crédito de 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra productos como  liquido para ondulaciones, tintes y un espejo para su salón de belleza.
María  tiene como sueño tener su Salón de Belleza para crecer como microempresaria
texts.en:
María Neidi A. M. is 42 years old, and lives in the Víctor Raúl II settlement of the Porvenir district of La Libertad, Perú. She finished her Secondary School education, and has 2 children that rely on her for financial support. María dedicates herself to styling, perming and cutting hair, as well as to raising livestock such as cuyes (guinea pigs) and ducks. She has had this business, which she runs out of her home, for 15 years. She invested the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from her cooperative bank Leaders in Action II into buying hair products such as perm solutions and hair dyes. The loan of 800 soles will be invested into more such products, as well as a mirror for her beauty salon. María’s dream is to open a beauty salon so she can grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair styling products such as perm solutions and dyes, and a mirror for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Nafissatou

texts.fr: Nafissatou vend des habiles  dans la cité touristique de Saly située à 80km de Dakar le capitale sénégalaise.les boubous qu’elle confectionne sont vendus aussi bien sur place que dans les pays limitrophes. Elle est âgée de 45 ans, elle est mariée et vit avec son époux et ses enfants. Les revus titrés de son activité plus permettent d’une part de renforcer son activité et d’autre part de soutenir son mari dans les dépenses du ménage. Pour la confection de nouveaux modèles elle sollicite un prêt.
