texts.en:
Nafissatou sells clothes in the tourist city of Saly about 80km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She makes boubous (long robes or dresses typically worn in West Africa) that are sold both locally and in neighboring countries. Nafissatou is 45 years old, married and she lives with her husband and children. The revenue generated by her work allows her, on the one hand to improve her business, and on the other hand to support her husband with the household expenses. She is requesting a loan in order to design some new boubous.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Razia Muhammad Siddique Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a wife of M. S. who has lived in the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 10 years. She is a very hardworking lady. She prepares embroidered dresses for her neighbors and earns money. She uses her money when needed. Her husband is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver. He has been in this profession for the past 3 years. Lately its engine has created problems and its repair has become essential, therefore Razia baji is requesting for a loan of Pak Rs. 15,000/.

Madiha S. baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).
Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy iron to sell. 
Musarat baji wants a loan to buy books (religious and funny books) for her book shop. 
Naziran baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
La señora Águeda P. A. tiene 52 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria Incompleta, no tiene  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Águeda se dedica a la Venta de Golosinas también a cocinar para el Comedor Popular de los Wawasis, este negocio se inicio hace 5 años, su negocio se desarrolla en afueras de la Posta Médica.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos como galletas, caramelos, frutas.
El crédito de 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra productos como  galletas, caramelos, frutas.
Águeda  tiene como sueño tener su Bodega para crecer como microempresaria
texts.en:
Águeda P. A. is 52 years old, and lives in the Víctor Raúl II settlement of the Porvenir district, in La Libertad, Perú. She did not complete her primary school education, and does not have any children that depend on her financially. Águeda dedicates herself to selling snacks/sweets, and also cooks for the Popular Cafeteria of the Wawasis. She started her business 5 years ago, which she runs outside a medical post. She invested the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from her cooperative bank Leaders in Action II into the purchase of products such as cookies, caramels, fruits. She will invest the loan of 800 soles into the purchase of the same types of products, cookies, caramels, fruits. Águeda’s dream is to have a grocery store, so she can grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products such as cookies, caramels, fruits.

loans.name: Rafiqan Mairaj-Ud-Din Group

texts.en:
Rafiqan baji is the wife of M. and lives in a city called Lahore, Pakistan where she has lived for the past eight years. Lahore is famous for its history and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband runs a Punjabi food selling business. He sells dahi bhalas and samosas, which are Punjabi foods. He has been in this business for the last three years. The high quality of his food earns him more customers. Rafiqan baji operates an embroidery business to share the financial burden with her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for the food selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Khalida baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Shakeela baji wants a loan to buy material (leather and nails) for her shoe making business. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Bushra baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

The members mutually guarantee each others' loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for food selling business

loans.name: Otuchopi 2 Akwir Beatrice Group

texts.en:
A. Beatrice is a 25-year-old single businesswoman; she has five children, all going to school.

She has been dealing in her business of manufacturing local brew since 2001. She is using the loan to purchase millet and yeast for making local brew for sale. Her business has enabled her to take care of her family and pay her children’s school fees. Her future dream is to purchase a plot of land and construct a residential house.

loans.use: To purchase millet and yeast for making local brew

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora María Elizabeth C. V. tiene 32 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria Completa,  tiene  2 hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
María se dedica al Alquiler de Cochera de Carros y Mototaxis también a cocinar para el Comedor Popular de los Wawasis, este negocio se inicio hace 5 años, su negocio se desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra de ladrillos para cercar la cochera.
El crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra ladrillos y pagar mano de obra para incrementar el espacio de la cochera.
María  tiene como sueño tener su cochera más amplia para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
María Elizabeth C. V. is 32 years old, and lives in the Víctor Raúl II settlement of the Porvenir district, in La Libertad, Perú. She completed her primary school education, and has 2 children that depend on her financially. María dedicates herself to car rentals and mototaxis, and also cooks for the Popular Cafeteria of the Wawasis. She started her business 5 years ago, which she manages from her house. She invested the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from her cooperative bank Leaders in Action II into the purchase of bricks to enclose her garage. She will invest the loan of 300 soles to pay for bricks and manual labor to enlarge her garage. María’s dream is to have a larger garage, so she can grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of bricks and to pay for manual labor to make her garage bigger.

loans.name: Enisa

texts.en:
Enisa Kišić was born in 1968 and comes from the suburbs of Tuzla. She has two children: her son is 19  and daughter is 15. Enisa`s husband works as a driver for a gasoline company.

Enisa is employed as a seller in a local grocery store. Besides that, she grows vegetables in her garden and breeds chickens. She is one of our longer-term clients: she has already repaid two loans which were invested in her poultry business.

Enisa requested her third loan from WWI (Žene za Žene International) in the amount of 1,000 KM to purchase chickens and poultry feed. Enisa sells chicken meat through the store where she works and also to her repeat clients. In this way she provides more household income for her family and thus an easier life.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and poultry feed

loans.name: Dilara

texts.en:
Dilara A. is 54 years old. She is married with two children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age.

For about 11 years she has been purchasing young sheep from the local market, fattening them, and then selling them. Dilara is very hard-working, and her diligence is incredible. She looks for ways to provide extra income for her home. Dilara wakes up early every morning to feed her sheep. She is supporting her children with education. She is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy 10 sheep and fodder to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Agamahammad

texts.en:
Agamahammad M. is 48 years old, and a dedicated father who is responsible for his wife and three children.

Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Agamahammad has become a very successful businessman. He has a friendly family who always try to help each other. Thus his wife helps him with his business.

He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle: cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now Agamahammad wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. With this goal in mind, Agamahammad is requesting a loan of 1200 USD that will serve as business capital. The profits he will make from this business will allow him to improve the living conditions of his household and also make some investments.

Agamahammad thanks all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Razia Allah Ditta Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji wants a loan to buy decorative pieces to sell.

Rashda baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Sugran baji wants a loan to buy material (clothes, colored thread and beads) for her decorative embroidery business.

Irshad baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

Razia baji is the group leader of these ladies listed above. They all live in Lahore, Pakistan. Razia baji is a very hardworking lady. She runs a clothes selling business in the community. She buys clothes from the city of Multan at cheap prices and sells to the clothing shops and her community. Razia baji does this work to support her family and to have an independent life. Her husband runs a business selling artificial jewelry. He sells jewelry sets to the jewelry shops of the main markets of Lahore, Ichra and AnarkA.. Razia baji is applying for a loan to buy jewelry sets to expand her husband’s business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy artificial jewelry sets to sell

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.es:
La señora Baltazara R. R. D. Z. tiene 39 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria Completa,  tiene  3 hijos que depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Baltazara se dedica a la Venta D. Ropa, este negocio se inicio hace 3años, su negocio se desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra D. ropa como buzos, ropa interior, polos, camisas.
El crédito D. 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. ropa como buzos, ropa interior, polos, camisas.
Baltazara tiene como sueño tener su Tienda D. Ropa para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Baltazara R. R. D. Z. is 39 years old, and lives in a neighborhood called Asentamiento Humano Victor Raul II, in the Porvenir district of the Trujillo province, in the state of La Libertad, Peru.

She finished primary school and has three children who depend on her economically. Baltazara has been selling clothing from her home for the past three years.

Her first loan of 300 soles (Peruvian currency) that she received from the communal bank Lideresas en Accion II, was used to purchase clothing such as sportswear, undergarments, polo shirts, and t-shirts. She will use this current loan to purchase the same types of merchandise.

Baltazara’s dream is to own her own clothing store in order to grow as a small business entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing articles like sportswear, undergarments, polo shirts, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Safia Bano Abdul Ghafoor Group

texts.en:
Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine.

Rubina baji wants a loan to buy chairs, tables and table covers for her catering business.

Farzana baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

Safia bano baji is the group leader of the ladies listed above. Her husband, A. G., runs a sanitary supplies business. She is a very sensitive and caring lady, so she helps her husband by arranging the supplies, which it makes it easier for her husband to find the things. She is applying for a loan to buy sanitary supplies (taps and pipes) to expand her husband’s sanitary business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy sanitary supplies to sell

loans.name: Aterei C Auma Jennifer Group

texts.en:
A. Jennifer is 35 years old and married with five children who are all schooling. She makes bricks for sale. She has been in this business for 4 years.

She will use this loan to purchase a bicycle to simplify her movements to the base where she makes her bricks, and to pay the workers who help her make the bricks, load and offload them, and transport them to convenient places for sale. She is active and hardworking, and her dream is to work hard to improve the productivity of her business and her farm.

loans.use: Purchase a bicycle and pay her workers

loans.name: Razia Rafiq Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones to sell. 
Zarqa baji wants a loan to buy iron for making iron rods to sell. 
Munawar baji wants a loan to buy items (chairs, tables and table covers) for her catering business. 
Nusrat begum baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. 

My name is Razia and I am the group leader of these above-mentioned ladies. My members and I reside in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. My husband’s name is Mr. R.. He is a mechanic and repairs vehicles in a motor workshop. I operate a business sewing clothes to support my husband. My husband wants to start his own motor workshop. I am requesting a loan so that my husband is able to buy repairing tools to start the motor workshop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy motor repairing tools.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 
Усмонова Шоира женщина . которая торгует на рынке Худжанда детской одеждой. Она привозит товар из Истаравшана и Бишкека. Для завоза летних детских футболок и шорт она решила получить повторный кредит. Она за время кредитования ни разу не подводила организацию.
texts.en:
Shoira U. is a woman who sells children's clothing on the market of Khujand. She brings the merchandise from Istaravshan and Bishkek. She decided to get a new loan to bring in children's summer t-shirts and shorts. During her credit history she has never let our organization down.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand.” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand retail business of children's clothing

loans.name: Aterei C Aanyu Helen Group

texts.en:
A. Helen is 46 years of age. She is a widow with eight children schooling and, in addition, she takes care of three dependents. She deals in produce: groundnuts (peanuts), sorghum, etc. So far, she has been three years in her business.

Helen is using the loan to purchase more produce such as groundnuts and sorghum for sale. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is improving her farm productivity and purchasing a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase produce such as groundnuts and sorghum for sale

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thủy Thị Đào was born in 1971 (no. 010107010006). She lives with her husband and 2 children, one is going to school. Her husband is a driver. Her family has an income of about 2,500,000 VND. She was believed by everybody in her village. Besides housework, she also attends in social work and she is a group leader. She wants to borrow 3,270,000 VND (185 USD) to breed pigs and poultry. There are 4 other Fund participants in her group: 

Mai Thị B. Nguyễn was born in 1983 (no. 010107010008). She is a worker. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND (350 USD) to repair her house.

Thanh Thị Như Nguyễn was born in 1960 (no. 010107010009). She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (280 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

May Thị Nguyễn was born in 1954 (no. 010107010007). She wants to borrow 1,962,000 VND (110 USD) to buy vegetables for reselling in the market.

Luật Thị Nguyễn was born in 1950 (no. 010107010107). She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (280 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To breed pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman S. is an ordinary man in the district of Agsu in Azerbaijan. He is a very responsible person who, since his youth, has been running a livestock farm with the goal of supporting his family, his wife and three children.

Elman needs to purchase calves to raise them and maximize his profits by selling their milk and meat. Once he has these products from his flock he sells them in his neighborhood and in this manner he is able to support his family. For this reason, Elman is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Santos Claudina

texts.es:
La señora Santos Claudina M. G.  tiene 44 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria Incompleta,  tiene  3 hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Santos se dedica a bodega también vende pan, este negocio se inicio hace 3años, su negocio se desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra de Productos como arroz, azúcar, golosinas, galletas, gaseosas y cerveza.
El crédito de 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de Productos como arroz, azúcar, golosinas, galletas, gaseosas y cerveza.
Santos tiene como sueño tener su minimarket para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Santos Claudina M. G. is 44 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Asentamiento Humano Victor Raul II, in the Porvenir district of the Trujillo province, in the state of La Libertad, Peru.

She attended elementary school but did not finish, and has three children who depend on her economically. Santos has been running a grocery store and selling bread from her home for the past three years.

Her first loan of 300 soles (Peruvian currency) that she received from the communal bank Lideresas en Accion II, was used to purchase products like rice, sugar, sweets, cookies, soda and beer. This loan of 800 soles will be used to purchase the same types of merchandise.

Santos’ dream is to own her own minimarket in order to grow as a small business entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products like rice, sugar, sweets, cookies, soda and beer.

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil A. is 24 years old, single and lives with his parents.

Jamil sells confectionery and other food items in the market and has been in this business already for eight years. This activity generates the main income for his family.

Since Jamil is very popular in the market selling fresh and tasty products, he tries to maintain a wide variety of goods. Today Jamil requests 2000 USD to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. The loan will greatly improve his income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for his market.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
La señora María Marta Julián Gutiérrez tiene 55 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Superior Completa  ella es Profesora de Primaria, tiene 1 nieto que depende económicamente de ella.
María se dedica a la Venta de esteras, madera este negocio se inicio hace 15 años, su negocio se desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra de Productos como esteras, madera de Guayaquil.
El crédito de 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de Productos como esteras, madera de Guayaquil.
María tiene como sueño tener su ferretería  para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Marta J. G. is 55 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Asentamiento Humano Victor Raul II, in the Porvenir district of the Trujillo province, in the state of La Libertad, Peru.

She finished college and is a primary school teacher. She has one grandson who depends on her economically. Maria has been selling mats and wood from her home for the past 15 years.

Her first loan of 300 soles (Peruvian currency) that she received from the communal bank Lideresas en Accion II, was used to purchase mats and wood from Guayaquil. This loan of 800 soles will be used to purchase the same kind of products.

Maria’s dream is to own her own hardware store in order to grow as a small business entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mats and wood

loans.name: Du's Group

texts.en:
Dụ Thị Lưu was born in 1960. (no: 010102040015). Every day, she buys seafood to resell in the market.  She lives at Nhoi Duoi village, Dong Anh district, Ha Noi city. She has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 VND. She wants to increase her income. So, she needs 2.204.000 VND (or 125 USD) to buy more seafood to sell.
Besides Ms Hường, Thị Đỗ also attends in her group. (no: 010102040016). She wants to borrow 1.972.000 VND (or 110 USD) to buy furniture for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sea food to sell.

loans.name: Yrma Alvina

texts.es:
La señora Yrma Alvina R. Rodríguez tiene 49 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Superior Incompleta, tiene 1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Yrma se dedica a la Crianza y Venta de animales menores, madera este negocio se inicio hace 20 años, su negocio se desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invertirá  en la compra de animales menores como cuyes, pollos, patos también hace eventos como polladas para vender.
Yrma tiene como sueño tener granja para  Vender animales por mayor y menor para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Yrma Alvina R. Rodríguez is 49 years old. She lives in the Victor Raúl II human settlement, Porvenir district, Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Perú.

She studied in, but did not complete, a higher education. She has one daughter who depends on her economically.

Yrma raises and sells young animals. She began this business 20 years ago. She runs her business from home.

The first loan of 300 soles that she received from her community bank, Lideres en Acción II (Leaders in Action II), will be invested in young animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and also ducks. She has events such as polladas (neighborhood barbeques) to sell her chicken.

Yrma dreams to have a farm from which to sell her animals by retail and in bulk and to grow as a small business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy young animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and also ducks and have polladas (neighborhood barbeques) to sell her chicken.

loans.name: Gairat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


 


Гайрат мужчина – кредитор в организации несколько лет. Он сам работает специалистом в юстиции города Худжанда. Кроме этого он имеет бизнес продажи велосипедов, вешалок для одежды, маленьких телевизоров. Он привозит товар из Китая , раз в  месяц или раз в два месяца. Он хочет на полученый кредит привезти ещё телевизоры и магнитофоны.
texts.en:
Gairat is a man who has been taking out loans with our organization for several years. He works as a specialist in the justice department of the town of Khujand. Besides that he has a business selling bicycles, clothes hangers and small television sets. He brings the merchandise from China once or twice a month. He wants to use this loan to bring in more televisions and music players.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand.” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of bicycles and other items

loans.name: Huyen's Group

texts.en:
Huyền Thị Nguyễn was born in 1952 (no. 010102080014). She has 4 children. She sells clothes in the market. Her husband raises pigs and grows vegetables at home. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. She wants to expand her business. She needs 4,142,000 VND (235 USD) to buy more clothes to sell in the market. Besides Huyền, Ms. Thuận Thị Nguyễn also attends this group.

Thuận Thị Nguyễn was born in 1970 (no. 010102080015).  She has 2 children. She is a dressmaker. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (235 USD) to buy material to make clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell in the market.

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Hằng Thị Hoàng was born in 1971 (no: 010102080018). She has a shop. She sells noodle soup. She has 3 children. Her husband is a worker. She wants to expand her shop, but she hasn’t enough money. She needs 6,758,000 VND (or 380 USD) to buy a chair and table for her shop. She is a group leader, too. There are 2 other Fund participants in her group.

Khuyên Thị Nguyễn was born in 1968 (no: 010102080017). She has a bazaar at home. She has a daughter. She makes an averge monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She needs 5,886,000 VND (or 330 USD) to buy goods for her bazaar.

Hường Thị Nguyễn was born in 1948 (no: 010102080005). She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (or 300 USD) to buy building materials to resell.

loans.use: To buy chair and table for her shop

loans.name: Elisa Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Elisa Margarita L. G. tiene 54 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella no tiene estudios, tiene 1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Elisa se dedica a la Crianza de aves también teje y lo vende en las ferias semanales de la sierra, este negocio se inicio hace 15 años, su negocio se desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra cuyes, patos, pollos.
El crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de lanas de diferentes colores y gruesor para tejer chompas, ropones.
Elisa tiene como sueño tener  granja de animales para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Elisa Margarita L. G. is 54 and lives in the el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II Etapa, in the Porvenir District, Trujillo Province, La Libertad Department, Peru. She has no education, and has one dependent daughter. She earns her living raising birds and knitting, and sells her products in the weekly fairs in La Sierra. She started her business 15 years ago, and she works from her home. Elisa used her first loan, 300 soles that she received from Lideresas en Acción II (Women Leaders in Action II) Village Bank, to buy guinea pigs, ducks, and chickens. She plans to use this loan of 500 soles to buy wools in different colors and widths to knit sweaters and christening gowns. She dreams of having an animal farm so she can grow as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wools in different colors and widths to knit sweaters and christening gowns.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hồng Thị Nguyễn was born in 1961. (no: 010102080004). She lives with her husband and 2 children in Pho Cho – Co Loa- Dong Anh-Ha Noi. Every morning, she gets up early to sell  bread.  But, her main job is farming. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND (or 380 USD) to invest in a small business.

loans.use: to invest in small business.

loans.name: Bakhriddin

texts.en:
B. Bakhriddin is a gentleman who has dedicated himself to the business of farming and livestock for the past 3 years. He is married and has a daughter. Currently he is faced with the need to invest in the purchase of cattle. For this simple reason he is seeking the support of IMON International to obtain a loan for the purchase of cattle to sell. Bakhriddin is grateful to everyone supporting him.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle for developing business.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
B. Rustam is 45 years old. He is married and has 5 children. Rustam sells foodstuff in his grocery. He has been in this business already for 12 years. This activity generates the main income for Rustam's family. Rustam is very popular in his community for providing fresh products daily for sale. He tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today Rustam requests 7000 Somoni for expanding the range of foodstuff in his grocery.

loans.use: Purchasing inventory for food market.

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en: The need to improve his income and provide education to his five, dear children are the reasons Komiljon is courteously requesting this loan. Komiljon is a very responsible and hardworking father who, for many years, was dedicated to the business of buying and selling shoes. Komiljon has so far accessed loans from IMON International seven times and has seen his business expand. With the income, he said he was able to educate his children as it is the most important thing for him. Today Komiljon is requesting a loan of 2,500 Somoni to expand his business so that he can generate more income for the well-being of his family. He is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan. loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sale of cement and construction supplies

loans.name: Ahmadkul

texts.en:
G. Ahmadkul, 46, is married and has five children. He lives in Tursunzade and works in the agricultural industry. Six years ago he started to cultivate land that he owned to generate more income to support his family.

Ahmadkul grows wheat, corn and vegetables. He will use the loan to improve his yield. Ahmadkul enjoys his job and he will continue to use loans to improve his farm and become a better farmer.

loans.use: Purchasing the seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr:
Née le 31/12/1978 à Aklakou, madame A. Kokoè demeure aujourd’hui à Aklakou avec sa famille. Avec trois personnes à charges, elle exerce comme activité la vente de produits de premières nécessités et de produits de ménage depuis six (06) ans. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ces enfants.
Depuis un certain un temps elle assiste à une augmentation de sa clientèle mais par faute de moyens financiers, elle est incapable de satisfaire leur demande. Pour répondre à cet état de fait, elle sollicite un crédit pour accroitre le niveau de ses commandes. Ceci lui permettra de répondre aux besoins de sa  clientèle et d’améliorer considérablement son niveau de vie, celui de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1978 in Aklakou, Mrs. A. Kokoè still lives in Aklakou with her family. As the breadwinner for 3 people, she has been selling staple goods and household products for six years. This activity permits her to cover the needs of her children. For quite some time, she has been seeing her clientele grow, but because she lacks financial means, she is not capable of satisfying their demand. To respond to this situation, she is requesting a loan so that she can place more orders. This will allow her to satisfy the needs of her clientele, considerably improve her standard of living and that of her family, and reimburse her loan within 12 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of staple goods and household products

loans.name: Karomatullo

texts.en:
Karomatullo H. is a married father of three children. He has a large and friendly family. For 10 years he has been engaged in farming. Love for his children is the motor that keeps him working hard for their future. He works with his wife to achieve quality products.

The high prices of fertilizer have caused his production to slow down. He wishes to do better, to increase the number of hectares with crops. To do it, Karomatullo requests a loan and hopes that you can help him. This way he can look forward to a profitable crop to increase his income and pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sale of staple goods

loans.name: Aterei F Asio Helen Group

texts.en:
Helen A. is 36 year old, married, with nine children. She has been in her business for three years. Helen requests a loan to purchase veterinary drugs for livestock, to meet her customers’ demands.

She also advises people about livestock. Her future dream is to purchase a motorcycle so she can be of better service to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase veterinary drugs to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.name: Inomkul

texts.en:
Inomkul J. is 42 years old, married and the father of four children. Inomkul is an optimistic, hardworking man. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so it produces excellent vegetables. Inomkul has been in the agri-business for more than 10 years. His loving wife is also engaged to the business. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time taking job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest.

He is planning to fix his house and save enough money for the well being of his family. He requests a loan of $1250 USD. Inomkul appeals to your generous heart for a swift contribution.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Askarboy

texts.en:
Askarboy K. is a simple farmer with simple dreams – to uplift his family’s economic life and to send his dearest children to university.

Farming has been his major source of income. Askarboy produces wheat, onion and watermelon. He requests a loan of $1250 to support his business and to avoid asking credits from traders with higher interest rates. He is grateful that is able to borrow from lenders that offer low interest to become free from poverty.

Askarboy says that through prayers and hard work, his dreams can be achieved someday. Providing his children with an education is one of the important things that Askarboy prioritizes.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Aterei F Aanyu Mary Group

texts.en:
A. Mary is 21 years old and married with three children of which one is schooling.

Mary operates a retail shop and sells fish, so far for two years. She is using the loan to purchase retail stock such as sugar, rice, millet flour, soap, matchboxes, cooking oil and smoked fish for sale. She hopes for improvement in her business and her future plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock such as sugar, rice, millet flour, soap, matchboxes, cooking oil and smoked fish

loans.name: Samaddin

texts.en:
Samaddin A. is a hardworking business owner from Agsu, Azerbaijan, who has a business selling men’s clothes. He has been running his business already for eighteen years and has gained much experience. Samaddin is married and has two sons. His business has become the main source of income for his family.

Samaddin has requested a loan of $1,500 to add to his working capital. His business is growing and the financial assistance will help him to continue operating successfully and support his family.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal clothes to sell

loans.name: Eshpulot

texts.en: K. Eshpulot is the married father of three children. He produces tomatoes and cucumbers which he plants once a year. His wife is a teacher in a local school. To help meet the hard physical labor of his farming work, one of his elder children is working with him. Rice growing is his main source of earning income to sustain his family’s living conditions. Eshpulot is applying for a loan to buy seed and fertilizer. This fund will ensure the economic prosperity of this friendly family. loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To dye and sell pagnes

loans.name: Oumy Gueye

texts.fr: oumy gueye N. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis 2004.elle habite en face du marche mais exerce son activite de couturiere au sein meme du marche qui se trouve non loin de la caisse.ce credit de 150 000 lui permettra d'acquerir une nouvelle machine a coudre afin de mieux repondre aux besoins de sa clientele.l'augmentation de ses revenus pourra l'aider a ameliorer ses conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Oumy Gueye N. has been a member of the Yoff credit union since 2004. She lives opposite the market, but has her place of business in the heart of the market which is not far from the credit union. This loan of 150,000 will permit her to acquire a new sewing machine so that she can better respond to the needs of her clientele. The increase in her income will help her to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a new sewing machine

loans.name: Aybaniz

texts.en:
Aybaniz B. is 52. Currently, she, together with her husband, dedicates herself to her livestock business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the region. She is the mother of eight children who she cares for and has the responsibility of educating.

It’s important to note that Aybaniz is very conscious of her duty to support her family financially. It’s for this reason that she turned to AqroInvest Credit Union to obtain a $1,200 loan to purchase cattle to help her increase her income. With your help, she will be able to make her business succeed and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase two cattle

loans.name: Aterei F Acham Monica Group

texts.en:
A. Monica is 28 years old and married with six children, all schooling. She has been making bricks, selling fish and groundnuts (peanuts) for over three years.

She is using the loan to purchase firewood for burning the bricks, to pay workers, and to buy smoked fish and groundnuts for sale. Through her business, she has obtained some poultry and her family’s standard of living is improving. Her future plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for burning the bricks, to pay workers and to buy smoked fish and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Saifiddin

texts.en: K. Saifiddin is 25 years old, married, and has a little child. He is a villager in Istaravshan town in Northern Tajikistan. He and his brother are farmers who own 0.8 hectares (2 acres) of land that they use to cultivate vegetables. On their plantation, they now face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to buy seeds and fertilizer. So, Saifiddin decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Be an important part of the well-being of this young and noble family. loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sale of staple goods and foodstuffs

loans.name: Aterei F Asire Christine Group

texts.en:
A. Christine is a 28-year-old single businesswoman with three children of whom one is in school. She has owned a restaurant and sold fish for, so far, two years.

Christine is using the loan to purchase smoked fish to sell and food for her restaurant such as sweet potatoes, cassava, millet flour, beans, meat, etc. She is a hardworking businesswoman who encourages others to work. Her dream is to obtain livestock.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish to sell and food for her restaurant

loans.name: Mirzaga

texts.en:
The fact that Mirzaga S. is a hard-working person has allowed him over many years to earn enough income to support his four children. Together with his wife, Mirzaga is devoted to the raising of animals, especially cows which he buys and sells in his local market. In this manner, he obtains the income that he needs.

In order to increase his income and revitalize his business, Mirzaga is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase young cattle. This purchase will enable him to increase his sales, earn more, and meet the needs of his children.

loans.use: To purchase four calves.

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Tony is a 20-year-old man. He has owned a clothing store for the past year. Today, Tony is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase new clothes to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en:
Elkhan B. is 37 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Elkhan has been a cattle breeder since 1999. He tells us that he comes from a farming family and that he does very well, financially, because he takes good care of his animals. At the same time, he works as a fireman. 
His wife is his biggest supporter. She helps him in anything she can and takes good care of him and the house. With this loan, he would like to expand his herd of cattle. This is fundamental as summer season is coming and wedding parties are starting, the demand for meat is very high. The loan will greatly improve Elkhan’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 24 year-old man living in Al Chiyyah, Mount Lebanon. He has owned a car mechanic repair shop since 2006. Today Ali is requesting to borrow $1,000 in order to buy a car scanner for the shop.

loans.use: To buy a car scanner

loans.name: Radim

texts.en:
Radim S. is in the livestock business. He breeds livestock, which provides sustenance for his humble home. Radim is single and lives with his parents. It's important to note that since he started his business, he has acquired an abundance of experience and knowledge because of his great dedication to breeding his animals.

Radim is looking for a loan of 1200 USD to purchase livestock to sell in order to continue with his arduous work with cattle in his sector.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 55 year-old married man with 2 children living in Keter Maya, Mount Lebanon. He has owned a mini market since 2000. Today Omar is hoping to borrow $1,200 to be able to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Aterei B Atim Grace Group

texts.en: Grace A., 26 and married with two children, one of whom is attending school, has owned a retail shop selling basics such as soap, sugar, beans, maize flour, etc. for over three years. She is requesting the loan to purchase sugar, soap, beans, maize flour, salt, millet flour, rice, etc. to meet customer demand. Active and hardworking, Grace believes the loan will increase her stock; her future plan is to open a big shop in town.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap, beans, maize flour, salt, millet flour, rice, etc. to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en: Sevil K. has worked in the agricultural field since she was young. Her parents instilled in her the value of hard work, an ethic which she demonstrates today. She buys and sells cattle and, in this manner, earns income for her family. Sevil does not have a lot of confidence in agricultural production, so she has now opted to devote her time to raising animals. She hopes to improve the rearing conditions of her young animals and in this way improve her living situation. For this reason she is seeking a loan of $1200. Sevil is married and has two sons who are her everything.

loans.use: To purchase two cows.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem, a 25-year-old man living in Haret Hreik, Mount Lebanon, has been a baker since 2006, with four years of previous experience. Today, Kassem is hoping to borrow $1,200 in order to buy new tools.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his bakery.

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en: Rafiqa M. is a married mother of three children. Her husband works as a farmer, and she has been helping him for the last 18 years. Rafiqa has a small piece of land upon which she cultivates wheat and corn. Her business has helped give her children an education, and she wishes to continue working so she can take care of them while they live with her. Rafiqa is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Rafiqa and her family thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en: Wassim, a 29-year-old man living in Makseh, Bekaa Valley, has owned a car repair shop since 2008. Today, Wassim would like to borrow $1,200 to buy a new machine to be able to better service his clients.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for the business.

loans.name: Thierno

texts.fr: thierno T. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis 2007.il habite dans le quartier de yoff mbenguenne.il evolue dans le domaine du commerce et mene une activite orientee vers la vente de vaisselle et d'ustensiles de cuisine divers.ce credit de 250 000 lui permettra d'augmenter son fond de roulement pour renforcer le stock de son magasin.
texts.en:
Thierno T. has been a member of the Yoff credit union since 2007. He lives in the Yoff Mbenguenne neighborhood. He is a budding entrepreneur and has a business oriented towards selling dishes and various kitchen utensils. This loan of 250,000 will allow him to increase his working capital to bolster the inventory of his little store.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to his inventory

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en:
Rafiqa K. is an active entrepreneur, selling clothing for men. She has a circle of loyal clients and a variety of merchandise in her shop. She has gained rich experience working in this sphere of trade for the last five years.

All of Rafiqa 's business endeavors have been characterized by commitment and reliability. She tries to please each of her customers’ tastes and is always seeking to expand the assortment of inventory she offers for sale in her shop. She started this business on her own, but now her children are actively helping her to run this family venture.

Today Rafiqa is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to re-stock her inventory and to continue expanding her trade.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Aterei B Akello Florence Group

texts.en: A. Florence is 40-years old, married, and has seven children (five of whom are school-aged). She takes care of two additional dependents, one of whom is school-aged. She deals in poultry, selling chickens locally. She has been in her business for three years. She is using the loan to purchase chickens for sale in local mobile markets. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to educate her children and to obtain livestock too.

loans.use: To purchase chickens for sale in local mobile markets.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (101406421) is a 31 year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, T. owns & operates a business selling pork products in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2001, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND. She will use these funds to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by T. from TYM Fund.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Yabana

texts.en: Yabana G. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to help her to open a bakery.  Yabana is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for settlement. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a bakery.

Sỹ owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling metal and metal-related products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month.

In 2005, Sỹ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Sỹ is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 5th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Giovanna Andrea

texts.es: La señora  Giovanna  es un cliente antiguo, en su historial crediticio tiene cero dias de atraso, lo cual indica que es una persona responsable y cumplida.  La señora  Giovanna se dedica a la elaboracion de chompas y chamarras de tela corderoy, su mercado esta ubicado en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, ella vende en la feria 16 de julio de El Alto, como tambien a la feria de desaguadero; el esposo  se dedica a la tapiceria de movilidades trabaja en su mismo domiclio, ella tiene un niño pequeño que tiene apenas un año ellos piensan trabajar fuerte para construir un patrimonio para su hijo, el destino del credito es la compra de mas tela para la produccion en linea en tiempo de demanda.
texts.en:
Giovanna is an old client, and in all her history of loan repayment, she has never been even a day late--a clear sign that she is a responsible and upstanding person. Giovanna makes jackets and sweaters out of corduroy, which she sells at different fairs in La Paz, such as the July 16th fair in El Alto, or the Desaguadero fair. Her husband works out of their home in automobile re-upholstery. They have a son who is barely a year old, and they plan to work hard to build an inheritance for him. This loan will be used for the purchase of more fabric for assembly-line style production during times of demand.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Martha Zenobia

texts.es: La señora Martha M. I. es un cliente relativamente nueva, esta es su segunda secuencia, en el tiempo que esta en la institucion demostro responsabilidad, la señora se dedica a la venta de pollos y lechon al horno su puesto esta ubicado en la zon a16 de julio, la señora prepara platos ricos por los cual tiene clientes fieles a su cocina, su esposo es chofer de taxi por lo cual tiene buen tiempo para dedicarle a su familia, la señora es una perona emprendedora e innovadora que cuando ve la oportunidad no la despedicia, en esta ocasion se le presento un terreno de ocasion en un lugar bien ubicado y estrategico para futuros negocios por lo cual quiere invertir en ello.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha M. I. is a relatively new client and is in her second loan sequence. In the time that she has been a part of the institution, she has demonstrated responsibility. She sells chicken and roasted pork, and her stall is located in the area known as the 16th of July district. She prepares delicious food, and therefore she has faithful clients at her kitchen. Her husband is a taxi driver and has good time to dedicate to the family. She is an entrepreneurial and innovative woman, and when she sees an opportunity, she does not let it pass her by; in this instance, she has found a well-situated and strategic location for future business in which she wants to invest.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Olimata

texts.fr: olimata F. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis mai 2009.elle exerce l'activite de teinture depuis plus d'une dizaine d'annees.elle souhaiterait satisfaire la demande de sa clientele qui est de dplus en plus orientee vers la commande de tissus teints.avec ce credit de 150 000 elle compte acuerir ses propres tissus qu'elle va teindre et les exposer a la vente ce qui serait plus rentable pour elle.cette femme est soutient de famille et voudrait ameliorer les conditions d'existence de sa famille.
texts.en:
Olimata F. has been a member of the Yoff bank since May 2009. She has worked in the fabric-dying business for over 10 years. She would like to meet the ever-increasing demand of her clients for dyed fabrics. With this loan of 150,000 she plans to buy her own fabrics to dye and sell, which will be more profitable for her. Since she has a family to support, she would like to improve living conditions for them.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for dying and selling

loans.use: To improve the state of the garage.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad is a 48-year-old married man with two children. He has been working in the agricultural sector since 1995.Today, Ziad is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy merchandise.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Esperanza En El Senor: Grupo 3 Group

texts.en:
Britania C. G. is the group leader in the “Esperanza en el Senor” bank. She is taking out her third loan with Esperanza. All of her loans have gone to supplement the business she started two years ago with her first Esperanza loan.

Britania has a small accessory shop that she runs out of her house. She sells many different types of women’s accessories such as bracelets, purses, and perfumes. This loan will go to help her expand her inventory so she can diversify her product offerings.

Britania is the single mother of two children, ages five and eleven. The income from her business goes to support her two children. She lives in a community that appreciates her business. She hopes to save enough money to provide for her children so that they can go to college.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et a 02 enfants, son mari est un gendarme. Le revenu de son mari est insuffisant pour couvrir toutes les charges du foyer, pour pouvoir l’aider dans les charges quotidiennes elle a entamé le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale et divers. Elle est la seule à exercer cette activité dans son quartier ce qui fait qu’elle réalise de très bonnes recettes. Voulant agrandir  son stock et commencer le commerce de produits congelés elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 04 cartons de lait « PEAK », 05 cartons de savons , 6 bidons d’huile, divers produits congelés.
texts.en:
Ayaovi M. is married to a police officer, and has two children. Her husband's income is not enough to cover all of their household expenses. To help with daily expenses, she has started selling various food products. She is the only person with this type of business in her neighborhood, so she earns a good deal of money. Hoping to expand her stock and begin selling frozen food products she is requesting her first loan through WAGES to buy four boxes of "PEAK" milk, five boxes of soap, six containers of oil, and various frozen foods.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new types of food products for her business

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion 1 Group

texts.en:
Janeta (pictured on the far left) is of Haitian decent. She has eight grown children and has been receiving loans from Esperanza for six years now. She lives in Eusrarduna, a batay of Consuelo. A batay is a sugar cane plantation site that is mostly inhabited by Haitian migrant workers. Most batays still do not have latrines, potable water is rare, and electricity is non-existent. There are narrow dirt roads that surround the batay where motoconchos (motorcycle taxi’s) swoosh through. 

Janeta is an experienced retail clothes sales-women. She says she has been in this line of work as far back as she can remember. She primarily sells to people in her community. They have known her and her business for some time now. She also sells on the streets. When asked how these loans have changed her business, she responded, “They help my business grow and bring in more profits.” 

Please continue to support Janeta. Thank you.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes to resell to people in her community

loans.name: Komlanvi

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur  a ouvert sa boutique qu’il a appelé « MIR TELECOM », dans sa boutique il vend des antennes, des appareils électroniques et câbles et divers accessoires électroniques. Son stock de marchandises est épuisé, il sollicite un  premier crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec des câbles électriques, antennes et divers appareils et accessoires électroniques.
Etant célibataire, c’est avec le revenu de ses activités qu’il subvient à ses propres
texts.en:
Komlanvi A. opened a shop called "Mir Telecom" where he sells antennas, electronic devices, wires and other electronic accessories. He is running out of stock and is requesting his first loan to replenish his supply of these items. Since he is single, he runs the business on his own, and this support will help him continue to operate and earn income.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase elecrical wires, electronic devices and antennas

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et père de 02 enfants. Afin de pouvoir subvenir convenablement aux besoins de sa famille, il a commencé en 2007 le commerce en détail de produits pétroliers qu'il met dans des bouteilles et d’huile à moteur. Il exerce son activité dans le quartier de kpédji, un quartier de la ville de lomé. Il veut rehausser son stock, il a déjà obtenu deux crédits qu’il a bien remboursé, il sollicite de WAGES son troisième  crédit pour acheter des produits pétroliers et des huiles à moteur.
texts.en:
Yawo A. is married and the father of two children. In order to support his family's needs, he began a retail business in 2007 selling bottled oil products and motor oil. He runs this business in the neighborhood of Kpédji, in the city of Lomé. He would like to expand his stock, and has already obtained two loans that he fully reimbursed. He is requesting his third loan from WAGES in order to buy motor oil and oil products.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase oil products

loans.name: Abdourahmane

texts.fr: abdourahmane S. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis mars 2003 ou il adeja renbourse cinq credits.le local dans lequel il gere son activite se situe a son lieu de domicile a yoff mbenguenne une rue qui est trs frequentee.il est tres connu dans la commercialisation de produits alimentaires qu'il exerce depuis plusieurs annees.ce credit de 300 000 lui permetra d'augmenter son fond de roulement en vue d'une divrsification plus importante de ses produits .ceci l'aidera a elargir son activite accroitre le niveau de sa marge beneficiaire et mieux afronter ses responsabilites familiales.
texts.en:
Abdourahmane S. has been a member of the Yoff credit union since March 2003 and he has already reimbursed 5 loans. The venue for his business is his home in Yoff Mbenguenne, in a much-used street. He is well-known for selling foodstuffs, a business he has been in for several years. This loan of 300,000 will allow him to add to his working capital so as to further diversify his inventory. It will permit him to expand his business, raise his profit margin, and better deal with his responsibilities for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMMERCE

loans.name: Edjoè

texts.fr:
Cette dame est une sage femme, pour aider les femmes n’ayant pas de moyens à se procurer des  médicaments elle a commencé la vente de produits génériques et pharmaceutiques en détail. Elle fait cela depuis 5 ans déjà. Ainsi les femmes arrivent à se procurer les médicaments quand elles sont malades.
Son stock actuel est épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des produits génériques "MEG".
texts.en:
This lady is a midwife. In order to help women who don't have the means to buy medicines, she began to sell generic and pharmaceutical products retail. She has been doing this for 5 years already. Thus the women manage to get medicines when they are ill.

Her inventory is presently sold out so she wants to replenish it and has asked WAGES for her first loan to buy "MEG" generic products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of generic medicines

loans.name: Anoko

texts.fr: Cette femme a associé à son métier d’infirmière accoucheuse  le commerce des produits génériques et pharmaceutiques. Ainsi elle permet aux malades n’ayant pas assez d’argent pour acheter les médicaments à la pharmacie de l’acheter chez elle. Son stock de marchandises est épuisé et elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des produits génériques et pharmaceutiques.
texts.en:
This woman is both a nurse-midwife and a vendor of generic and pharmaceutical products. Thus, she allows ill people who don't have enough money to buy medicines at the pharmacy to buy from her. Her inventory of medicines is expended and she wants to replenish it. She is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy generic and pharmaceutical products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of generic and pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stocking and selling cereals

loans.name: Bello

texts.fr: En 1999, cette jeune femme a abandonné les études et s’est lancée dans le commerce de pagnes pour pouvoir subvenir à ses propres besoins. Cette activité marche bien pour elle, elle conquiert tous les jours de nouveaux clients. le stock de pagnes dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire ses clients , elle s’adresse alors à WAGES pour solliciter un crédit qui lui permettrai d’augmenter son stock avec 30 pièces de pagnes de qualité « WAX » et 5 pagnes « HI TARGET ».
texts.en:
In 1999, this young woman left school and began to sell "pagnes" (lengths of brightly patterned African cloth) to support herself. This business has been successful; she wins over new customers daily. The inventory of "pagnes" that she presently has doesn't permit her to satisfy her customers, so she has come to WAGES to ask for a loan that will permit her to add to her stock by buying 30 lengths of "Wax" brand cloth and 5 lengths of "Hi Target" brand cloth.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell food items

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce comme activité la restauration, elle a un restaurant non loin du marché d’adidogomé, elle fait des plats togolais comme le fufu qui est préparé à base d’ignames, la pâte à base de maïs. ses plats sont très appréciés par ses clients. Les produits nécessaires à son activité de restauration étant épuisés, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son second crédit pour acheter 10 tas d’ignames, 5 sacs de maïs et divers autres produits alimentaires.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a lady who works in the food catering business. She has a restaurant not far from the Adidogomé market. She makes Togolese dishes, such as fufu made from yams and pâte made from corn. Her dishes are much appreciated by her customers. The goods necessary for her restaurant business are exhausted, so she wants to stock up again and is requesting her second loan from WAGES to buy ten piles of yams, five sacks of corn, and various other food items. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Josefina es casada, tiene 73 años y 4 hijos, Josefina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, en el ultimo mes alquilo un kiosco en un lugar mas transitado en donde venderá golosinas, frutas y comida. Además Josefina vende quesos a los trabajadores de diferentes instituciones.
Josefina necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Los sueños de Josefina son ahorrar para su vejez y descansar.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the Estrella Communal Bank.
Josefina is 73 years old, married and has 4 children. Josefina runs a store from her home selling general groceries. Last month she rented a kiosk in a busier location where she will sell sweets, fruit and food. Josefina also sells cheese to the workers of various organisations.
Josefina needs an 800 PEN loan to purchase cheese.
Josefina dreams of saving up so that she can relax in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheese

loans.name: Juliana Teodora

texts.es:
Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Juliana es casada, tiene 47 años y 2 hijos, Juliana viaja a las distintas ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales y quesos, que luego comercializa en los mercados y molinos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Juliana necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso, cereales.
Los sueños de Juliana son que sus hijos sean profesionales y aumentar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the Star Community Bank, married, 47 years old, and has two children. Juliana travels to the various markets of the region where she sells fruits and buys cereals and cheeses which she then sells in the markets and mills of Ayacucho. Juilana needs a loan of 800 soles that will be invested in the purchase of cheese and cereals. Her dreams are that her children become professionals and that she can increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cheeses and cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To transport sand and gravel

loans.name: Karen Elizabeth

texts.es:
Karen es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Karen es soltera y tiene 24 años, vive con sus padres, Karen estudia la carrera de Antropología en la universidad, Karen vende cosméticos por catálogos que vende al crédito.
Karen necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de perfumes.
Los sueños de Karen son terminar sus estudios y ser profesional, apoyar a su mama en la educación de sus hermanos menores.
texts.en:
Karen is a member of the Star Community Bank, is single, 24 years old, and lives with her parents. She studies Anthropology in the university. Karen sells cosmetics from catalogs that provide credit. She needs a loan of 800 soles that will be invested in the purchase of perfumes. Karen's dreams are to complete her studies, become a professional, and help her mother with the education of her younger brothers.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of perfumes

loans.name: Yanapay Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “YANAPAY”, lengua quechua que significa traducido al español (ayudar) viven en la ciudad del Cusco, y se reúnen en las oficinas de la organización arariwa con cede en huanchac.

Nuestros socios, alternan sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, alguno de ellos tienen restaurantes, otros desean invertir en la culminación de sus construcciones de viviendas, venta de quinua (bebida proteica), alquilar un stand en el centro comercial el molino, etc. Los socios desean el préstamo para poder invertir en sus diferentes negocios.

Los socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "Yanapay", a Quecha word that means "to help", live in Cusco city and meet in the offices of the organization Arariwa, which is headquartered in Huanchac. They alternate their household responsibilities with their retail activities: some of them have restaurants or wish to complete construction on their homes, others sell quinoa (as a high-protein drink) or rent stands in the El Molino commerical center. The members would like a loan to invest in their respective businesses. The members appreciate and value the loan granted through Kiva and are committed to repaying their debt in the period established.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell grocery items

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Carmela es separada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Carmela tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donde vende especerías como ají molido, ajo molido, productos que ella prepara. Además Carmela en algunas oportunidades vende comida en el puesto de su mama.
Carmela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ají colorado, comino y ají amarillo.
Los sueños de Carmela son que sus hijos sean profesionales y realizar los acabados de su casa.
texts.en:
Carmela is a member of the Estrella Communal Bank.
Carmela is 43 years old, separated and has 4 children. Carmela runs a stall in the Magdalena market where she sells spices like ground chilli pepper and garlic that she prepares. Sometimes Carmela also sells food at her mother’s stall.
Carmela needs a 1000 PEN loan to purchase red chilli peppers, cumin and yellow chilli peppers.
Carmela dreams of her children becoming professionals and of completing work on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase red chilli peppers, cumin and yellow chilli peppers

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Yolanda es soltera, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Yolanda tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende carne, los animales los compra en las ferias. Además Yolanda vende leña en su casa.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ovino y ganado porcino.
Los sueños de Yolanda son construir su casa y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Banco Comunal Estrella [Community Star Bank]. Yoland is single, 28 years old and has a son. Yolanda has a stand at the central market in the city of Ayacucho where she sells meat, the animals she buys at fairs. Additionally, Yolanda sells firewood from her home. Yolanda needs a loan of 1000 Pervian Soles. The money would be invested in buying sheep and pigs. Yolanda dreams of building a home and educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growing produce for markets

loans.name: Zulem

texts.es:
Zulem es socia del Banco Comunal Capulí.
Zulem es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 1 hijo, Zulem tiene un puesto en el mercado Vivanco en donde vende pollos que compra de las avícolas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Zulem necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido para la compra de muebles para su casa.
Los sueños de Zulem es mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zulem is a member of the Capulí Communal Bank.
Zulem is 31 years old, has one child and lives with her partner. Zulem buys chickens from poultry farmers and sells them from her Vivanco market stall every day.
Zulem needs a 2000 PEN loan to purchase furniture for her home.
Zulem dreams of improving her business and giving her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase furniture for her home

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr: A. Pierrette est âgée de cinquante et un (51) ans. Pierrette est née à SAKETE un village du Département du PLATEAU dans le Sud BENIN. Pierrette est mariée à BOURAÏMA Fachinan un employé du service des Travaux Publics du Bénin. Pierrette et Fachinan ont quatre enfants: trois garçons et une fille, tous majeurs. Pierrette vit à Yénawa, un quartier de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin dans la maison de son petit frère où elle exerce son activité. Pierrette vend à manger(riz, haricot, pâte de maïs, pâte de farine de manioc et pâte de causette d'igname). Pierrette a déjà eu quatre crédits avec ALIDé. Pierrette a bien remboursé ses crédits et a pu amener son activité à un stade supérieur avec. Pour pouvoir continuer de développer son activité et de mieux servir sa clientèle, Pierrette sollicite un cinquième crédit de la part de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Pierrette is 51 years old and was born in SAKETE, a village of PLATEAU County, in southern Benin. She is married to BOURAÏMA Fachinan, an employee in the public works service of Benin. Pierrette and Fachinan have four children: 3 boys and a girl, all of age. Pierrette lives in Yénawa, a district of the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, in a house belonging to her younger brother. There, she operates her business selling cooked food (rice, beans, cornmeal mash, cassava mash, and yam chips mash). She has already had four loans with Alidé and has repaid them. She was thus able to raise her business to a higher level. To be able to continue developing her business and to serve her customers better, she’s requesting a fifth loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a 50-kg sack of corn, a 50-kg sack of rice, a 25-kg sack of beans, and some firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stockpiling cereals for resale

loans.name: Julia Alejandra

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Capulí.
