Julia es soltera, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Julia tiene un puesto alquilado en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada. Además Julia vende artesanías por mayor a comerciantes en la ciudad de Lima, las piezas de artesanía lo compra de los productores.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de artesanías en piedra de Huamanga.
Los sueños de Julia son tener una casa propia, mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Banco Comunal Capulí. Julia is single, 39 years old and has two children. Julia has a rented stand at the market called “The 12th of April” where she sells various types of clothes. Julia also sells handcrafts wholesale to vendors in the city of Lima. The handcrafts she buys directly from the makers. Julia needs a loan of 1400 Peruvian Soles that she will invest in stone handcrafts from Huamanga region of Peru. Julia dreams of owning her own home, improving her business and offering a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone handcrafts from Humanga, Peru.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sale of charcoal

loans.name: Zilda Claudia

texts.es:
Zilda es socia del Banco Comunal Capulí.
Zilda es casada, tiene 58 años y 4 hijos, Zilda es profesora cesante del nivel primaria, y actualmente viene dictando clases particulares D. reforzamiento en su casa o en ocasiones en casa D. sus alumnos. Además Zilda venD. ropa variada y también teje chompas, colchas a pedido.
Zilda necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. polos, pantalones para niños.
Zilda sueña con mejorar su casa, tener una tienda comercial e irse D. viaje D. descanso junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Zilda is a member of the Banco Comunal Capulí [Community Bank of Capulí]. Zilda is married, 58 years old and has four children. Zilda is an unemployed elementary school teacher. Currently, she gives private tutor lessons from her home and sometimes at the home of her students. Additionally, Zilda sells various types of clothes and also sews sweaters and quilts on request. Zilda needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Soles that will be invested in buying shirts and pants for children. Zilda dreams of improving her home, having a storefront and going on a trip with her husband to relax.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts and pants for children.

loans.name: Milva Edith

texts.es:
Milva es socia del Banco Comunal Capulí.
Milva es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hija, Milva junto a su esposo tienen una tienda agro veterinaria llamada Nicol, ubicada en una avenida transitada en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Milva necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos veterinarios.
Los sueños de Milva son tener casa propia y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Milva is a meber of the Banco Comunal Capulí [Community Bank of Capulí]. Milva is 30 years old, has one child and with her common law husband has an agricultural veterinarian store called Nicol. The rented storefront is located on a main avenue and is open for business everyday. Milva needs a loan of 800 Peruvian Soles that would be invested in the purchase of veterinarian products. Milva dreams of having her own home and that her daughter becomes a working professional.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to purchase veterinarian products.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Victoria es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Victoria vende carne al por mayor, reparte a comerciantes del mercado Vivanco, los animales los adquiere en las ferias de la región, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ovinos.
Los sueños de Victoria son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Capulí Communal Bank.
Victoria is 34 years old, has 4 children and lives with her common-law husband. Victoria sells meat wholesale to vendors at the Vivanco Market. She acquires the animals at fairs in the region with the help of her husband.
Victoria needs a 1400 PEN loan to purchase sheep.
Victoria dreams of her children becoming professionals and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa M. es una joven de 36 años que tiene 2 hijos, el primer hijo de ella tiene 17 años y tiene una enfermedad que no le ha permitido desarrollarse muy bien, su otra hija tiene 9 años de edad y esta en cuarto grado, y ella tiene excelencia academica.
Rosa empezo vendiendo ropa usada hace 18 años, luego cambio a ventas de comidas en oficinas cerca de su casa de habitacion, luego ella se mudo a la colonia 28 de marzo, le detectaron un cancer en los riñones y se detuvo con la venta de comidas y tuvo que parar el tratamiento de su hijo para poder tratarse ella, cuando se recupero le recomendaron comer bastantes frutas, pero debido a que en la colonia no existia ningun puesto de venta de frutas ella decidio poner este tipo de negocio y le ha ido muy bien, ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas frutas.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is a youthful 36 years old and has two children. Her first child is a daughter who is 17 years old and has an illness that has not allowed her to develop very well. Her other daughter is 9 years old and is in fourth grade with an excellent academic record. Rosa started selling used clothing 18 years ago and then changed to selling food to offices near her home. Later, she moved to a community called “The 28th of March” where they detected cancer in her kidneys and she had to stop the food selling business as well as stop treatment of her daughter in order to take care of herself. When she recovered, they recommended she eat plenty of fruits but since the community had not one fruit stand, she decided to open one herself. It has gone very well and she needs a loan in order to be able to more fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits such as mangos, pineapples and watermelons.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: A. Pascaline est âgée de 56 ans. Pascaline est originaire de GUEZIN un village lacustre du Département de MONO au BENIN. Pascaline est mère de quatre enfants: deux garçons et deux filles, tous majeurs. Pascaline est veuve depuis dix sept (17) ans. Pascaline vit et exerce son commerce dans la maison de son fils aîné à minontchou, un quartier périphérique de la ville de COTONOU, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Pascaline vend depuis quinze (15) ans des produits divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, huile de noix de palme et d'arachide, pétrole lampant, etc.) Pascaline a eu déjà deux crédits avec ALIDé. Pascaline sollicite présentement un troisième prêt de ALIDé pour mieux développer son activité.
texts.en:
A. Pascaline is 56 years old. Pascaline is originally from GUEZIN, a village near lakes in the Department of Mono in Benin. She is the mother of 4 children: two sons and two daughters, all adults.

Pascaline has been a widow for 17 years. She lives and conducts her business in the home of her elder son in Minontchou, an outlying district of the city of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. For 15 years, she has been selling various products (candy, cookies; tins of milk, sardines, tomatoes; sugar, pasta, detergent, dish soap, hand soap, palm oil and peanut oil, kerosene, etc.)

Pascaline has already had 2 loans from ALIDé. She is now requesting her third loan from ALIDé so that she can better develop her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a jerry can of 25 liters of palm oil, 2 jerry cans of 25 liters of peanut oil, 50 liters of kerosene, two cartonse deux cases of candy, two cases of cookies and 50 kg of manioc flour

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Nora es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 1 hijo, Nora junto a su esposo tienen un taller de confecciones, además tienen empleados que trabajan con ellos, confeccionan buzos, polos, productos que vende por mayor a las diferentes tiendas, y también tienen un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde venden sus prendas.
Nora necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Nora son  tener una casa y puesto propios, una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Nora is a member of the Capuli Microfinance Institute.

She is a 31-year-old married mother with one son. She and her husband have a garment factory with several workers under their supervision. They manufacture track suits and T-shirts, which they sell wholesale throughout several stores. They also sell their apparel in a stand that they have at the 12 de Abril market.

Nora needs an 800.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing fabric.

Nora dreams of owning a house and some market stands, as well as providing her son with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: opening a beauty salon and buying necessary supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize and manioc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing sweet potatoes

loans.name: Las Flores De Palmadera Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal  Las Flores D. Palmadera, pertenece a la Comunidad D. Palmadera  ubicada en el distrito D. Acoria, Provincia D. Huancavelica, departamento D. Huancavelica. La mayoría D. la población D. esta zona es activa en la producción y se organizan mancomunadamente, sus producciones se financian en Ayaccocha, Hucro y Huancavelica. La mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

El Bancomunal tiene 17 socias las cuales solicitan prestamos entre 200 y 800 soles para utilizarlos en sus negocios, haciendo un total D. 7,100 soles.

Leonarda, es casada, tiene 3 hijos D. 14, 8 y 6 años, se dedica a la venta D. carne, Leonarda compra chanchos, carneros  y los mata en su casa para vender su carne, en su negocio le ayudan su esposo e hijos. La mayor dificultad que tiene que enfrentar son los huaycos que hay en la región, donD. tiene que financiar nuevamente para su negocio. Solicita un préstamo D. 400 soles para la compra D. ganados y alimentos para los animales. Su sueño es vender al por mayor, para lo cual necesita invertir más dinero. Por ahora está ahorrando para comprar frazadas para sus hijos que estudian fuera D. la localidad.

Angélica, es casada, tiene 5 hijos en edad escolar D. 13, 10, 8, 6 y 2 años, con el primer crédito que recibió hace unos 6 meses compró ropa para sus hijos, no supo invertir en su negocio, solo con una parte compro animales menores que cria en su casa y los vendió poco a poco para pagar su préstamo, por la mala inversión tuvo problemas pero pese a ello se sintió responsable y pagó su primer crédito. Solicita un préstamo D. 800 soles para iniciar su negocio, quiere tener una granja D. gallinas, para poder vender y consumir sus huevos. Le gustaría ahorrar para los arreglos que necesita su casa.
texts.en:
'Las Flores D. Palmadera' (The Flowers of Palmadera) community bank belongs to the community of Palmadera, located in the Acoria district of Huancavelica province, in the department of Huancavelica. The majority of the population in this zone work in production and they organize themselves jointly to finance their work in Ayaccocha, Hucro and Huancavelica. The majority work in agriculture, livestock, and business. The community bank consists of 17 partners who request loans between 200 and 800 PEN to use in their businesses; the sum of all loans is 7,100 PEN. Leonarda is married and has 3 children who are 14, 8, and 6 years old. She sells meat. Leonarda buys pigs and rams; she kills them at her house and sells the meat. Her husband and children help her in the business. The greatest difficulty that she faces is the region's flash floods, often requiring her to rebuild her business. She requests a loan of 400 PEN to buy livestock and feed for the animals. Her dream is to sell wholesale, for which she would need to invest more money. Currently she is saving to buy blankets for her children, who study out of town. Angélica is married and has 5 children who are 13, 10, 8, 6 and 2 years old. With her first loan she received 6 months ago, she bought clothes for her children, not knowing to invest in her business. Only with part of the loan she bought small animals to raise at home and sell, slowly repaying her loan. Because of the bad investment she had problems but in spite of the difficulties she felt responsible and repaid her first loan. She requests another loan of 800 PEN to start her business; she wants to have a chicken farm so she can sell and eat the eggs. She would like to save for the repairs her house needs.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fulfill loan requests between 200 and 800 PEN, to be used in businesses. The total of all loans is 7,100 PEN.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Olga Sofia

texts.es: Olga P. tiene una pequeña pulperia, tiene mucho tiempo de tenerla ella vende: arroz, azucar, maiz, refrescos y otras cosas. ella tiene la ayuda de su hijo ya que por las mañanas se levanta a las 4:00 am para salir a vender a una melonera que queda cerca de su casa ahi vende refrescos. en esa melonera trebaja el esposo de olga, ella y su esposo han salido adelante con sus esfuerzos, ella  espera seguir adelante y en el futuro tener una pulperia mas surtida.
texts.en:
Olga P. has had a small grocery shop for long time. She sells rice, sugar, corn, soft drinks and some other products. Her son helps in the business since she has to get up at 4 in the morning to go to sell soft drinks at a place near to her house, where her husband works too. Olga and her husband have gone ahead with their efforts, she hopes to keep the business going and eventually to offer more products and have a well stocked grocery shop.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, juice, sugar, rice, beans, meat, corn ,cookies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of fertilizer for growing maize

loans.name: Elyse

texts.fr:
A. Elyse est née vers 1961 à ABOMEY, Capitale historique du BENIN. Elyse est mariée à LOKO Daniel, un vitrier qui exerce sa profession à COTONOU, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Elyse et Daniel ont quatre 
enfants: deux filles et deux garçons qui sont tous au lycée. Elyse et sa famille vit à Suru-Léré un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou. C'est Daniel, le mari d'Elyse qui supporte les charges de la familles. Ainsi, Elyse réinvesti les revenus de son activité dans celle-ci pour mieux la développer. Elyse vend des beignets de haricot, de patate douce, de pomme de terre, de banane et d'igname frites depuis sept (7) ans à côté du lycée public de son quartier. Elyse a eu déjà quatre crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. L'activité d'Elyse a connu une évolution remarquable depuis son premier crédit. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Elyse sollicite un cinquième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Elyse was born around 1961 in ABOMEY, historic capital of Benin. Elyse is married to Loko Daniel, a glazier who works in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Elyse and Daniel have four children, two daughters and two sons who are all in high school.

Elyse and her family live in Suru-Léré, a working-class neighborhood of the city of Cotonou. It's Daniel, Elyse's husband, who supports the family. Thus, Elyse reinvests the income from her business so as to develop it better. Elyse has been selling fitters made of beans, sweet potatoes, potatoes, and bananas, and fried cocoyams for 7 years near the public high school in her neighborhood. Elyse has already had four loans from ALIDé, loans that she reimbursed correctly. Her business has undergone a remarkable evolution since her first loan. In order to better satisfy her ever-growing clientele, Elyse is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 1 sack of 100 kg of cocoyams, 50 kg of dried beans, 25 liters of peanut oil and firewood

loans.name: Martha Odilia

texts.es: Martha Garica se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas desde hace 9 años,  se levanta a las 3:00 am para empezar a fabricar las ricas tortillas, martha tiene 3 hijas ellas le ayudan ya que sus tortillas tienen vastante demanda, ella compra el maiz, la cal y el papel en la ciudad viaja cada 8 dias y la leña la compra en el lugar donde vive, martha es viuda le a tocado trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijas pero con su ayuda y la de Dios ha logrado salir adelante en estos momentos ella necesita comprar mas materia prima para tener mas produccion y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Martha G. has been making and selling tortillas for nine years. She gets up at 3:00 a.m. to start making her delicious tortillas. Martha has three daughters who help her, since there is quite a demand for her tortillas. She goes to the city every eight days to buy the corn, lime, and paper. She buys the wood in the area where she lives. Martha is a widow. She has had to work a lot to help her daughters get ahead. With your help and help from God, she has been able to get ahead. She now needs a loan to buy raw materials to produce more and have better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, water, lime, wood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing sweet potatoes

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es:
el grupo Emmanuel esta integrado por 3 personas las cuales han convivido por muchos años.
la sra, Maria G. tiene 48 años de edad, esta casada, tuvo 7 hijos de los cuales todos ya se casaron y le ayudan economicamente, ella tiene una pulperia desde hace 2 años, en la cual vende productos de consumo popular como ser frijoles, arroz, azucar, cafe, pan, lacteos, etc. ella ha logrado tener una buena clientela y su mayor sueño es tener un supermercado.
la sra. Maria A. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales uno esta en edad escolar. ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosmeticos, tiene 10 años de realizar esta actividad, ella vende en el mercado de Langue, Valle. y en algunos barrios y colonias de esta ciudad de Nacaome., entre los productos que vende ella estan: pantalones, camisetas, blusas, boxers, calsetas, blumers, calsetines, cremas, desodorantes, tintes, carteras, trajes de niño. el sueño de ella es que sus hijos sean empresarios.
El Sr. Elvis R. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 1 hijo. el se dedica a la venta de leña desde hace varios años, para vender su producto el se traslada en carro a los diferentes barrios y colonias de esta ciudad, su sueño es vender leña al por mayor a todas las productoras de tortillas.
texts.en:
The Emmanuel group consists of 3 people who have lived together for many years. Mrs. Maria G. is 48-years old and is married with 7 children who are all married and are helping out financially. For the last two years, she has been running a convenient store which sells popular consumer products like: beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, dairy products and etc... She wishes to have good clients and her big dream is to own a supermarket.

Mrs. Maria A. is 29-years old and single with two children with one child of school age. It has been 10 years that Maria has been dedicated to selling clothes and cosmetics. She sells her products in the Langue market in Valle and in some boroughs and colonies in the city of Nacome. The products that she sells are: pants, skirts, blouses, boxers, jerseys, crèmes, deodorants, dyes, hang bags, and children’s clothes. It’s her dream to have her children be entrepreneurs.

Mr. Elvis R. is 23-years old is single and has one child. He has dedicated himself to selling spirits for several years. He sells his products by car to several boroughs and colonies in the city. His dream is to sell the best spirits and best tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various consumer products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing a very succulent groundnut commonly called « efio »

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es: el sr. Margarito A. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, el tiene una tienda de abarroterias en su casa de habitacion, el se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio para atender a sus clientes, el vive con su esposa y su hija que tambien le ayudan con la atencion de los clientes, el esta muy contento ya que su negocio les genera ingresos para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar y su familia, el necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener muy surtido su negocio , en el futuro piensa construir para poder hace mas grande su local y asi poder montar un mercadito completo, su meta o sueño es poner una bodega o deposito.
texts.en:
Margarito A. sells popular consumer products. He has a grocery store in his house. He gets up very early to open his business to take care of his customers. He lives with his wife and daughter. They also help waiting on the customers. He is very happy with his business since it generates income to cover the home and family expenses. He needs a loan to buy more merchandise to have a very well stocked store. In the future he is thinking of building in order to make his location bigger. Then he could set up a complete market. His dream is to have a general store or warehouse.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy soft drinks, churros, glasses, plates, plastics, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, beans, shortening, oil, salt, tortillas,milk products, pastas, toilet paper, soaps, pencils

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pruchase of fertilizer for growing maize

loans.name: Ana Liliana

texts.es:
la Sra. Ana Liliana G. tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, la cual opera bajo el nombre de pulperia ANA, actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 7 años, el crecimiento de su negocio es notable y esto debido a la ubicacion con que cuenta el mismo y tambien por la atencion que ella les brinda a sus clientes.
ella vive en union libre y solo uno de sus hijos depende de ella, su compañero de hogar trabaja como motorista de equipo pesado.
ella solicita el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio, ella nos comenta que se siente muy alegre.
con los ingresos que le genera su negocio le colabora a su esposo para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Liliana G. has a mini market named ANA located in her house. She has been in this business for seven years. The notable growth of her business is due to its location and also to the attention she offers her customers. She is in a common law marriage, and only one of her children is a dependent. Her husband works as a heavy equipment operator. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy merchandise to better stock her business. She feels happy with the income the business generates. She and her husband both contribute to cover the family and household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy sugar, rice, soap, toilet paper, soft drinks, coffee, canned juices, chicken, eggs, corn flour, cheese, butter

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ada Esmeralda

texts.es:
la Sra,. Ada R. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella cuenta con una pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de pulperia EL ESTUDIANTE, ella es maestra jubilada quien opto por poner su negocio despues de su jubilacion. ella tiene muchos años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella, estos estan cursando la universidad.
ella se siente muy contenta con este negocio, ya que le permite generar ingresos y al mismo tiempo estar en su casa sin tener que salir a trabajar.
ella esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mercaderia y asi tener una tienda mas grande, su meta es poder tener un mercadito, y lo que ella mas desea es poder ayudarles a sus hijos a que sean unos profesionales de bien.
texts.en:
Ada Rodríguez sells popular consumer ítems. She has a mini market named El Estudiante. She is a retired teacher who opted to start her business after her retirement. She has many years of experience in this type of business. She is a single mother with two dependent children who attend the university. She is very happy with the business because it allows her to generate income, while at the same time she can be in her house without having to leave to work. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy merchandise and have a bigger store. Her goal is to be able to have a market. What she most wishes for is to be able to help her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, shortening, coffee, eggs, corn, bread, flour, soft drinks, paper, churros, soap, pastas, juice, salsas, milk products, meat,

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen had established a career as a court reporter, before she was sidetracked by personal tragedy.  After many years, she returned to court reporting and eventually found her passion in helping the hearing-impaired community through transcription and closed captioning services.  While working for a community college providing educational captioning services, Karen started One Stop Verbatim Services, which offers universal access to not only the hearing-impaired, but also English language learners, the elderly, and distance learning students.  Karen has big dreams for her business—she spends plenty of time cold-calling potential clients, such as sports stadiums where she wants to initiate captioning for sports games and events on their big screens.

A $10,000 loan will enable Karen to purchase the updated equipment that she needs in order to provide the best service to her clients and to expand her services to include web podcasts.

loans.use: Equipment for closed captioning services

loans.name: El Macueliso Group

texts.es:
este es el grupo Macueliso, todos son personas respetables y honorables en su comunidad, ellos tienen mucho tiempo de concerse y siempre han trabajado en grupo, las actividades que ellos realizan son las siguientes:
el Sr. Rigoberto R. tiene una pulperia, misma que inicio desde hace 5 años, el nos comento que inicio con un inventario de Lps.800.00 y ubico su producto en un cajon de madera de 50cm cuadrados, atraves del tiempo el crecimiento de su negocio es muy bueno, ha sido una persona muy trabajadora y muy buen administrador tambien. el es casado y padre de 4 hijos los cuales dependen de ellos al 100%, ademas de dedicarse a este negocio tambien siembra maiz y frijoles, cuando el trabaja en el campo su esposa atienda la pulperia.
El sr. Henry S. tiene 2 años de haber iniciado con el negocio de la pulperia, ya que anteriormente solo se dedicaba a la agricultuara, pero debido a la buena ubicacion con que cuenta su casa tomo la decision de instalar este negocio, su casa se encuentra ubicada contiguo al centro de estudios de esa comunidad y frente a un campo de futbol tambien. ademas en la pulperia tiene un molino para maiz, este negocio es muy bueno ya que en esta comunidad no hay otra persona que se dedique a esta actividad, el es casado y tiene 4 hijos los cuales todos dependen de el.
la Sra. Digna H.: se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas, actrividad que inicio desde hace 7 años, el producto que ella elabora lo vende la los dueños de negocios de la comunidad de Oculi, donde ella reside, ella ha sabido ganar la clientela  por su buen sabor, tamaño e higiene con que elabora el producto, ella tomo la decision de apoyar a su esposo en lo poco que puede con los gastos del hogar. ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos y todos dependen de ellos.
estos integrantes de este grupo necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias.
texts.en:
This is the Macueliso group. They are all respectable and honorable people in their community. They have known each other for a long time, and they have always worked in the group. Their activities are as follows: Rigoberto R. has a mini market that he started five years ago with an inventory of Lps. 800.00, which he fit into a 50 square centimeter wooden box. With the passage of time his business has grown well. He has been a very hard working person and a good administrator, too. He is married and has four dependent children. In addition to this business, he also plants corn and beans. When he works in the field his wife takes care of the store. Henry S. started his mini market two years ago. Before that he only worked as a farmer. But, due to the good location of his house, he made the decision to set up this business. He house is located next to the community center for studies and in front of a soccer field. Also, the mini market has a mill for corn. This business is very good since there is not another one in the community. He is married and has four dependent children. Digna H. has been making and selling rosquillas (a regional cookie specialty) for seven years. She sells them to the business owners in the Oculi community where she lives. She has known how to win customers with the good flavor, size, and cleanliness in the production of her rosquillas. She made the decision to help her husband, the little that she can, with the household expenses. She is married and has three dependent children. The members of this group need the loan to be able to get ahead with their businesses and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy salt, sugar, rice, soap, coffee, salsa, shortening, powedered milk, milk products, churros, corn, tortillas, cheese, margarine, oil, four, grains, eggs, juices, soft drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omegas Group

texts.es:
este grupo se llama Alfa y Omegas, tienen mucho tiempo de conocerse y tienen muchas ganas de salir adelante, sus actividades son las siguientes:
la sra. NORMA SUYAPA G., su actividad principal es la elaboracion y venta de chicharras 9ppelejo de cerdo frito en forma de chicharron pero mucho mas grande) , tambien se didica a la confeccion de ropa para dama, ella comenta que gracias a los ingresos que persibe de este negocio ella puede contribuir con los gastos de su familia y al mismo tiempo esta en su casa cuidando de su familia,  actualmente ella necesita de mayor inversion para poder abastecer la demanda existente y no cuenta con el capital  suficiente.  Ella manifiesta que  con el apoyo  economico que ella le brinda a su esposo ellos han mejorado su vivienda y eso le motiva a seguir adelante

ANTONIA DEL CARMEN V., ella es casada,  ella y su esposo ya quedaron solos como iniciaron, ya que sus hijos se fueron de la casa para formar su familias.
su actividad principal es la elaboracion y ventas de Tortillas, con los ingresos que persibe  contribuye con los gastos de alimentacion ya que su esposo trabaja como vigilante en un Instituto y los ingresos que persiben no es mucho, pero juntando los dos ingresos ellos han logrado salir adelante, ha mejorado su vivienda y se sienten muy felices.

LUIS EDGARDO L. el trabaja para un beneficio de cafe, y en los tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva la que distribuye de manera ambulante y por encargo,  tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, cuenta con buena clientela.
actualmente el necesita surtir mas su negocio por lo que solicita el credito y asi mejorar  sus ingresos, logrando asi  un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This group’s name is Alfa y Omegas. They have known each other for a long time, and they have a lot of desire to get ahead. Their activities are as follows: Norma Suyapa G. makes and sells “chicharras” (like the fried pork skin of a “chicharron”, but much bigger). She also makes women’s clothes. Thanks to the income she receives from this business, she is able to contribute to the family expenses. At the same time, she is in her house taking care of her family. She currently needs a greater investment to be able to fill the existing demand. She does not have sufficient capital. With the economic support she gives her husband, they have improved their house. This motivates her to keep going forward. Antonia del Carmen V. is married. She and her husband are now alone, just as they started out. Their children have left home to form their own families. Her primary business is making and selling tortillas. With the income she receives she contributes to the food expenses. Her husband works as a guard at the Institute, but his income is not much. However, by putting the two incomes together they have been able to get ahead. They have improved their house, and they feel very happy. Luis Edgardo L. works for a coffee processor. On his days off he sells new clothes on foot. He has been doing this for many years, and he has a good client base. He currently needs to better stock his business. That is why he is asking for a loan, to increase his income and achieve a better level of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, wood, oil, pork skin, packaging bags

loans.name: Ray

texts.en:
Ray is in the business of providing solutions to homes and businesses. The 53-year-old computer and electronic services consultant advises clients on what equipment best suits their needs. Because Ray doesn’t install the equipment himself, he needs to hire qualified professionals. He has been experiencing delays in identifying skilled labor to enable him to complete his contracts.

To address this, he is collaborating with another organization to become certified through MECP, a vocational school for installation technicians. He has applied for this loan from ACCION USA in order to be able to fund the certification process. Becoming certified as a training provider would help Ray's business because training and certifying the most talented of his sub-contractors will allow him to have qualified labor at his fingertips as he continues to take on larger jobs.

He hopes to be able to grow his business and offer more training and employment opportunities to youth from technical colleges. For Ray, his business is not just a source of income but a way to create employment and empower the hard-working men and women in his community.

loans.use: Training and certification for his computer and electronic services business

loans.name: Reina De La Paz Group

texts.es: El grupo “Reina de la Paz” es un grupo nuevo que esta integrado de catorce  personas,  de las cuales 4 son hombres y 10 mujeres todos ellos se dedican a diferentes actividades como la venta de comida, gas, ropa, elaboración de pan, servicio de transporte público y a la educación de niños en escuelas. El nivel competitivo es alto pero las socias saben como salir adelante con la venta de sus productos, pero requieren de un apoyo económico para las épocas bajas en las cuales se requiere cambiar de productos o aumentar la mercadería es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento. A pesar que el grupo es nuevo cuenta con la experiencia de grupos solidarios debido a anteriores financiamientos en instituciones similares a al fundación Agrocapital quien les brinda un apoyo para agrandar sus negocios y a mejora la calida de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Reina de la Paz" group is a new group composed of fourteen people, of whom four are men and ten are women. All the members do different things to make a living, such as selling food, gas, or clothes, baking bread, providing public transport and educating children in schools. There is a high level of competition, but the members of the group know how to stay afloat with the sales of their products. However, they need economic support for the low periods during which they need to change products or increase their merchandise, and for this reason they require financing. Despite the fact that the group is newly formed, they have experience of support groups of this kind due to previous financing from instiutions similar to the Agrocapital foundation, who offer support to grow their businesses and improve the quality of life of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ismary Cecilia

texts.es: la Sra. Ismary M. tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de tres preciosas niñas, tiene de dedicarse a este negocio hace un año, en su pulperia vende productos como ser jabones, refrescos, pollos, espaguetis, salsas, palomitas de maiz, margarina y otros, el negocio se encuentra en un lugar estrategico donde transita mucha gente. la sra compra a la semana $474 y vende $586 obteniendo una ganancia de $112 a la semana, ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor, ya que asi se consiguen a mejor precio de lo normal, ella vive con su esposo y sus tres hijas, el sueño de ella es tener un mercadito bien instalado con todas las necesidades para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ismary M. is 35 years old and is the mother of three precious girls. She has been working at her present business for the past year. She has a small grocery store where she sells products like soaps, soft drinks, chicken, pasta, sauces, popcorn, margarine, and many other things. Her store has a great location with a lot of traffic. Ismary buys $474 worth of goods during the week and she sells $586. Her profit is $112 a week. She needs a loan to buy merchandise in bulk, since she can get the merchandise at better prices than the normal prices. She lives with her husband and her three children. Her dream is to have a little market that is all set up with all of the necessary items so that she can serve her customers well.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, churros, pasta, flour, spaghetti, lard, oil, sausages, and milk products.

loans.name: Impacto Group

texts.es: El banco comunal denominado “Impacto” esta representado por  la señora Mariela, conformado por 13 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican al servicio de secretariado, pero alguna de las socias se dedican a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ropa, pan al transporte publico y a la confección de prendas de vestir. La competencia en la venta de productos es alta pero las socias saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de crecer ya que de ello depende el bien estar de sus familias. El destino del crédito es para la apertura de negocios independientes y para la adquisición de mercarías para incrementar sus ingresos y poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calida de vida. A pesar que los integrantes del grupo no tienen experiencia en grupos solidaR. tienen las ganas de trabajar para salir adelante y dan gracias por poder contar con el apoyo económico que les brinda la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The Impacto (Impact) Communal Bank is represented by Señora Mariela and is composed of 13 members, the majority of whom are engaged in secretarial work. However, some of the members work at cosmetics catalog sales or selling clothing, or bread to public transport passengers, or they work at manufacturing articles of clothing. Their competence at selling products is high but the members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and their desire to grow since the well being of their families depends on it. The objective of the loan is to open up independent businesses and for the acquisition of merchandise in order to increase their incomes and be able to provide their families with a better quality of life. Despite the fact that the group members don't have experience in solidarity groups they are eager to work to get ahead, and they are thankful for being able to have the economic support that Fundación Agrocapital provides them.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: el Sr. Miguel tiene 44 años de edad, se dedica al servicio de tranporte desde los 15 años, el trabaja para poryectos transportando materiales como cemento, bloques, arena, canaletas, varillas, ventanas etc.. por cada viaje que realiza en sus vehiculos cobra $15.00 y gasta $7.00, el realiza 4 viajes diarios, el vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en la colonia Montelimar de la ciudad de Comayaguela, su esposa tiene una pequeña tienda de ropa nueva en la cual el le apoya, anteriormente su trabajo era de taxista pero fue ahorrando hasta poder comprarse este camion, el dinero lo necesita para pagar la ultima cuota de su camion, el sueño de el es poder tener varios camiones de transporte y asi salir adelante con su familia que es lo que mas quiere en este mundo.
texts.en:
Don Miguel is 44 years old, he has been working as a trucker since he was 15 years old. He works for projects transporting materials such as cement, blocks, sand, water pipes, rods, windows, etc. He charges $15.00 per trip in his vehicle, the expenses are $7.00 and he makes 4 trips daily. He lives with his wife and two children in the neighborhood Montelimar of the town of Camayaguela. His wife has a small store selling new clothes and he supports her. Previously he worked as a taxi driver but saved money so he could buy this truck. He needs the loan for the last payment of his truck. It is his dream to own several trucks and thus be able to get ahead together with his family. This is what he wants the most in this world.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a truck.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: San Juan Bautista Group

texts.es: El  grupo “San Juan Bautista” se encuentra cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando ante todo sus ganas D. salir adelante trabajando juntos, su presidenta es la señora Olga y ella al igual que sus compañeros se dedican ala venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, venta D. comida, cosméticos y a actividades como la sastrería, servicio D. limpieza y elaboración D. pan casero. El nivel competitivo en el mercado es alto pero los socios saben como salir adelante ya que D. ello depenD. el bien estar D. sus familias ya que ellos representan el pilar D. sus hogares. El destino del financiamiento es para capital D. trabajo y la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para coadyuvar en el incremento D. sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This is the second season of the group "San Juan Bautista" and above all, it has proven eager to get ahead working together. The president, doña Olga as well as her partners work selling groceries in local stores, food, cosmetics as well as tailoring, cleaning and baking homemaD. bread. The competition level at the market is high but the partners know how to get ahead as the well-being of their families are at stake and they represent the basis of their homes. The loan will be used as work capital and to purchase merchandise, supplies and tools to contribute to the increase of their income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Paraizo Group

texts.es: El grupo “Paraizo” esta representado por la señora Marcia y conformado por 16 miembros los cuales se dedican a actividades como la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, comida, ropa, pan, construcciones de viviendas, lavado de ropa a domicilio y distribuidores de productos. El nivel competitivo es alto pero los socios saben como salir adelante con la venta de sus productos, pero requieren de un apoyo económico para las épocas bajas en las cuales se requiere cambiar de productos o aumentar la mercadería es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento. A pesar que el grupo es nuevo cuenta con la experiencia de grupos solidarios debido a anteriores financiamientos en instituciones similares a al fundación Agrocapital quien les brinda un apoyo para agrandar sus negocios y a mejora la calida de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Paraizo" is represented by Mrs. Marcia and has 16 members who sell cosmetics from catalog, food, clothes, bread, build houses, do laundry at home and distribute products. The competition level is high but the partners know how to get ahead selling their products, but are in need of economic support for the low periods when they have to change the products or increase the merchandise, and for this reason they require financing. In spite of the group being new, it has experience from solidary groups due to prior loans from institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital who offers them support to extend their businesses and improve the life quality of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work caapital

loans.name: Buen Encuentro Group

texts.es:
el grupo el buen encuentro esta formado por tres mujeres muy exitosas, responsables y honestas, son vecinas cercanas y familiares al mismo tiempo, las actividades de ellas son las siguientes:
Lastenia O.: se dedica a la confeccion de cameras, cortinas y manteles, ella tiene 20 años de hacer este tipo de actividad, ella va al mercado a comprar las telas por libras, retazos grandes y pequeños y con esto aprovecha para confeccionar el producto que vende. ella vive en la colonia Vista Hermosa, tambien ella se dedica a elaborar tortillas esta actividad tiene poco tiempo de efectuarla pero le ayuda mucho para sus ingresos diarios. ella vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo vive en Estados Unidos. ella necesita el credito para comprar mas telas al por mayor y asi tener mayores ganancias.
la sra. Vilma O. es una mujer joven, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de cama, ella sale a vender a colonias cercanas de donde ella vive, los fin de mes viaja a una comunidad que se llama Soledad que esta ubicada en el departamento del Paraiso, ahi cuenta con clientes fijos, tambien ella aprovecha su estadia para ir a comunidades aledañas a esta.
tambien ella ofrece productos por catalogo como ser cremas, desodorantes, lapiz labial y otras cosas que le encargan. ella necesita el dinero para comprar mas productos al por mayor y asi tener mayores ventas cuando sale de viaje a las diferentes comunidades.
La sra. maritza Z.: es una chica muy joven, emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella tiene su negocio que es una pulperia la cual esta muy bien surtida pero ella siente que necesita comprar mas mecaderia para asi cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes. ella vive con su madre y tiene una hija de 20 meses de nacida, su pulperia lleva el nombre de GABY.
ella antes trabajaba para una empresa que fabricaba calzado pero esta quebro y la despidieron, por eso ella decidio poner su propio negocio.
texts.en:
The Good Encounters Group consists of three very successful, responsible and honest women who are both family and close neighbors. Their activities are as follows:

Lastenia O. makes a living making sewing dresses, drapes and tablecloths, and has 20 years experience in the business. She goes to the market to purchase the fabrics by the pound, big and small cuts, and with this she's able to make the products she sells. She lives in the colony of Vista Hermosa and also makes tortillas. It doesn't take up much time but it helps her a lot with her daily income. She lives with her two children, and her husband lives in the United States. She's requesting the loan to purchase more fabrics at wholesale and thus improve her margins.

Vilma O. is a young woman with a strong desire to move up in life. She makes a living selling bedding, going out to the colonies close to where she lives to sell her products. At the end of the month, she travels to a community called Soledad in the department of Paraiso, where she has permanent customers. She takes advantage of her stay by going to the surrounding communities as well. She also offers product via catalog, such as lotions, deodorants, lipstick and other items. She is requesting the loan to purchase more products at wholesale and thus have better earnings when she goes out to the different communities.

Maritza Z. is a very enterprising young woman with a strong desire to move up in life. She has a convenience store that is well stocked, but she feels she needs to buy more merchandise to meet all the needs of her customers. She lives with her mother and has a 20-month-old daughter. Her store is called GABY. She previously worked for a business that made footwear, but it folded and she was laid off, which is why she decided to start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale products and supplies for convenience store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Magnificas Group

texts.es: El Grupo “Las Magnificas” esta representadas por la señora Julia y compuesto  por 16 personas que van cursando juntas su quinto ciclo en la cual demostraron solidez, honradez y responsabilidad y siguen con las ganas D. seguir creciendo a pesar D. haber tropezado con algunos malos integrantes ellas siguen luchando por salir adelante en sus pequeños negocios D. venta D. frutas, carne, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, cosméticos por catálogos, comida y su dedicación a la música. El destino del crédito es para el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo para la compra D. materiales insumos y herramientas que ayuden a genera un mayor ingreso para seguir superándose y mejorando la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Las Magnificas" is represented by Mrs. Julia and has 16 members who have been together for five seasons showing strength, honesty, and responsibility, and continue wanting to go on growing in spite of having had problems with some bad members. They are still struggling to get ahead with their small businesses selling fruit, meat, groceries in local stores, cosmetics from catalog, food and dedicated to music. The loan will be spent to increase the work capital and buy supplies and tools to help increase earnings in order to continue to move ahead and improve the life quality of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Concepcion Rosario

texts.es:
la señora CONCEPCION ROSARIO A. de 55 años de edad, esta casada con el señor LORENZO FUNEZ,  tienen 06 hijos, todos casados, ella vive en la colonia nueva Vista de san lorenzo su casa esta fabricada con ladrillos de adobe y vive con su nieto, el cual esta en la escuela de la comunidad. ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y frescos, ella desea vender chicharras que es muy parecido al chicharron pero mas grande y tostado, ya que anteriormente tenia una pulperia pero no le funciono debido a  que en la zona hay muchas pulperias. es por esta razon que ella esta solocitando el credito ya que esta invirtiendo en las chicharras. 

ella quiere comprar el producto por mayor 

su deseo es que su nieto estudie y se prepare para la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Concepcion Rosario Alverez is 5 years old and is married to Mr. Lorenzo Funez. She has 6 children, all of whom are married. She lives in a new neighborhood, Vista de Son Lorenzo. Her house is made of bricks and adobe. She lives with her grandson, who goes to school in the community. She sells fruit and sodas. She wants to sell cicadas, which is like a pork crackling, but larger and more toasted. Earlier, she had a grocery store, but it did not do well because there are many grocery stores in her area. This is why she is asking for a loan to start selling cicadas. She wants to sell a better product so her grandson can continue to study and prepare for his life.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cicadas, salt, sodas, fruit

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Bautista Group

texts.es: El grupo “Juan Bautista” esta reprensado por la señora Carmen, es un grupo nuevo que se reunieron entre personas de la misma comunidad de manera que se conocen muy bien y confían uno al otro. En general los integrantes se dedican a la venta de aves, zapatos, pan, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, dulce, salteña y algunos al servicio de transporte en motocicletas. El entorno de los miembros del grupo es bastante competitivo pero con sus ganas de trabajar y su experiencia salen adelante para brinda a sus hogares una mejor calida de vida. El destino del crédito es para adquisición de materiales, repuestos, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso para otorgar a sus familias un hogar económicamente estable. A pesar de ser un grupo nuevo cuentan con experiencia en créditos solidarios por lo que saben administrar bien los fondos otorgados.
texts.en:
The "Juan Bautista" ("John the Baptist") group is represented by Carmen. This is a new group that brings together people from the same community who know each other well and trust in each other. In general the members make a living selling birds, shoes, bread, groceries in neighborhood stores, candy, empanadas, and some work in transportation with mototaxis. The business environment for the group members is quite competitive, but with their will to work and their experience they are able to make headway to provide their households with a better quality of life. The loan will be used to acquire materials, spare parts, ingredients and tools that will help the members generate more income to make their family finances stable. Despite being a new group the members have experience with group loans and know how to administer the funds well.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials, spare parts, ingredients and tools that will help make the members' businesses more efficient

loans.name: Cristobal Antonio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Cristobal A. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su servicio de taxi el cual es el negocio que le permite llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

El señor Cristobal ha logrado salir adelante gracias a los créditos que ha realizado en Ceprodel y hoy en día se siente muy contento porque ha solicitado un nuevo crédito y está seguro que le será proporcionado para la compra de los repuestos y reparación del taxi para continuar con su ardua labor en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandga, Cristobal A. works hard to make a living with his taxi service, a business that allows him to provide sustenance for his home. Cristobal has been able to make headway thanks to the loans from Kiva partner CEPRODEL. Today he feels very satisfied because he has requested a new loan and is sure it will be provided for the purchase of spare parts and to repair his taxi so he can continue working hard in his city.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Fátima Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo y gran dedicación y empeño a su trabajo, la señora Fátima H. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería ubicado en la ciudad de Chinandega donde es muy visitada por sus clientes todos los días para realizar sus compras.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y con mucho interés en seguir desarrollando su negocio. Hoy en día espera que Ceprodel le brinde un nuevo crédito para la compra de los productos para la pulpería y de esta forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
With a lot of hard work and dedication to her job, Fátima H. makes a living with her convenience store business located in the city of Chinandega. Her store is busy with customers every day to make their purchases. She has shown herself to be a very hard-working person who is very interested in developing her business. Today she hopes that Kiva partner CEPRODEL provides her with a new loan for the purchase of products for her convenience store, and in this way she will improve the living condition for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her convenience store

loans.name: Rodrigo Cristino

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente en las afueras del Mercado central, el señor Rodrigo P. se dedica a su actividad de servicio de transporte teniendo su propio triciclo con el cual traslada a las personas de un lado a otro dependiendo el lugar que se visite.

Rodrigo tiene la necesidad de invertir en el triciclo para mejorar sus condiciones y por esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito y así mejorar el medio de transporte y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, specifically in the outskirts of the central market, Rodrigo P. makes a living transporting customers with his pedicab, taking them from one side to the other depending the location. Rodrigo faces the necessity of investing in his pedicab to improve its conditions, and for this he has turned to Kiva partner CEPRODEL to request a loan so he can improve his means of transportation and provide a better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his mototaxi

loans.name: Isidro Eradio

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo en el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Isidro P. se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos ferreteros ofreciendo todo tipo de producto del ramo de la ferretería.

A este negocio se dedica desde hace dos años y se ha logrado ver el cambio que ha tenido el negocio habiéndose desarrollado cada día más. Hoy en día espera ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de los productos ferreteros y así continuar logrando la satisfacción de todos sus clientes en el mercado.
texts.en:
With a lot of enthusiasm in the central market of Chinandega city, Isidro P. dedicates himself to his business of selling hardware products, offering all types of products from the hardware industry. He has worked in this business for two years and has been able to see the business change, developing more every day. Today he hopes to benefit from a loan to buy more hardware products and thus continue winning the satisfaction of his customers in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hardware products

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es:
La señora Celinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Violetas II”, vive en el Jr. Carlos Mariátegui Nº 250, Distrito de Nueva Cajamarca, Provincia Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 39 años tiene 5 hijos, todos aun en etapa escolar.  

Motivada por sus ganas de sacar adelante a su familia  y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora, inicio su negocio con un capital de S/. 300.00 vendiendo  artículos para el hogar como, ollas de aluminio, platos y  tasas de loza, jarra y vasos de vidrio, bandejas de plástico entre  otros, productos que los ofrece en las ferias o festividades que se realizan en las distintas comunidades aledañas a la ciudad de Nueva Cajamarca, sitios  que recorre junto a su esposo donde son muy conocidos por los buenos productos y por los cómodos precios que venden. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará  juegos de ollas de aluminio de 12 y 7 piezas de varias marcas, 6 docenas de platos de loza, tazas, 5 docenas de jarras y vasos de vidrio, 4 docenas de bandejas de plástico de distintos  tamaños para así mantener a su clientela satisfecha porque   encontrará  en su negocio los productos que buscan.
 
Se siente muy contenta, ya que pese a las dificultades supo salir adelante junto a su familia, por lo que reconoce y agradece el apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres, que quieren emprender su negocio y salir adelante solas, sin depender de nadie.
texts.en:
Celinda belongs to “Las Violetas II” Communal Bank. She lives at Nº 250 Carlos Mariátegui St., in Nueva Cajamarca, Rioja province, Department of San Martín. She is 39 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their 5 children, who are all in school. Motivated by her desire to support her family, and thanks to her energy and enterprising nature, Celinda started her business with 300.00 soles in capital. She sells household products such as aluminum pots, china plates and cups, glasses, glass jugs, plastic trays, etc. Celinda sells these products at street markets and festivities, which take place in the various communities near the city of Nueva Cajamarca. She and her husband travel to these communities together, and they are known in these places for their good products and their reasonable prices. Celinda will use this loan of 800.00 soles to purchase 12 sets of aluminum pots, 7 pieces of various types, 6 dozen china plates and cups, 5 dozen glasses and glass jugs, and 4 dozen plastic trays of different sizes. These products will allow her to keep her clientele satisfied, since she will have everything her customers are looking for. Celinda feels very happy, since despite the difficulties, she knows that she and her family will be able to get ahead. She recognizes and appreciates the support that the Manuela Ramos organization has given to her and to other women who want to start businesses and succeed on their own, without being dependent on anyone.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing products to increase her stock.

loans.name: Alicia De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo e interés por desarrollar su negocio, la señora Alicia O. se dedica a la comercialización de ropa en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega siendo este negocio el que le permite percibir ingresos para su desarrollo.

Hoy en día ella necesita invertir en la compra de la ropa para comercializarla y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y así adquirir la mercadería y ofrecerla a sus fieles clientes.
texts.en:
Having a lot of enthusiasm and desire to develop her business, Alicia O. sells clothing in Chinandega's Central Market. This business allows her to earn money for her development. Currently she needs to invest in buying clothes to sell, which is why she turned to Ceprodel to receive a loan, which will enable her to acquire merchandise that she can offer to her loyal clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Norita

texts.es:
La señora Norita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Hilmer Torres”, vive en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte, Distrito D. Morales, Provincia San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 57 años, 04 hijos todos ellos ya independientes y formando sus propias  familias.

Norita, a su edad aun se siente con fuerzas para seguir trabajando, ella se dedica a la venta D. bebidas gasificadas. Manifiesta que con el negocio que ejerce se siente muy tranquila y contenta, es ella quien administra su negocio. Se siente muy capaz y responsable con las cuotas que debe pagar mensualmente al Banco Comunal.

Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio,  es conocida en el barrio; ya que sus gaseosas las venD. bien heladitas al gusto del cliente.
Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando mas bebidas gaseosas D. diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas. Así como agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Se siente orgullosa por haber logrado implementar su negocio, y asegurarse una vejez tranquila. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a superarse y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y a defenderse como mujeres.
texts.en:
Norita belongs to the "Hilmer Torres" Community Bank and lives on Alfonso Ugarte Street, in Morales District, San Martin Province and Department. She is married, 57 years old, and has 4 children, all of whom are now independent, with families of their own. At her age, Norita still has energy to keep working. She sells carbonated beverages. She says that with her business she feels very secure and content. She is responsible for administering the business. She feels responsible to the Community Bank and able to make her monthly payments. She currently is working in the same business and is well known in the neighborhood because she sells her sodas well-chilled as her clients like them. With this loan of 1000 PEN she wants to invest in buying sodas of different flavors, sizes and brands, as well as mineral water, both carbonated and still. She is proud of herself for having been able to start this business, guaranteeing herself a secure old age. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for having helped her and other women to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas to augment the products she sells

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Violetas II”, vive en Jr. Bolognesi Nº 300, Distrito de Nuevo Cajamarca, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 43 años, 02 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes y con familia.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Gloria, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y se siente muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the "Las Violetas II" Community Bank and lives at 300 Bolognesi Street, Nuevo Cajamarca District, San Martin Province and Department. She is married, 43 years old, and has 2 children, both independent with families of their own. Because of her character and her desire to fulfill her dreams she started a business selling groceries. With the earnings from the business, she has helped support her household. From the beginning her business has continually added customers. She now has steady customers who come to her store every day because she offers all of the products that a housewife needs and because she attends to the needs of her customers with her characteristic charisma. With this loan of 3000 PEN she wants to invest in buying sacks of rice and sugar, packets of cookies, pasta and salt, milk, canned fish, eggs, and personal hygiene articles in order to be able to continue providing good service to her customers. Gloria feels strong and able to continue working and is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have development opportunities in their communities.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, cookies, milk, etc.

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
La señora Lili, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II”, vive en el Jr. Víctor Andrés Belaunde Nº 489, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 40 años, 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Deseando ver profesional a su único hijo, y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que antes vendía zapatos y en su trayectoria paso por muchas dificultades, pero su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante sola le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas prepararas.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y le va muy bien, tiene sus clientes fijos y ya es conocida por sus clientes, y por la buena sazón de sus comidas.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,800.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de comidas, posteriormente desea implementar mas su negocio con un Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Lili belongs to the "Las Estrellitas II" Community Bank and lives at 489 Victor Andres Belaunde Street, in Tarapoto District, San Martin Province and Department. She is separated, 40 years old, and has 2 children that still depend on her. Wanting to see her only son become a professional and to earn her own income to be able to achieve that goal, she decided to start her own business. She tells us that she used to sell shoes and that she went through a lot of difficulties, but her strong will and desire to get ahead have helped to start her own business selling prepared foods. She continues with that business now and it is going very well. She has steady customers and is well known for her clientele and for the tastiness of her food. With this loan of 1800 PEN she wants to invest in materials for her dishes, such as sacks of rice and sugar, chickens and eggs, bananas, pastas and oils, as well as cooking utensils, in order to be able to offer quality service. She feels great strength to continue selling food and eventually grow her business into a well-appointed restaurant, to provide better service to her clientele. She is grateful to the Manuala Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food for catering business

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La señora Matilde, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II”, vive en el Jr. Tahuantinsuyo Cdra. 06, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 47 años, 03 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de Juanes, en el Mercado Nº 02 de la Ciudad, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y moradores de la comunidad, hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donde vende diariamente  por las mañanas. Tiene años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 desea invertirlo comprando víveres como arroz en sacos, huevos en javas, gallinas criollas para sus juanes; asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Matilde, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Matilde belongs to the “Las Estrellitas II” Community Bank and lives at Block 6, Tahuantinsuyo Street, Tarapoto District, San Martín Province and Department. She is married, 47 years old, and has 3 children, all now independent. With the hard-working spirit that has always characterized her, and wanting to get ahead on her own, she started her own business selling "juanes" (a typical Peruvian dish) in the Number 2 Market in the city. Little by little she built a reputation among her customers and in the community, and she tells us that her business is doing very well. She continues now with that business, selling food every morning. She has been working in this business for years and is very happy with what she does. With this loan of 1000 PEN she wants to invest in buying sacks of rice, eggs and chickens for her "juanes" as well as cooking utensils in order to be able to offer quality service. Matilde feels secure and content with her work and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare food for sale (rice, eggs, chicken).  Purchase cooking utensils

loans.name: Mirelith

texts.es:
Mirelith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Shatojinas Laboriosas”, vive en el Calle Comercio S/Nº, Distrito de Shatoja, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 02 de los cuales aun dependen de ella.

Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de comida diaria tipo menú, ubicada en su misma casa.

En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su puesto de venta, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 1.500.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante, Mirelith, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mirelith belongs to the "Shatojinas Laboriosas” communal bank and lives on Comercio Street in the district of Shatoja in the province of San Martín. She is married, 34 years old, and a mother of 2 children whom both are dependent on her. With confidence in her ability to prepare various kinds of tasty food, she used her first loan of 300 Soles to start a business selling food, from a fixed menu, in her own house. Currently, she continues in the same business and already has a loyal client base that comes daily to her stand, where she attends to them with the charisma for which she is known. With this loan of 1,500 Soles she would like to purchase ingredients for the preparation of her dishes, such as sacs of rice and sugar, packages of oil, chicken as well as utensils, to be able to expand her business and improve the service she provides to her clients. She is prepared for everything and still has a lot of motivation to continue working and get ahead. Mirelith is thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the realization of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare food (sugar, rice, chicken, noodles)

loans.name: Zeudi

texts.es:
La señora Zeudi, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II”, vive en el Jr. Progreso Nº 533, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años, 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella y son por la que ella trabaja constantemente.

Motivada por su espíritu joven y su energía emprendedora, inicio su negocio con un capital de S/. 300.00 con la Venta de limones, en un puesto del Mercado “El Huequito” de la misma ciudad, tiene clientes fijos y es ella quien  los atiende con su carisma y buen trato. 
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio esta satisfecha con lo que hace.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará  07 sacos de limones, parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando mesas para ubicar sus limones.

Se siente muy contenta, ya que pese a las dificultades supo salir adelante junto a su familia, por lo que reconoce y agradece el apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres, que quieren emprender su negocio y salir adelante solas, sin depender de nadie.
texts.en:
Zeudi belongs to the “Las Estrellitas II” Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. Progreso Nº 533, in the Tarapoto District of San Martín Province, in the San Martín Region of Peru. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner and has two dependent children who are the reason she works constantly.
Driven by her youthful spirit and enterprising energy, she started selling lemons at a stall in the city’s “El Huequito” Market with 300 PEN in capital. She has regular customers and, with charisma, she provides them excellent customer service. She continues to runs the same business and is happy in what she does.
With this 1000 PEN loan, she will buy 7 sacks of lemons and will also use part of the money to purchase tables to display them.
She is very happy since she has been able to overcome difficulties together with her family. She acknowledges and is grateful for the support that the Manuela Ramos Movement provides her and other women who wish to start up a business and make it, without depending on anyone.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of lemons and tables to display her products

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora tiene 53 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la elaboración de ropa, labor que le gusta mucho, ya que coser es una actividad que le gustó hacer desde muy joven. Además de esto, Aurora tiene unos locales que alquila para diversos negocios en una zona comercial de su localidad. Con ambas actividades obtiene los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su familia y la educación de sus hijos. Para un futuro cercano, a Aurora le gustaría tener un taller muy bien implementado de costura, ya que por el momento todos sus trabajos los hace en casa. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes demuestran responsabilidad en sus pagos, además de ser muy unidos en las diversas actividades demandadas por su asesor de crédito. Con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales de costura (telas, hilos y otros), además arreglará las estructuras de uno de sus locales para poder alquilarlo pronto.
texts.en:
Aurora is 53 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her two children in a house of her own. She's been making clothes for three years and enjoys the work because sewing is an activity she's liked since she was young. In addition, Aurora rents space to a number of businesses in a commercial district in her city. These two sources of income provide her with enough to cover her family's expenses and her children's education. In the near future, Aurora would like to have a well-supplied sewing workshop, since she works from home at the moment.
