This is her sixth loan with MFP, and what she likes about her communal bank is that all the members are responsible with their payments, as well as being very engaged in the variety of activities required by their loan advisor. She will use the requested loan to purchase sewing supplies (cloth, thread, etc.), as well as repairing structural damage in one of her commercial spaces so she can rent it out.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials and repairing one of her rental spaces

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora María S. se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos diversos ofrecidos en su propia pulpería la cual ha logrado manejar y sacar adelante gracias a sus esfuerzos por mejorar el negocio.

Ella es una dama que ha logrado aprovechar los créditos brindados por Ceprodel y hoy en día una vez más acude para ser beneficiada con un nuevo crédito que le permita la compra de dichos productos para ofertarlos en la pulpería y de esta manera contribuir al bienestar de su amada familia que tiene que mantener.
texts.en:
María S. dedicates herself to the her business in the sale of various products offered in her small grocery store, which she has been able to manage and continue expanding thanks to her efforts to improve the business. She is a woman who has been able to take advantage of the loans offered by Ceprodel and now she again seeks a new loan that will allow her to purchase products to offer in her small grocery store; in this way she will contribute to the well-being of her beloved family who she has to support.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Violetas II”, vive en la Provincia Rioja, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años, 04 hijos, el mayor ya independiente y los tres menores aun son estudiantes. 

Alejandrina, es una mujer muy jovial, alegre y optimista que se inicio vendiendo verduras en pequeñas cantidades que los comerciantes mayoristas lo daban a crédito confiados en su responsabilidad a la que ella no defraudó en ningún momento, poco a poco fue haciéndose D. su capital hasta que se instaló en un puesto D. ventas del mercado central D. la ciudad D. Nueva Cajamarca, cambiando el negocio D. la venta D. verduras por la D.  frutas.

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden al Mercado a comprar frutas D. la Región muy variados  y D. muy buena calidad para preparar jugos o para comerlos como postre, es ella quien personalmente les atienD.  con una sonrisa.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando sacos D. naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, taperibas, piñas  y plátanos verdes y guineos en racimos para así mantener surtido su negocio y dar una buena  atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Alejandrina, sueña con tener un negocio D. venta D. ropa. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alejandrina belongs to the communal bank “Las Violetas II” (The Violets II). She lives in Nueva Cajamarca, Rioja Province, Department of San Martín. She is married, 48 years old and has four children – the oldest of which lives independently. The three younger children are students. Alejandrina is a very jovial, happy and optimistic woman, who started selling vegetables in small quantities that wholesale merchants would give to her on credit. It was her responsibility not to defraud on her payments at any time. Little by little she was making capital that way, until she installed a stand at the central market in the city of Cajamarca, changing her business from the sale of vegetables to the sale of fruits. Now, she has faithful clientele who come to the Market daily to buy her varied, high-quality local fruit to make juices or to eat as desert. She always attends to her customers with a smile. With this loan of S/ 2,000.00, she wants to invest in buying sacks of oranges, tangerines, lemons, grapefruit, golden apples, pineapples, and bunches of green plantains and bananas in order to keep her business stocked and to give her clients what they need. Alejandrina dreams of having a clothing business. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her execute her business, and also to the many women that want her to grow personally and in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more fruit

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Violetas II”, vive en Jr. Imperio Nº 475, Distrito de Nuevo Cajamarca, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 51 años, 03 hijos, uno que aun dependen de ella y esta estudiando.

Su impulso  y empeño de ver a sus hijos profesionales, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico de su familia, ya que es una madre soltera, aprendió a seguir adelante. 
En la actualidad, es muy querida por sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque ella cuenta con todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es ella misma quien les brinda su atención con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, desea invertirlo comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Julita como le dicen de cariño, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, día a día agradece a la vida, por brindarle una gran oportunidad de salir adelante como mujer, igualmente al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por iniciarla a convertirse en una mujer empresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Julia belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Violetas II", and lives in Jr. Imperio Nº 475, a district of Nueva Cajamarca, Province San Martín, Departmento de San Martín. She is single, fifty one years old, and has three children, one who still depends on her and is studying. Her motivation and pledge is to see her children become professionals. They motivated her to undertake her own business selling groceries. Her business is located in her own house, a location very well suited to care for her clients. The profits she generates help the economic income of her family. Since she is a single mother, she learned to get by and keep going. Currently, she is very wanted by her regular clients who daily come to her store for purchases because she has all the products the housewife needs, and she herself gives everyone her attention with the charisma that characterizes her. With the loan of S/ 1,500.00, she will invest in buying rice and sugar in bulk bags, noodles in packages, milk and presreved fish in packets and a varietry of brands, eggs in cartons and articles of personal hygiene, so she can continue giving her clients better attention. Julita, as they say with affection, feels a great deal of fortitude in order to continue working, day by day giving thanks for her life. This loan will be a great opportunity to do well by this women, likewise to the Movement Manuela Ramos, by intiating her conversion to a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to augment her products (rice, sugar, noodles, etc)

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
En la cuidad de Chinandega, la señora Silvia S. con gran entusiasmo y dedicación trabaja en su panadería propia elaborando el pan que es comercializado a diario en su panadería el cual es visitada por sus clientes.

Ella ha logrado mejorar sus condiciones y para ello hoy en día una vez más ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar el pan. La materia prima es la harina, azúcar, levadura, entre otros. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente en su negocio
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega Silvia S. works in her bakery with great enthusiasm and dedication making bread; the bread is sold daily in her bakery, which is visited by her clients. She has been able to improve her conditions and because of this she currently is again seeking the support of Ceprodel by soliciting a loan to purchase basic materials for bread making. The basic materials are flour, sugar, and yeast, amongst others. This credit will help her business a great deal.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic materials to make bread.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos es padre soltero, tiene 33 años, vive con su hija de 3 añitos, su madre y su hermana. Desde hace 8 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros (taxi) en su motocarro, y para incrementar sus ingresos económicos, desde hace 2 años empezó a criar pollos en un galpón que construyó el mismo en un espacio de su casa, los cuales, después de que llegan a un tamaño y peso adecuado (cada 45 días), los vende. Ambas labores le ayudan a satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar, por lo que está muy satisfecho por lo que hasta el momento ha conseguido. Para un futuro cercano, Carlos quiere empezar a criar pavos y cerdos, pues ha notado que la carne de estos animales, también es muy demandada. Este es su 5to crédito con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que existe compañerismo y solidaridad entre todos sus compañeros y compañeras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará pollos bebé y suficiente alimento para su crianza.
texts.en:
Carlos is a single father, he is 33 years old, and he lives with his baby daughter of 3 years, with his wife and sister. For the past 8 years he has been providing public transport (taxi services) on his motorcycle. And to supplement his income, 2 years ago he started raising chickens in a coop he built in a space on his property. When the chickens grow to a certain size and weight (about every 45 days) he sells them. Both jobs help him fill the household necessities. He is so happy to have achieved what he has to date. For the near future, Carlos would like to start raising turkeys and pigs. He has noted that the meat products from this animals is in great demand. This is his 5th credit with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). What he loves best about his community bank is that there exists a sense of friendship and solidarity among the members. With the funds he is requesting he will pruchase chicks and enough feed to raise them.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Maria Elva

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elva, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Violetas  II”, vive en el Jr. Nicaragua Cuadra 1, Barrio Santa Isabel, Distrito de Nueva Cajamarca, Provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 52 años y 03 hijos todos  independientes.

Desde hace muchos años Maria Elva se dedica al lavado de ropa, en sus inicio lo hacia manualmente  pero sus usuarios  fueron  aumentando. dado  el servicio  de calidad que realizaba a sus clientes estos quedaban satisfechos, por lo que con el préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 que obtuvo adquirió una lavadora eléctrica de segunda mano, pero esto tampoco fue suficiente porque entre sus clientes también ya cuenta con instituciones privadas que envían gran cantidad  de ropa para lavar, actualmente cuenta con otra lavadora digital que le es de muchísima ayuda.  

Uno de sus sueños y metas por lograr, es implementar una lavandería mas grande con lavadoras y secadoras industriales y así pueda expandir mas su cartera de clientes. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 2000.00, cancelará el costo  de su actual lavadora. Además comprara  detergente en cajas, jabón en barras y suavizantes en frascos  para así seguir dando un servicio de calidad.  

Maria Elva, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Maria Elva belongs to the Community Bank "Las Violetas II". She lives in Jr. Nicaragua Cuadra 1, in the Santa Isabel region of the Cajamarca district, located in Rioja, San Martin. She is married, 52 years old and has 3 children, all of whom are independent.

For the past many years Maria Elva has been providing laundry services. When she just started she washed clothes by hand but her customers soon started to multiply. Given the high quality of service she provides her clients were also very satisfied. With the first loan of S/.300 nuevos soles she purchased a second-hand washing machine. But this soon was not enough either because she soon started providing her services to private organizations that sent her large volumes of washing to do. Currently she has a digital washing machine that has been enormous help to her.

One of her dreams and a goal to strive for is the establishment of a larger laundry shop, set up with industrial washers and dryers, so that she might expand her roster of clients.

With the requested loan of S/2000 she will completely pay off the washer she currently has. And she will purchase boxes of detergent and fabric softener, to keep up the level of service she has been providing.

Maria Elva feels like a very accomplished woman, and now more than ever she has the drive to make her dreams a reality. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) to having helped her start up her business, as it has been done for so many other women entrepreneurs.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete payment on a washer and to purchase laundry products (soaps and detergents).

loans.name: Clarial De Los Angeles

texts.es:
En el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Clarial P. se dedica a la venta de ropa y chinelas comercializadas todos los días en su tramo donde a diario es visitada por los clientes que adquieren sus productos.

Hoy en día una vez mas espera ser beneficiada con los créditos de Ceprodel para la compra de los productos y de esta manera ofertarlos para continuar mejorando su situación económica y la de su familia.
texts.en:
In the central market of the city of Chinandega, Clarial P. dedicates herself to the sale of clothing and sandals sold every day in her stand that is visited by clients that buy her products. At present she is hoping to again take advantage of the loans offered by Ceprodel to purchase products that she will offer to continue improving her and her family’s economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and sandals.

texts.es: Charito tiene 40 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus 2 hijos, quienes son estudiantes, uno cursa el 1º de primaria y el otro 3º de secundaria. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y de productos de belleza por catálogo de una línea cosmética muy reconocida a nivel nacional. Ambas cosas las lleva a vender por los diferentes lugares de su localidad, de casa en casa, dejándolas al contado y al crédito. Charito trabaja sólo por las tardes, ya que por la mañana se ocupa de las labores en el hogar. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque por medio de él conoce a mucha gente, lo que le es beneficioso pues obtiene más clientes. La mayor dificultad que se le presenta es cuando las personas incumplen con su pago, por lo demás, dice que le va bien, pues se considera una mujer decidida y luchadora, que siempre trata de cumplir lo que se propone. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos son solidarios y existe mucho compañerismo, pues todos están pendientes de las necesidades de los demás y se ayudan mutuamente. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de belleza y ropa para seguir activa en su negocio.
texts.en:
Charito is a 40-year-old single mother with 2 school age children—one is in first grade while the other is in his third year of secondary school. For 5 years, she has been selling clothing and beauty products by catalogue from a nationally-known line of cosmetics. She sells these products door-to-door in her locality, accepting cash and credit payments. Charito works only evenings because she takes care of the household chores in the morning. She really likes her job because it allows her to get to know many people, which is beneficial because she obtains more customers that way. Her biggest challenge is when people do not make payments, but other than that, her business is prosperous. She considers herself a determined and hard-working woman who always tries to achieve what she sets out to do. This is her 2nd loan with MFP. What she likes about her microfinance institute is that all its members are united and there is a lot of camaraderie because they all worry about each others’ needs, and they help each other out. With the loan that she is requesting, she will purchase more beauty products and clothing so that she can keep her business afloat.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
La señora Emma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Shatojinas Laboriosas”, vive en el Jr. Sargento Lores S/Nº, Provincia El Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y es madre de 06 hijos, 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Viviendo cerca a un lugar donde hay mucho movimiento, Emma decidió vender sus comidas preparadas y anticuchos en la Plaza de su Distrito, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados y tiene mucha acogida. 
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, a partir de las 6:00 de la tarde. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propio restaurant en un local bien acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Emma P. is a member of the “Shatojinas Laboriosas” Microfinance Institute. She is a 48-year-old married mother of 6 children, 3 of whom are still her dependents.

Living near a bustling area, Emma decided to sell prepared foods and marinated grilled meat on skewers (anticuchos) at her district’s main square. She states that daily sales are good because of the delicious flavor that she gives to her dishes, and because her business is so welcoming.

She currently owns this same business, and she is satisfied with the job that she does day by day, starting at 6pm. She personally attends to her customers with the charisma that she is noted for.

She would like to invest this 2,000.00 PEN loan in purchasing ingredients for her daily food preparation, such as rice by the kilogram, sugar, gallons of cooking oil, chicken, and utensils to restock her business and provide better customer service. She feels alive and has the desire to keep moving forward. She has many dreams and goals in her life, such as launching her own restaurant in a well-equipped business space. She gives thanks to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food preparation ingredients (rice, sugar, cooking oil, chicken)

loans.name: Gabic Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Gabic, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Hilmer Torres”, vive en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 560, Distrito de Morales, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años, 02 hijos que aun depende de ella.

Es una mujer capaz, se dedica al servicio de Fotocopias, implemento su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, donde atiende diariamente con muy buena demanda de clientes,  por lo que se siente muy contenta ya que es la única fotocopia en el barrio y al frente de un Colegio.
Nos cuenta también que para iniciarse, tuvo que haber pasado por muchos retos, empezaron con una impresora multifuncional, viendo que el procedimiento era muy lento, decidió comprarse una fotocopiadora mas grande, para poder atender a sus clientes y atenderlos mas rápido.
 En la actualidad ya es conocida por sus clientes, mayormente alumnos, amigos, vecinos y clientes fijos, cuenta con un personal que la apoya.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando millares de papel bond y frascos de toner para contar con todo el material necesario y no le falte el  momento mas oportuno.

Gabic, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy capaz, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida, con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos que le ayudo a iniciarse como una mujer empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Gabic Z. is a member of the “Hilmer Torres” Microfinance Institute. She is a 38-year-old married mother with two dependent children.

She is a competent woman who offers photocopy services in her business, which she runs from home. She serves a sizeable amount of customers, which is why she feels happy to be the only copy center in the neighborhood across the street from a school.

She also states that in order to get settled, she had to overcome many challenges. She started out with just a multifunction printer, but upon seeing that it was too slow, she decided to purchase a bigger copy machine so that she could offer her customers speedy services.

She is now well-known by her customers, who are mostly students, friends, neighbors, and steady customers. She also has supportive personnel.

She would like to invest this 1,000.00 PEN loan in purchasing reams of bond paper and toner cartridges so that she can have the necessary supplies and not run out when she most needs them.

Gabic now feels like a capable woman with a stronger desire to get ahead in life and realize her dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to get started as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase copy machine supplies (paper and toner)

loans.name: Mayra Damaris

texts.es:
Desde hace 5 años en la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Mayra se dedica a su negocio de venta de carne atendida por ella misma todos los días siendo este el negocio que ella tiene con el cual sustenta a su familia.

Ha logrado mejorar su situación apoyándose de los créditos que Ceprodel le ha brindado y hoy en día una vez más ha acudido esperando ser beneficiada con un nuevo crédito para así continuar saliendo adelante y proyectándose en su negocio de venta de carne.
texts.en:
For five years, Ms. Mayra A. has had her own butcher shop in the city of Chinandega. She runs this business herself everyday because she supports her family with it.

She has managed to improve her living conditions with the support that Ceprodel has given her in the form of loans. Today, she once again turns to this institute, hoping to be granted a new loan so that she can keep moving forward with her butcher shop.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat

loans.name: Luz Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Luz Pilar, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Violetas II”, vive en el Jr. Bolognesi Nº 524, Distrito de Nueva Cajamarca, Provincia Rioja Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 30 años, 03 hijos, 2 de ellas estudian en la escuela primaria  y  la última educación inicial.

Su espíritu juvenil y la necesidad de ayudar en el ingreso económico del hogar le motivo a iniciarse en el negocio y no vio la mejor manera de hacerlo con el primer préstamo que le otorgaron de S/. 300.00,  con esto mandó a confeccionar una maleta de madera  y en ella ofrecer las golosinas que tenia proyectado vender a sus clientes que serian los alumnos y profesores de un centro educativo que se ubica muy cerca de su casa., es así como se inicia y hoy continua con la misma actividad, diariamente tiene muy buenas ventas por lo que se siente muy contenta, por eso trabaja en doble turno por la mañana en un centro educativo y por la tarde en otro. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00, lo invertirá comprando golosinas como: chocolates sublimes, cañonazo; chupetines, chicles y galletas y caramelos en diferentes sabores y marcas; así satisfacer a sus clientes, parte del dinero también lo invirtió comprando pequeños juguetes que también son  pedidos de sus pequeños clientes.

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo que le demanda bastante tiempo ,  cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida como son el de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Luz Pilar is a member of the “Las Violetas II” Microfinance Institute. She is a 30-year-old married mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are in elementary school while the other is in preschool.

Her youthful spirit and her need to help with the household income motivated her to start her own business, and what better way to do it than with her first 300.00 PEN loan. With this money, she had a wooden case made so that she can use it to sell candy to her customers—the students and teachers of an educational center near her home. Thus, she started her business, which she is still running today. Everyday, sales are good, which makes her happy. For that reason, she works double shifts—in the morning at one educational center, and in the evening at another.

She will invest this 800.00 PEN loan in purchasing sweets, such as: Sublime white chocolate, Cañonazo chocolate crispy wafers, lollipops, bubble gum, cookies, and candies of different brands and flavors so that she can keep her customers satisfied. She will also invest some of the money in purchasing small toys that her young customers ordered.

She feels very satisfied with her work, even though it takes up a lot of her time. She thinks it is worth the sacrifice because she can realize her dreams and reach her lifetime goal of getting her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy to increase inventory

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
La señora Lita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II”, vive en el Jr. Progreso Nº 380 – Centro Poblado 09 de Abril, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 42 años y 01 hijo independientes.

Anteriormente Lita, se dedicaba a la venta de ropa y zapatos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su taller de confección de vestidos y teniendo habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo Manuela Ramos decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa.
 Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.
Uno de sus sueños y meta por lograr, es implementar su propio taller de confección de ropas para dormir, confeccionadas por ella misma.
En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de ropas y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,300.00, desea invertirlo comprando telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Lita, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Lita belongs to the Las Estrellitas II Community Bank. She lives on Jr. Progreso Nº 380 – Centro Poblado 09 de Abril, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 42, single, and has one independent son. Lita previously sold clothes and shoes. Little by little, she was generating her own income and saving money. She wanted to set up a clothes making shop. Having sewing talent, she did not doubt in doing so. With the help from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open her own business, which is located in her house. Her sales are going very well. She works on advance orders from her customers. One of her dreams and goals is to set up her own shop for making sleepwear, which she would make. She currently continues making clothes. She has a loyal customer base. She stays home each day completing her sewing and filling orders. She tends to her customers with her characteristic amiability. With the loan for 1,300 PEN she will buy meters of different types of fabric; tools like scissors, sewing needles for both machine and hand sewing, pins and buttons. Lita feels that she is an accomplished woman, with the desire to achieve and make her dreams a reality. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business, as well as assisting many women who hope to expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kilos of fabric to make clothes

loans.name: Mily

texts.es:
La señora Mily, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Shatojinas Laboriosas”, vive en el Ex Aeropuerto cdra. 01, Distrito de Shatoja, Provincia El Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 45 años 04 hijos, uno que aun dependen de ella.

Mily, una mujer que se siente capaz de cumplir sus metas, por lo que ella y su esposo, decidieron implementar su propio negocio  de venta de maderas. 
Se inicio en el negocio desde muy joven, actividad que le ayudo a realizarse como mujer y así saco adelante a sus hijos y hoy ya son profesionales, al mismo tiempo esta muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos, por brindarle el apoyo para mejorar su negocio.
Hoy en día, continua con el mismo negocio, tiene muy buena acogida y cuenta con clientes fijos ya fidelizados, también trabaja con diferentes empresas.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1000.00, desea invertirlo comprando maderas como: cedro, alfaro, paliperro, rifari, anacaspi. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando combustible para hacer su aserrín y luego venderlas. 

Mily, esta muy contenta  y se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarial.
texts.en:
Mily belongs to the "Shatojinas Laboriosas" Community Bank and lives in the district of Shatoja, El Dorado province, department of San Martín. She is a married 45-year-old mother of four children, one of whom is still dependent on her. Mily is a women who feels like she can achieve her goals, which is why she and her husband decided to start up their own business selling timber. She started the business when she was very young, and it helped her grow as a woman and make headway for her children, who are now professionals. At the same time she is very grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for providing the support she needed to improve her business. Today, she continues her work and the business is very well received with many permanent and loyal customers. She also works with different companies. Mily is requesting a loan of 1000 soles, which she plans to invest in the purchase of timber such as ceder and other types of wood. Part of the money will also be used to purchase fuel to make and then sell sawdust. Mily is very satisfied and feels very fulfilled but she still has a strong desire to keep moving up in life and make her dreams a reality. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and also helping the many other women who want to grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase different types of wood

loans.name: Nidia María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Nidia A. con mucho entusiasmo se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de alimentos los que son preparados por ella misma en su localidad. Se ha destacado por ser una excelente cocinera que a todos les agrada la manera en que prepara los alimentos.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con la necesidad de ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes de la comida y por eso espera confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado satisfactoriamente para salir adelante.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Nidia A. tends her business of selling the food that she prepares. She stands out for being an excellent cook, and the way she prepares food pleases everyone. She comes to Ceprodel because she needs a loan to buy ingredients for the meals she makes. She hopes and trusts that her loan will be approved in order for her to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her meals

loans.name: Acela

texts.es:
La señora Acela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Shatojinas Laboriosas”, vive en el Caserío Ponciano, Distrito de Shatoja, Provincia San Martín Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 46 años, 05 hijos, tres de ellos que aun dependen de ella.

Nos cuenta que se inicio con la venta de abarrotes, ya son años que se dedica a este tipo de venta.
Estableció su negocio, ahorrando poco a poco, vendiendo sus productos que su cracrá le produce y con el apoyo del crédito de Manuela Ramos, tuvo mas en capital y se inicio con s/. 300.00 donde comenzó a comprar sus productos, para establecer su bodeguita.
Hoy sus vecinos y amigos ya le conocen y tiene mucha acogida, sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca, una de sus ventajas grandes que tiene; es que se encuentra ubicada cerca de un campito, y ahí es donde vende sus gaseosas heladitas.

Con el préstamo de S/.800.00, lo invertirá comprando abarrotes como: arroz y azúcar en sacos, paquetes de leches y aceites; también paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y tamaños e insumos para la limpieza del hogar e higiene personal. Así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazadas en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Acela belongs to the Shatojinas Laboriosas Community Bank. She lives in the Caserío Ponciano, Shatoja district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 46, and in a common law marriage. She has five children; three of them are still dependent upon her. She has been selling groceries for years. She started her business by saving little by little and selling products her farm produces. With the loan from Manuela Ramos, she had more capital; she started with 300 PEN. She bought products and set up her little store. Now her friends and neighbors know and welcome her, and the products sell themselves. One of the big advantages she has is that she is located near a small field, and that is where she sells her cold soft drinks. With a loan for 800 PEN she will buy groceries like rice, sacks of sugar, packages of milk and oil. She will also buy packages of different flavors and sizes of soft drinks, housecleaning supplies, and personal hygiene items. This way she can keep her customers satisfied and happy. She feels very satisfied with the work she does. She believes it is worth the sacrifice to accomplish the dreams and goals that she has outlined for her life. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for offering support to her and other women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to increase her product (rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Reyna se dedica desde hace 20 años a atender su negocio de venta de productos varios como lo son productos comestibles asi como jabones, productos de limpieza, entre otros.

Ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de los productos porque al habérsele agotado requiere comercializarlos y aunque su establecimiento no presta las condiciones necesarias, ella siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante en el negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna has had her business in Chinandega for twenty years. She sells various products like food, soap, and cleaning products, among others. She has asked Ceprodel for a loan to buy products to sell because she has sold old. Even though her establishment does not lend itself to good selling conditions, she always works hard to get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo en su negocio, la señora Juana N. se dedica a la venta de ropa en la ciudad de Chinandega siendo este negocio el que le permite mantener a su familia llevando el bienestar a esta.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una excelente comerciante y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel una vez más para ser beneficiada con un nuevo crédito para la compra de la ropa y así exhibirla y adquirir sus ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Putting great effort into her business, Juana Loyola sells clothes in the city of Chinandega. This business allows her to support her family and bring them well being. She has stood out as an excellent businesswoman. She has come, once again, to Ceprodel for a new loan to buy and display new clothes. This will give her income to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno.  Ella tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente y es madre de 04 hijos y uno por llegar, está embarazada.  Tiene estudios de educación superior (profesora) y vive en el Barrio Santa Bárbara.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal.  Inició su negocio gracias al primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles.  Eugenia se dedica a la compra y venta CDs (discos).

Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de flores, para ello requiere de un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra de flores, punteros, cordones, cintas, cola de rata, telas, etc.

Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio en una tienda grande y bien surtida.

A ella le gusta el trabajo solidario del Banco Comunal y sobre todo las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Eugenia belongs to the Niño Jesús de Praga Community Bank. It is located in the Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is 34 and in a common law marriage. She has four children and one on the way; she is pregnant. She has a college education (teacher), and she lives in the Santa Bárbara neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos since the foundation of her Community Bank. She started her business thanks to her first loan for 300 PEN. Eugenia buys and sells CDs (compact discs). She currently sells flowers, and for this she needs a loan for 3,000 PEN. She will use the loan to buy flowers, card holders, cords, ribbons, elastic, fabric, etc. Her biggest dream is to expand her business and make it into a big, well stocked store. She likes the Community Banks’ supportive work and, above all, she likes the training talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flowers, card holders, cords, ribbons, elastic, fabric

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II”, vive en Jr. Manco Inca Nº 529, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 27 años, 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado “El Huequito”, un puesto bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 
Las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico de su familia, ya que es una madre soltera, aprendió a seguir adelante. Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar porque ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,300.00, desea invertirlo comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Marleny, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y prepararse día a día a lo que la vida se le presenta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela R. por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Marlene belongs to the Las Estrellitas II Community Bank. She lives on Jr. Manco Inca Nº 529, Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 27, single, and she has two dependent children. Her effort and desire to help her children have motivated her to begin her own business selling groceries. It is located in the El Huequito market, and her stand is well equipped to wait on customers. The generated earnings help the family income. Since she is a single mother, she learned to get ahead. Since the business started, she has been winning customers. She currently has regular customers who shop at her stand daily. This is because she has all of the products that a housewife needs, and she personally waits on them with her characteristic charisma. With the loan for 1,300 PEN she will buy rice, sacks of sugar, packages of noodles, milk, boxes of different brands of canned fish, eggs, and personal hygiene products to continue to give better attention to her customers. Marleny feels the strength to keep working and to prepare, day by day, for what life brings. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela R. for helping women like her have opportunities to develop themselves in the environment where they flourish.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to increase her products (noodles, eggs, rice, sugar)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Estelbina Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Estelbina como toda mujer nicaraguense es muy esforzada y trabajadora la cual se dedica a su trabajo de elaboración y venta de alimentos preparados por ella misma en su localidad en la ciudad de Chinandega. 

Ella ha logrado mejorar en parte su condición pasando de vender solamente alimentos a vender bebidas y esto se lo ha debido a Ceprodel el cual le ha beneficiado grandemente. Hoy en día ha solicitado un nuevo crédito para continuar saliendo adelante y así beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estelbina, as all Nicaraguan women, is very energetic and hard working. She dedicates her time to the preparation and sale of food, which she makes herself at her residence in the city of Chinandega. She has been able to improve her conditions by going from selling only food to also selling beverages. This was made possible by Ceprodel, from which she has benefited a great deal. She is currently requesting a new loan to continue to move forward and benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food ingredients.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
La señora Eleuteria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús D. Praga”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chuchito, Departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 57 años D. edad, está casada y es madre D. 04 hijos todos ya independientes y profesionales.  Tiene estudios D. primaria incompleta (2do grado) y vive en el Barrio Huascar.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. la fundación del Banco Comunal,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, inició su negocio D. compra y venta D. verduras. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, comprará verduras, (zanahorias, apio, lechugas, cebollas, tomates zapallos, los mismos que los compra directamente D. Arequipa para luego venderlos en las ferias D. Yunguyo.

Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando y tener más ganancias.

A ella le gustan los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eleuteria belongs to the Community Bank "Niño Jesús D. Praga" (Child Jesus of Prague) located in the Yunguyo district, province of Chuchito, department of Puno. She is 57 years old, married and mother of 4 grown children, all independent and professionals. She has completed primary school through the 2nd graD., and lives in the Huascar neighborhood. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement since the inception of the Community Bank, with an initial loan of 300 new soles she started her business in the buying and selling of vegetables. She is currently needing a loan of 3000 new soles to invest in her business. She will purchase vegetables, (carrots, celery, lettuces, onions, tomatoes, squashes) which she buys directly from Arequipa and then sells them in the markets of Yunguyo. Her biggest dream is to continue working and have more income. She enjoys the meetings among the member of the Community Banks.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of carrots, celery, lettuces.onions, tomatoes squashes for resale.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Violetas II”, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Las Américas, Distrito de Nueva Cajamarca, Provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 43 años, 06 hijos, 4 mujeres y 2 varones, de los cuales aun 2 de ellos son estudiantes y viven con ella. 
El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de panes y dulces que los ofrecía inicialmente en una canasta ubicándose en una de las principales calles de la ciudad, poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y moradores de la comunidad, hoy cuenta con una carreta con vitrina en la que exhibe sus productos y tiene ya un lugar fijo para sus ventas en las afueras del mercado de abastos de la ciudad,  lugar muy concurrido por los moradores propios de la zona y de otros lugares aledaños
  
Con el préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 desea invertirlo comprando harina de trigo, azúcar en sacos, esencias en cajas, huevos en javas, aceite en docenas, productos que servirán para elaborar sus productos y ofrecer a su clientela con la misma calidad de siempre.   

Santos, anhela construir su casa propia y en ella instalar su negocio por ahora se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Santos belongs to the communal bank "Las Violetas II." She is a single parent of 6 children, 4 girls and 2 boys. Two are still young and they live with her and are in school. She has a fighting spirit and a strong desire to do better in life. This is why she started her own small business. She makes a living selling pastries. When she first started selling pastries she sold them out of a basket and she walked around the busiest streets of her city looking for people to sell to. Little by little she built a good reputation for herself and started selling more and more. She was able to buy a cart with glass windows that she could display her pastries behind. Now she sells from one fixed place that is located outside of a main marketplace. Santos is asking for a loan of $1,000 that she will invest in her business by buying wheat flour, sugar, eggs and more products that she will need to expand her pastries business and to give her customers the best products possible. She wishes to at some point build her own house and be able to provide much more for her children. She is thankful for the Manuela Ramos Movement because it has helped her to reach her dreams and goals.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her pastries such as flour, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Leonardo De La Concepción

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo M. actualmente tiene 20 años de dedicarse a su negocio de venta de productos ferreteros en la ciudad de Chinandega donde es visitado por muchos clientes en su establecimiento que ha logrado levantar.

Es de relevancia destacar que el señor Leonardo con mucho entusiasmo ha salido adelante pero hoy atraviesa la necesidad de invertir a lo inmediato en la compra de los productos ferreteros y es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de dichos productos y de esta manera lograr salir adelante en el negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
Mr. Leonardo Manguia has been working for the past 20 years in the business of selling tools and hardware products in the city of Chinandega, Nicaragua. His business is is visted by a lot of customers that have helped make his business grow. Leonardo is very enthusiastic about doing better in life but now he realizes that he needs to invest in purchasing more hardware products to sell. This is why he has come to Ceprodel for a loan to invest as soon as possible to get his business to the point that he wants it to be at. He plans to increase his sales and to expand his business. He is asking for a loan of $325 to buy more products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his hardware store.

loans.name: Belta

texts.es:
La señora Belta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II”, vive en el Jr. Ricardo Palma Nº 1270, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años, y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella (son su gran orgullo).

Belta, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado.  Se inició vendiendo cosméticos de diferentes líneas como Unique, Esika, Leonisa y Avon, negocio con el que continua. 
Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo una vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Belta, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Belta belongs to the communal bank “Las Estrellitas II” (The Little Stars II) She lives at 1270 Jr. Ricardo Palma Street located in the district of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martín and in the department de San Martín. She is married, is 39 years old and has two children that she provides for. They are the great pride of her life. Belta is a woman that has been able to overcome many difficulties in her life. She has a strong desire to make a better life for herself and her family. Today she has a business that she runs and she is very happy and proud of herself. She sells cosmetic products for different companies like Unique, Esika, Leonisa and Avon. With the loan of $350 she will invest in buying more beauty products to sell like perfumes for women, cologne for men, lotions, compacts, lipsticks, nail polishes and also a display window to put her products behind. Belta is a mature and responsible woman and she serves as an example for many women entrepreneurs. She shows that people can make their dreams come true by having perseverance.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics to increase her stock.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Nelly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Shatojinas Laboriosas”, vive en la Calle Comercio s/nº, Distrito Banda D. Shatoja, Provincia El Dorado, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, y tiene 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen D. ella.

Nelly, es una mujer joven, con ganas D. seguir adelante, se considera una mujer luchadora y eficiente.
Comenzó vendiendo sus anticuchos y juanes, como vio que le genera buenos ingresos, decidió abrirse mas en el campo D. venta D. alimentos, así que con su esfuerzo estableció su propio restaurant, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes; con ese carisma y alegría que tiene.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que es muy conocida y tiene buena acogida.

Con el préstamo D. S/ 500.00, lo invertirá comprando insumos para preparar sus alimentos  como: kilos D. arroz, azúcar y papas, racimos D. plátanos, pollos vivos en javas. Y algunas herramientas cocina, para remplazar a los antiguos.

Nelly, se siente una mujer tranquila y contenta con lo logrado, y desea asegurarse una vejez tranquila por lo que agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sueños y metas, así como a otras   mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Nelly is a young woman with a strong desire to make a better life for herself and her family. She is hardworking and efficient with her time. She started her business by selling typical Peruvian foods like "anticuchos" and "juanes". She was able to earn a good profit by selling these items and she decided to start selling more food items. With hard work and dedication she started her own restaurant that she runs out of her own house. It is nicely set-up and she is able to serve her clients well. She is a very charismatic and happy person and this helps her to attract and keep customers. Her business is doing very well and has a good reputation for being a nice place to eat at. With the loan of $175 she will invest in ingredients to prepare her foods, like large quantities of rice, sugar, potatoes, bananas and chicken. She will also invest in new tools for her kitchen so that she can replace the old ones.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare her foods, like large quantities of rice, sugar, potatoes, bananas and chicken.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Don Hugo tiene 51 años, vive con su esposa, quien es profesora, tienen 3 hijos que aun están estudiando y son su mayor motivación de salir adelante. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de productos naturales medicinales como; miel de abeja, jarabes o extractos de raíces de árboles, etc. según la enfermedad o dolencia. Adicionalmente, ejerce el oficio de cerrajero, construye puertas, ventanas y otras estructuras metálicas. Ambas actividades le gustan mucho, además le son rentables porque sus remedios vegetales son muy demandados y su trabajo como cerrajero, también es muy requerido debido a su buena labor y responsabilidad. Este es su 9no préstamo con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes hacen un trabajo bien coordinado y en unión. Con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales de cerrajería y algunas herramientas para su uso, tales como cierras, llaves de torno, etc. Asimismo incrementará la cantidad de productos naturales que vende.
texts.en:
Don Hugo is 51 years old and lives with his wife who is a teacher. They have 3 children that are in school and are their motivation to move forward in life. For the past 15 years he’s been making a living by selling natural medicines like bee honey, syrups, extracts from the roots of trees, etc. He dispenses the right type of natural medicine according to the illness or the symptoms of his clients. He also works as a locksmith and he constructs doors, windows and other metallic structures. He likes both activities very much; also they are very profitable because his vegetables remedies are in very demanded and his work as a locksmith is also wanted by many people because of his careful work and his responsibility. This is his 9th loan with MFP, and what he likes about his communal bank is that among all the members they do a very good job and they work well together. With the money from the loan he will buy materials for his work as a locksmith and some tools, such as saws and drills. Also the money will him to increase the quanity of natural products that he sells.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and buy materials for locksmith business.

loans.name: Telesila

texts.es:
La señora Telesila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Shatojinas Laboriosas”, vive en el Barrio San Juan, Distrito Shatoja, Provincia El Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años, 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de juanes, ubicada en un local muy bien acondicionado, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donde vende diariamente  por las noches. Tiene años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, desea invertirlo comprando, insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes (plato criollo), asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad y remplazar a los antiguos.

Telesila, se siente tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ms. Telesila F. is a member of the “Shatojinas Loboriosas” Microfinance Institute. She lives in the department of San Martín. She is a 38-year-old married mother of 3 children, 2 of whom still depend on her financially.

Her hardworking spirit and her desire to get ahead on her own, which she has always been known for, have helped her start her own business selling juanes (rice, chicken, olives and an egg wrapped in a plantain leaf and parboiled). Her business is located in a well-equipped space, where little by little she has been gaining popularity with customers. She says that her business is now very prosperous.

She still has this same business, which is open nightly. She has been working in this business for years, and she feels very satisfied with what she does.

She would like to invest this 1,000.00 PEN loan in purchasing ingredients such as sacks of rice, eggs, chickens for her juanes (a Creole dish), as well as cooking utensils so that she can offer high-quality service and replace her old tools. Telesila feels at ease and content with her work, and she gives thanks to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her realize her hopes and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, eggs, chickens, and cooking utensils

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
La señora Natividad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Shatojinas Laboriosas”, vive en el Barrio San Martin, Distrito de Shatoja, Provincia El Dorado. Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 01  hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Natividad, es una mujer alegre, perseverante y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas y nos comenta que le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene clientes que la conocen y saben de su negocio. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará  más mercadería de ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. 

Ella manifiesta que esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado y lo hizo con mucho entusiasmo y optimismo.

Dice: Agradezco la oportunidad que me da  Manuela Ramos  de  contar con los  préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Natividad belongs to the “Shatojinas Laboriosas” Communal Bank and lives in the San Martin neighborhood, Shatoja district in the province of El Dorado, which is in the San Martín department. She lives with her partner, is 33 years old and is the mother of one child who she still supports. Natividad is a happy, persevering and capable woman. She works selling used clothing and she tells us that it is going very well for her as she already has clients who know her and her business. She is characterized by her strength and perseverance, which have helped her to grow independently as a woman and she is very proud of what she has achieved. With this loan of S/. 1,500.00, she will buy more clothing merchandise to vary her stock such as: pants, shorts, blouses in all sizes and models, polo shirts and dresses for adults and girls. She reports that she is very proud of what she has accomplished and she did it with great enthusiasm and optimism. She says: I am thankful for the opportunity that Manuela Ramos gives me to count on the loans that help me to develop as a woman and a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase second hand clothing in quantity

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Candida Rosa M. se dedica a la venta de sandalias y zapatos en su propio negocio que atiende desde hace 35 largos años habiendo sido este el negocio que a ella le ha permitido desarrollarse y percibir los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.

Ella busca la manera de salir adelante y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las sandalias y los zapatos y así llenar sus estantes y ofrecer variedad al público para continuar percibiendo los ingresos para sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Ms. Candida M. sells shoes at her own business that she has attended to for 35 long years. This business has permitted her to grow and receive an income. She has found it necessary to expand, and has therefore turned to CEPRODEL to be a beneficiary of credit to purchase footwear to fill her shelves and offer a variety of footwear to the public, so she can continue making an income to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza es madre soltera, tiene 37 años y vive sola. Sus aspiraciones desde muy joven han sido desarrollarse en el arte textil, es por eso que ahora es una excelente costurera. Cuenta con dos máquinas de coser que le son de mucha utilidad para la realización de su trabajo diario, que es la confección de ropa, la cual una vez terminada la ofrece de casa en casa a sus clientes, vendiéndola al contado o al crédito. Maritza es muy solicitada debido a su buen trabajo, inclusive trabaja para varias instituciones educativas en la confección de uniformes y trajes especiales para los niños. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 15 años, y se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos económicos. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son responsables y tienen mucha comunicación. El dinero que solicita lo usará en la compra de telas, hilos, cierres, etc., materiales de costura indispensables para elaborar sus prendas.
texts.en:
Maritza is a single mother, is 37 years old and lives alone. From a young age her aspirations have been to develop herself in textile art and this is why she is now an excellent dressmaker. She has two sewing machines which are very useful for carrying out her daily work, the production of clothing, which when finished she offers to her clients house to house, selling it in cash or on credit. Maritza is in high demand due to her good work and she even works for various educational institutions in the production of uniforms and special outfits for the children. She has been doing this activity for the past 15 years and it has turned into her principal source of income. This is her second loan with MFP and what she likes about her communal bank is that all of the members are responsible and communicate with each other a lot. She will use the money that she is requesting to purchase fabrics, thread, zippers, etc., sewing materials that are indispensible to produce her garments.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Melita

texts.es: Melita tiene 39 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hija de 11 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro y gracias a su buena administración de las ganancias, ahora tiene dos motocarros, con el cual brinda trabajo como choferes a las personas que lo necesitan, además de fortalecer la economía de su hogar. Con las ganancias obtenidas de este negocio ha implementado un lavadero de autos y motocarros, donde también contrata a otras personas para la atención del mismo. Y sin quedarse atrás, Melita también invierte en otro negocio, que es la compra y venta de pescado, es abastecedora de los comerciantes de este producto del mercado de su localidad. Con estos tres negocios, Melita busca progresar y brindarle a su hija unos buenos estudios. Este es su 5to crédito con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos sus compañeros son comprensivos y están pendientes de las necesidades de los demás, como también son responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita hará mantenimiento a sus motocarros, comprará mangueras para su lavadero y pescado para seguir abasteciendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Melita is 39 years old, is a single mother and lives with her 11 year old daughter in their own house. For the past 10 years she has worked transporting passengers in her motor-cart and thanks to the good administration of her earnings she now has two motor-carts with which she provides work as drivers to people who need it in addition to strengthening the economy of her home. With the earnings obtained from this business she has implemented a car and motor-cart wash that she also hires other people to run. And to not be left behind, Melita also invests in another business, the purchase and sale of fish, and she is the supplier of the sellers of this product in her community's market. With these three businesses Melita seeks to advance and provide her daughter with a good education. This is her 5th loan with MFP and what she likes about her communal bank is that all of the members are understanding and are aware of the needs of the others as well as being responsible with their payments. With the money that she is requesting she will do maintenance to her motor-carts and she will buy hoses for her car wash and fish to continue supplying her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of her motor-carts and investment in other businesses

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 34 años, es madre de 3 hijos, vive con su pareja quien la apoya mucho en su trabajo. Desde hace 2 años tiene un negocio de venta de bebidas (cervezas y gaseosa) en un lugar que acondiciona en su propia casa para ello. Su vivienda está ubicada en una calle por donde transitan muchas personas, y debido al intenso calor de la región, las ventas son muy buenas. Silvia quiere surgir y salir adelante, por ello que se esfuerza para que su negocio se convierta en lugar conocido y de mucha concurrencia, además de tener una tienda grande donde venda productos comestibles y diversos artículos. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son muy comprensibles ante los problemas de los demás, pero al mismo tiempo fomentan la responsabilidad y puntualidad en el pago de las cuotas. El dinero que solicita será invertido en la construcción de un kiosco en la parte delantera de su casa para vender con mayor comodidad, asimismo comprará mayor cantidad de gaseosas y cervezas.
texts.en:
Silvia is 34 years old, is the mother of 3 children and lives with her partner who greatly supports her work. For the past two years, she has had a business of selling drinks (beer and soda) from her own home. Her home is located in a heavily trafficked street; and due to the intense heat in the region, the sales are very good.

Silvia wants to expand and move forward, and is therefore putting forth a lot of effort to turn her business into a well-known place with a lot of customers, as well as having a bigger store where she sells groceries and other goods.

This is her second loan with MFP, and what she likes about her communal bank is that all of the partners are very understanding of others’ problems, but at the same time encourage responsibility and punctuality with the repayment quota.

The money that she is requesting will be invested in the construction of a kiosk in front of her house in order to sell with greater convenience, as well as to buy greater quantities of sodas and beer.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk and purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine S. is from the town of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 32 years old. Catherine is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Catherine and her husband own & operate a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling grocery items, animal feed, rice and beverages in the local community. Catherine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Catherine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catherine is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Catherine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and educational needs for her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora L. is from the town of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 37 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Flora owns and operates a business selling “ukay-ukay” (slightly-used clothes) in the local market. Flora has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Flora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of family members. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Abelino

texts.es: Abelino G. G. vive en departamento de La Paz, Abelino tiene 47 años de edad, posee  un pequeño negocio  de helados , a pesar que sus ingresos por sus ventas son a diario pero esto no es suficiente para lograr un buen margen de ganancia; ya que semanalmente gasta en transporte por qué  tiene que surtir su inventario, Abelino solicita este crédito por que quiere comprar una mayor cantidad de productos y así aprovechar el día que tiene que viajar a comprar helados ya que si compra una mayor cantidad no tendrá que regresar a la semana de esta manera ahorrara en transporte y tendrá más beneficios económicos en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Abelino G. G. lives in La Paz. He is 47 years old and has a small ice cream business. Despite earning a daily income from his sales, he does not have a large profit margin because he has to spend money every week on transportation to keep his inventory stocked. Abelino is requesting this loan because he wants to purchase a larger quantity of products so he will be able to take advantage of when he has to travel to buy ice creams, since then he wouldn't have to return as often and can save on transportation costs. In this way he will benefit more economically from his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy larger quanity of products to reduce transportation expenses

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao R. is 32-year-old and a resident of the Phnom Penh, where she earns a living selling Khmer noodle to neighbors in the village. She always buys the ingredients on credit. She returns the money after she finishes selling.

She is married with four children; all of whom are teenagers and school-age. Her husband works as a construction foreman. Mao R. hopes to earn extra income as a merchandise trader. Due to the lack of capital, Mao R. requests a loan of $1000 from Kiva’s partner HKL.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Dy L. is 53-year-old and lives in Kompong Cham, Cambodia. She is married to Sorn Chean, 56, (pictured) and blessed with five children.

Since 1980, Dy L. and her husband have grown rice and vegetables on their farmland. Dy L. will use her loan to grow cabbage, morning glory, spring onions, etc. This will allow their family to attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: Grow cabbages, morning glory, and spring onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase peanut products.

loans.name: Delmi Jeannette

texts.es: Delmi Jeannette C. vive en el departamento de La Paz, vive con sus hijos Tatiana de 11 años y Josué de 9 años, el esposo de Delmi se encuentra fuera del país, ayudando a su familia mensualmente por medio de remesas. Delmi aprovecha la oportunidad de superación económica, montando una tienda en su casa, donde lleva ya 7 años de tenerla. Delmi solicita este crédito por que quiere surtir mas su negocio, el cual ha ido crecido por la gran ambición de Delmi hacia poder darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Delmi Jeannette C. lives in the Dept. of La Paz with her children, eleven-year-old Tatiana and nine-year-old Josué. Her husband is out of the country, helping his family with monthly remittance payments. Delmi is taking advantage of the opportunity for economic advancement by setting up a store in their house, which they have had for the last seven years. She is seeking this loan because she wants to stock up her business, which has been growing because of the great ambition she has of being able to improve things for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up her business.

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Khiev O., 53, (husband in photo) is a mother who cares for five children. Khiev and her husband work as farmers.

One of her daughters sells clothes. Khiev will use her loan to improve her daughter’s clothes business, to better meet customer’s demands.

loans.use: Support daughter’s clothes selling business,

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Chhin A., age 23, is a villager who lives in Kompong Cham Province. She has given birth to one child who is of school-age.

In 2000, Chhin A. inherited a one-hectare (2.5-acre) farmland from her grandparents. On the farm she grows different kinds of vegetables, which she will cut and sell two months after she plants them. To alleviate her hard physical labor, her husband assists her in the process.

Due to the fact that the water system is far from the farmland, Chhin A. is applying for a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation.

loans.use: To buy a pumping machine for irrigation

loans.name: So

texts.en: So O., 46, lives with her family in a small thatch house located in Kompong Cham province. At present, she and her husband make a living as farmers. They grow various crops--they are flexible depending on the growing conditions of the different seasons. This couple has six children. Most of them are rice hulling workers. So O. will be using her loan to rent the neighbor's farmland and buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia R. S. vive en San Martin ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, Ana vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo. Hace tres años Ana monto una pequeña tienda, la cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco; en esta oportunidad Ana solicita un crédito por que quiere comprar granos básicos para comercializar en su negocio ventas que le ayudaran aumentar sus ingresos. Ana ya ha manejado créditos anteriormente donde ha sido una cliente muy responsable en sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia R. Soriana lives in San Martin, located in the district of San Salvador. Ana lives with her two children and her husband. Three years ago, Ana started a small store, which has been growing little by little. In this occasion, Ana is requesting a loan to buy basic grains in order to increase her profits. Ana has already previously received a loan, and she was a very responsible client with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains

loans.name: Theam

texts.en:
Theam T. is 54 years old and a resident of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a widowed mother blessed with five children, two of whom are married. Two are employed. Her daughter is a hairdresser and her son is a mirror cutter. They provide a little income to meet their family’s living expense.

Theam plants vegetables on the land in front of her home, She grows cabbage and onions. Theam sells her crops every two moths, after she plants.
