To alleviate the hard physical labor, Theam asks for a loan to purchase two cows to plow the land. She will rent them to other farmers for addition income.

loans.use: Purchase two cows.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es: Timoteo S. M. vive en la capital de El Salvador, Timoteo vive en casa propia con su esposa y un hijo. A pesar de ser un hombre de 60 años de edad don Timoteo manifiesta que con perseverancia y esfuerzo se logra salir adelante, y es así como lo hace el, hace tres años Timoteo monto una tienda ubicada en su casa, negocio que al día de ahora es  la principal fuente de ingresos económicos a la familia. Timoteo solicita un crédito por que quiere invertir en su negocio surtiéndolo de productos que hasta el momento el carece, pero son demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Timoteo S. M. lives in the capital of El Salvador with his wife and a son. In spite of being a 60-year-old man, Timoteo shows that with perseverance and effort it is possible to get ahead. And that is how he does it. Three years ago he set up a store located in his house, and currently it's the principle source of income for his family. Timoteo is seeking a loan because he wants to invest in his business by stocking it up with products he currently lacks, but which are requested by his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up his business.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Ou M., 38, is a married man and father of four kids.  Presently, Ou is widely known for growing crops because he has done so for a long time.  It's a skill he learned from his grandparents. His wife is a homemaker who is responsible for housework, caring for the children and helping on the farm.  Ou will use the loan to buy a plot of land for a vegetable crop during the rainy season.

loans.use: Buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Rors

texts.en:
Rors C., 42, is a fantastic mother who earns money to make sure her four children attain an education.

She and her husband use a small pigpen that they built to raise pigs. They also generate other profits by fishing in the Tunle Sap River, which is full of fish. Rors will use the loan to purchase a piglet and poultry to breed, and for more fishing tools.

loans.use: Purchase piglet and poultry to breed.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora C. is from Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Flora makes and sells food. Her main source of income comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Flora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services, to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from HSPFI to repair her house. Flora is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the needs of the family and for additional house repairs.

--------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Choem

texts.en: Choem K. is 29 years old, married, and the mother of one child (a minor). Her husband’s name is Noun Touch, and he is 27 years old. This humble couple earns their daily income by fishing in Tunle Sap Lake. Beside this, they have worked as rice farmers. This fishing season, the river is full of fish. Unfortunately, the family has only insufficient fishing tools. Hence, Choem K. is requesting this loan on Kiva in order to buy nets, traps, and a boat to fish. Choem K.'s husband appears in the picture.

loans.use: To buy nets, traps, and a boat.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia T. is from the town of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old. Rosalia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While it is not her only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products. She also cooks food, such as longganisa (pork sausage), for sale to the local community. Rosalia has been engaged in her business for over 11 years, and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. This improves her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP through HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rosalia is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used for a down payment for the refrigerator for her longganisa business and additional revolving capital for variety store. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosalia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education, and to be able to finance the family's basic needs. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City, and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: down payment for the refrigerator for her longganisa business, and additional revolving capital for variety store

loans.name: Vat

texts.en: Vat V., 35, earns her daily income by selling a few wares, including pork, vegetables, and fish. She uses her old bicycle to sell this produce door-to-door in the village. Additionally, she and her husband cultivate rice and vegetable crops on their own farmland. The family's house is lacking some parts, since the family's financial problems have stopped them from completing its construction. Therefore, Vat V. has decided to seek a $700 loan to buy housing equipment to fill the lacking part of her house. She and her husband are in the picture.

loans.use: To buy housing equipment
